groups.C_DescriptionC: 排球社旨在在为世外学生提供每周一次的排球训练机会。除了基础和专项训练外，排球社会更注重排球技术的实践。排球社不仅会组织校内的，还会参加校际、区级、市级各个类别的排球赛。丰富的活动形式不仅可以帮助发展排球技术，也可以达到IB理念中的均衡发展，让同学们在课余时间还能够放松和锻炼。
groups.C_DescriptionE: The volleyball club aims to provide opportunity of training for students who like volleyball. Other than the basic and advanced training, the club values more on practice on the field. The volleyball club not only organizes matches in the school, but also participates championships in Shanghai. Such diverse activities can help to develop students’ skills in volleyball. Also, it provides a chance of attaining “Balanced” in IB Learners Profile by by providing a chance to improve physical strength.

grecord.C_Theme: An intense match with the MYP volleyball team
grecord.C_Reflection: To help the MYP volleyball team prepare for their upcoming matches, members of the volleyball club attended their training. We first practiced passing the ball between members, then we started formal 6V6, 15 points match. The matches were very intense, as in one round two teams bid the points to 21 to 19, which was clearly a tough win. Both teams are very focused, which is the correct attitude towards a formal match. We hope this match would help both the MYP volleyball team and our team to advance our volleyball skills and face intense competition calmly.

grecord.C_Theme: 排球社组织疫情期间训练
grecord.C_Reflection: When we are limited by quarantine, I activated all our members to practice at home, with personal skills, each week we practice 2 times for 2hours and we insisted for 5 weeks. 疫情隔离期间每周呼吁社员在家练习，组织线上训练，每周5与周日练习垫球和传球动作累计2小时，持续5周！Everyone got a big improve on basic skills but the tactics, and attacking ability are weaker actually.

It is one of the activities in this semester, thus all of the members has attended this activity. We directly started playing games after the warming up activity. We divided into two separate teams and play three games with different students in a group. Although we didn't count the exact score of the games, all of the students pay their maximum efforts in the game. I play the role of main attacker which scores some points in the games. To conclude, this activity in the volleyball club plays a great end to this semester's activity.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 每一个青春期的女孩，都或多或少会对于自己的身材感到烦恼、羞愧，同时又无比憧憬健美、苗条纤细的小腹、大腿。正是因为我们感同身受，所以才会有这个女生室内运动社的想法。我们最大的亮点——仅限女生。同样作为女生，我们不愿意在放学后全是男生们的操场上进行体育锻炼，同时羞涩于每一个同学、老师甚至是家长或是好奇、或是鼓励的目光。给女生一个私密空间，暂时放下所有礼仪、淑女的包袱，挥洒汗水，重塑身材吧！
groups.C_DescriptionE: Almost every girl is worry about her figure, longing slim and healthy lower abdomen and thighs. We actually feel the same, thus we are inspired to create a club for girls. What's special is, we only accept girls! As girls, we don't want to run or play ball games on the playground in front of boys who are good at sporting. Also, classmates', teachers' and parents’ attentions can give us pressure. Give girls a private space to let all the etiquettes and requirements go. Join us! Start to be lean and fit right now!We keep track on our diet and fat density. A monthly checkout is necessary. Additionally, it is definitely important to develop a personal table, noting down every little changes about muscle feeling, body condition, heart rate and also mood. Hopefully, you would see a confident and healthier you after 5 months.

grecord.C_Reflection: Today, we did some exercises after school. We first did warm-up, and then ran several rounds. We were all very tired after running because we haven't exercises for nearly half year. Then we walked around the playground and talked about ourselves happily. We also played badminton for a while. I thought I played very well, and also my clubmates played well too. We were all very happy after doing exercises and we also became friends. After the activity, we went to see other club's activity and enjoyed watching at them.

Today we also did some exercises to strenghthen our body. We first did some warm-up and then ran several rounds. After that we played badminton for a long time. I liked play badminton best. Not only because I can play it very well, but also because it can improve my health and also help me grow taller. We played happily together, although sometimes I failed to catch the ball, I still enjoyed playing with them. After doing exercises, we all felt very tired and went home in order to relax ourselves and do homeworks more efficiently.

Today, we did some exercises on the playground. We first walked around the playground twice and talked about our study happily. We shared our experiences on many subjects such as biology and Chinese. Sometimes we were all sad about the poor score and sometimes we were happy about the new methods that we found recently. We talked really happy while walking. Although today we just walk for exercise, we still feel very relax and no longer have any stress on study.

Today we did exercise on the playground. Because of the decay of the conclusion, I went to the playground later than before. My friends have waited for me for a long time and I was very touched. Then we started to do exercise. We considered for a while and then decided to play badminton. We first lent some equipment to play the badminton. Then we happily played the badminton. Finally, we were all very tired and felt comfortable. We said goodbye to everyone and went home alone.

2019-03-01
Zhengduoyan is a woman comes from Korea and she is in her fifties now. She used to be extremely fat and in order to lose weight, she tries her best to exercise. During the process of doing exercise, she created many body building exercises belong to her. She was so determined that with the help of these exercise, she lost finally 21kg. Because of her success, her body building exercise became very popular. Today we find one of the videos of her body building exercise and follow it to exercise.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 世外啦啦队由一群活力、团结、乐观、开朗的学生们自发组织建立。我们希望通过啦啦队推广啦啦操这项特殊的与艺术结合的运动，让更多人了解与感受到青春的蓬勃与朝气；让喜欢啦啦操的同学们能够通过这个平台一同感受最灿烂美好的校园生活；我们更拥有乐于奉献和不断拼搏的体育精神，让参加比赛的同学不再孤军奋战。我们希望有更多的同学们加入带我们的队伍，共同代表世外爱心、大气、优雅的形象！
groups.C_DescriptionE: WFLMS CHARM, the cheerleading squad of WFLMS, is filled with a group of vigorous, cooperative and jolly students. We organize the team,choreographand find background musics all by ourselves. By running WFLMS CHARM, we hope to spread the altruistic, energetic and young spirit of cheerleading as well as to cheer up the athletics during the competition. We’re fearless cause we have each other’s care, we’re strong cause we never give up. And we hope and welcome everyone who is willing to shine during the best time of his/her life to join us, together we will make our school life unforgettable, courageous and full of fun!

grecord.C_Reflection: This semester, the school held the annual club exhibition under the canopy on the playground. In my original plan for the club, we were going to give the performance at the club exhibition. And before that, I was noted by some stuff of the Student Union, who told me that there was going to be the American Culture Week, just before the club exhibition. Then, I decided to performance on the American Culture Week but not the club exhibition because we did not have enough time to prepare for two performance.

Over all, we had three club meetings. Looking through this entire semester, the club members have all been through a lot together, from changing the advisor, a different leader of the club, and many unusual events and activities that are different from those of last year, etc. But we all have thrive together to get through this tough term. Our last advisor is a very strict one but professional. From my own perspective, the WFLA CHARM needs that kind of advisor a lot. Here, we hope that she will return next semester.

For this semester, unfortunately, there is no sport festival. And also, there is only one culture week in the entire term. That is the American Culture Week. We, as the WFLA CHARM, seek the opportunity to preform in front of both the DP department and the MYP department. It is such a great chance to enhance the popularity of our club in order to let more students and teachers know about our club and what we are actually achieving through weekly training.

On the day of the performance during the American Culture Week, the weather is good. And we prepared a series of dances—four in all—for the culture week. The first dance is ‘Never be Like You’, with me dancing alone. The second is ‘Worth it’ with five team members dancing. The third one is the traditional cheerleading dance, along with the music—‘Shawty Got Moves’. The last dance belongs to the pop genre. Two team members gave out the performance—‘Hood go Crazy’. The performance is successful.

We have some sessions occupied by the student union without inform earlier. And this the last club session of this semester. I required all the members to attend this session in order to not only review all the movements taught this term, but also announce some notifications. Although this semester is definitely not the best one, but I still believe that I can manage this club better next semester. After all, in my opinion, there is no semester that can be worse than this one.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 篮球社是以篮球为主题的运动社团，旨在提升世外师生的整体篮球水平和身体素质。篮球社提供每周一至两次的训练，让爱好篮球的同学磨练自己的技术、增强团队意识，同时成为一个好的领导者和一个合格的团队协作者。我们还会在篮球社中选拔出精英成员进入学校篮球队，参与各类区、市级比赛，为学校争取荣誉。在学校内会不定期举办校园篮球赛来增进班级团结、班级之前的和睦，让更多的人爱上篮球运动。
groups.C_DescriptionE: The aim of the basketball club is to improve health condition of students who like to play basketballs. The club offers two or more trainings a week in order to let club members have enough time for honing skills, for developing team spirit, and for trying to be good leaders and collaborators. Otherwise, the school team will participate in most of the competitions, and no matter the game will be held by schools, by districts or by the city, they will fight for the honor. During school days, we will also have daily basketball competitions; either for enhancing the group spirit of classes, or for attracting more students to join in the basketball club.

grecord.C_Theme: 2022 Basketball Class Preparation, Planning and Recruitment
grecord.C_Reflection: As the vice president of the basketball club, I made a plan to prepare for the start of the new year's basketball tournament. As the vice president of the basketball club, the main tasks were to make additions to the basketball rules, to reform the game system, and to train the new class of referees. Since this year's basketball tournament was held relatively late, the schedule was very tight, and all of us had to work together to do it.

Today, the main focus of the training is leg strength. This is important to the basketball game because we need to jump and sprint on every play. We did an activity that one person trying to pull the other person from running through the half court, and then both sprint through the other half of the court. This is a challenge for all of us since  we need to do it for multiple times and our legs start to fatigue, but it definitely helps us gain the strength we need to play in a high-tempo pace.

We did an activity that one person trying to pull the other person from running through the half court, and then both sprint through the other half of the court. This is a challenge for all of us since  we need to do it for multiple times and our legs start to fatigue, but it definitely helps us gain the strength we need to play in a high-tempo pace.

This is a challenge for all of us since  we need to do it for multiple times and our legs start to fatigue, but it definitely helps us gain the strength we need to play in a high-tempo pace.

groups.C_DescriptionC:
本届网球社主要两个创办目的：
1. 让更多的世外同学接触网球，通过一些基础训练和专项训练帮助同学们培养更多兴趣爱好，也让同学们在忙碌的高中生活中抽出时间强身健体。
2. 为有一定网球基础的同学创立校内平台；网球爱好者们可以通过网球社交流经验，在实战对打，各项比赛中互相提升网球水平。由此，网球社希望在本校建立良好的网球体育氛围，使同学们可以达到IB理念中的均衡发展，在课余时间还能够放松和锻炼。
groups.C_DescriptionE:
The Tennis Club was founded for two main purposes:
1. Let more non-Chinese students contact tennis, help students develop more interests and hobbies through some basic and special training, and also let students find time to build up their physical fitness in the busy high school life.
2. Establish a school platform for students with certain tennis foundation; Tennis fans can exchange experience through the tennis club, and improve each other's tennis level in the actual combat. Therefore, the Tennis Club hopes to establish a good atmosphere for tennis sports in our school, so that students can achieve the balanced development of IB philosophy, and also relax and exercise in their spare time.

grecord.C_Reflection: Practice controlling the ball by running on the field. Improve your ball-handling skills with precision and agility. This exercise focuses on refining your ability to maneuver and control the ball while in motion on the playing field. Through dedicated practice, enhance your coordination and mastery of the ball, essential elements for success in various sports. Whether soccer, basketball, or other dynamic sports, this training on the runway lays the foundation for adept ball control, contributing to overall performance and confidence in the game.

In this activity, students went to a professional tennis field to practice. We went to a tennis club. To start with, we initially palyed tennis gently to warm up. After playing gently for about half of an hour, we started to play against each other to gain a more practical experience in dealing with balls with different trajectories. Later, we also introduced some skills to cut the ball in front of the net and some specific techniques to serve balls with some threats to gain some points in the real competition.

Today’s main goal was to practice our volleys in our tennis training today. Warm up was stretching and jogging two rounds of two courts. Coach taught us to as much as possible hit the ball as far back as possible, as this will make the opponent be on defense. Whereas if you drop the ball near the net, your opponent will have the chance to hit back strongly as staying up front is the attacking section. Halfway in the lesson, we started practicing our volleys in pairs and this was quite challenging for me, as it is quite difficult to return a shot when the person volleying drops it at the net and I’m standing at the back of the court. We continued practicing and then played a doubles game in a ‘tie-breaker’ game. We lost track of time and went over training time by the end of our game.My goal for next week is to try running up front and playing the volleys when we play doubles again next time to practice my volleys under pressure.

The aim of these five trainings is to enhance and develop basic strokes by five steps to generating crazy power on your tennis forehand. In this training, we need to accomplish the step one by modify and solidify our forehead technique. Methods: Racket head speed. If you do everything correctly with your technique, but your racket travels through the contact point slowly on your forehand, you’ll always struggle to create the kind of power that you really want on your tennis forehand. Forehand technique is very important, but too often players forget the fact that good forehand technique should help you achieve more racket head speed.

Here’s what we worked on in our tennis training today: -Footwork: quick movements to be able to hit balls near or far from us and not get “off balanced” -Service: try to make first serves go in using upper arm strength; ensure all second serves go in -Playing ‘King of the Court’: take turns hitting with the ‘king’ and win 2 points in a row to become next king- to make sure ball stays in court and we prolong the game; to play game under pressure

groups.C_DescriptionC: 骑行社是一个集运动与技术一体的社团，我们立足于“读万卷书，行万里路”，倡导“融入自然，深入社会，挑战自我，体现别样人生”社团主旨。我们用骑行的方式，用自己亲生的社会实践经历去接触，了解，融入自然，社会和人生。在共同一个梦想---“行万里路”的基础上，世外骑行社将展开中短途自行车骑行，参观游览等多种社会实践活动，磨砺我们的意志，是我们融入自然和社会，增强团队合作精神，提高自理，自立的能力，让我们勇于追求理想，积极对待人生的态度，我们将以自己的脚步向着我们的梦想前进。
groups.C_DescriptionE: Cycling club is a combination of sports and technology. Our motto is “Read thousands of books, and travel thousands miles of roads”, and we propose to get into the nature, blend in the society and challenge oneself to live a different life. By cycling, we will meet many different people, experience many unexpected things. We will acquire the knowledge of society and nature. Based on the same goal ------ “travel thousands miles of roads”, WFLMS Cycling Club will organize several social practice activities such as short-distance cycling and monument visiting. Through cycling, we strengthen our willpower, or the volitional quality, either which is the ability to make us blend in nature and society. During cycling, the spirit of team cooperation helps our students develop a sense of self-independence and self-management. We are brave to pursue our goal. We have a positive attitude of our future, and we will follow our idea with our own steps.

grecord.C_Reflection: During the national holidays, I along with three other cycling club members cycled from WFLA in Puxi to Qiantan Leisure Park in Pudong. It was a fairly exhausting and long ride, but it was also quite a satisfying and enjoyable one, and it took us over 5 and a half hours to complete. I started from my home at 7:30 and gathered the other members at the school gate. We rode for 1 hour, took the ferry, and began to cycle around the leisure park. The trip took longer than expected, but we cycled almost one complete trip around the park, which was enormous. We parted for our home individually once we arrived again in Puxi. I arrived home at one in the afternoon.

All the members of the cycling club gathered together and attend the first meeting about the "Cycsafety" video plan. We decided that the script would be decided before 11.6. The main theme is about the safety issues in the cycling process, such as not riding against the direction of the flow, not riding too close to the road edge, etc. We also decided the division of work. Each of the club leader will lead a group of people with jobs like Photographing, Acting, etc.

This time, we discussed about the future of cycling club and elected the leader for next semester. Every one of us discussed about what we want to do and what have we done. At last, everyone vote and after some discussion, the next leader was elected. This reminds me of the time when I am competing with others to become the leader. I had some dreams about cycling club, and some came true. I believe the next leader also has dreams and will lead us to the next peak.

We are acting to help the students in Tibet to study English. Today we rode bicycle to raise money for the kids. At first, we released it on some official accounts and also raised money for the word card. We raised seven hundred yuan in total, and it can cover most of the cost of making the word card for them. Then, we rode seventy kilometers in order to do what we promised, and actually, everyone enjoyed it, because it is for the social welfare.

On 5.6, the cycling club held the first meeting today, and I am so exciting. I know that a lot of interesting activities are going to emerge this semester. We held the meeting in section C floor two, opposite to the restroom. The club leader mainly talks about the plan for this semester. He said that in this new semester, we are going to have routine week ride, that is to go riding every weekend, just for exercise. This can increase the number of activities we have in one semester and activate our club members.

groups.C_DescriptionC:
世外足球社立旨于培养大家对足球的兴趣，给热爱足球的人提供一个提升并展现自我的平台。

我们拥有丰富的训练与比赛：除了每周一次的校内训练外，在双休日还会在校外举行友谊赛，假期里还会参加杯赛与其他校队或俱乐部一决高下；其次，我们还拥有给力的队友：世外足球社可是人才辈出，在各项赛事斩获佳绩，加入我们，一起共创辉煌；此外，我们还提供丰富的 CAS 时间：训练和比赛可以给予取之不尽的 A 时间，帮助球队摄影还能提供一定的 S 时间，写推文、分享知识、访谈球员还可以给予 C 时间；另外，我们还拥有女足，如果你觉得中国女足嘎嘎牛，足球球星嘎嘎帅气，喜欢熬夜嘎嘎看球赛，你还在等什么？只要有脚有手，即使零基础也无妨，欢迎各位女神们来玩！

总而言之，只要你热爱足球，无论你踢得好不好，我们都欢迎你的到来！
groups.C_DescriptionE:
Football club aims to cultivate everyone's interest in football, and provide a platform for those who love football to improve and show themselves.

We have rich training and competitions: besides weekly school training, we will also hold friendly matches outside the school on weekends, and participate in football cups to compete with other school teams or clubs during holidays; Secondly, we have good teammates: our club has a large number of talents, who have achieved good results in various competitions. Join us and create brilliance together; Thirdly, we also provide rich CAS time: inexhaustible a-time can be given for training and competitions; certain s-time can be provided for shooting the team; c-time can be given for writing tweets, sharing knowledge, and interviewing players; Fourthly, we also have women's football team. If you think Chinese women's football team is super good, football star is super handsome, and likes to stay up all night watching football matches, what are you waiting for? As long as you have feet and hands, even if there is no foundation, you are welcome to play!

In short, as long as you love football, no matter how well you play, we will all welcome you!

grecord.C_Reflection: On June 4, WFLA played a match against Pinghe, which was the first round of the semi-final. Since my right foot was injured, I could not play the match. However, I still came so as to shoot the whole game. About 20 members of our football club came to play against Pinghe. Unluckily, due to the inadaptation of Pinghe football field, which was much smaller compared to the normal one, our team eventually lost the game badly, 1-6 beaten by Pinghe. We were so disappointed when the game finished. I hoped that in the next round, we could create a miracle.

On June 1, Thursday afternoon, all sports clubs in WFLA held a exhibition activity on the playground. Most of the clubs exhibited under the canopy, while my football club held the activity on one of the basketball fields. As the president of my football club, I separated the members who participated into three groups, so as to make them play quick games. Since I still have had an injury in my right foot, so I was unable to participate in the game. However, it was still fun to watch and shoot the members playing football.

On March 10, 2023, Friday, I held a soccer game after school at Guagua stadium. The players in the game were either my teammates or my soccer friends, including CZF, DHX, CZT, XW, WZ, WZY and HY. Since there were only 8 people, we invited two adults to play with us. The game was full of joy and I scored many goals. After playing for about one and a half hours, HY, XW and the adults had left, so we decided to play penalty. In the first round of penalty, CZF won the game. In the second round, I won the game by scoring twice. In the final round, I was the goalkeeper and save about 20 penalty in total, really amazing. Eventually, we ended the game at 8 o'clock, going back home.

On Wednesday, March 9, 2022, as the manager of the football club, I held an activity at school after class. By separating people into 4 groups, we played 4 vs 4 short matches against each other. Each match ended when a goal was scored or 5 minutes had passed. My team consisted of students all from my grade, who were respectively Daniel, Sky and Pedérrrr. Our team won 4 games in total, Pedérrrr scored twice, while Daniel and I scored once. The game was quite exhausting. After the activity finished, I was really tired. However, I am still looking forward to the next activity.

From the beginning of this semester, we started a new rule to have daily football exercise after one-day class, which is on top of our football match with other school teams happened once per week. We all know WLFA's football club is very strong among all the football teams in International high school, but the purpose to join this team is not only to win others, we actually want to gather all students who have interest & enthusiasm on football, who want to play together with other tennages sharing common interest, and the most important thing is we can do exercise and benefit to our body & health. 
Till now, it should be more than 30 hours recorded in this semester for this daily activity, although sometimes due to Covid 19 situation, we have to shift to on-line class and hold the Football Club activity via conference call.  Hope all club members love the exercise everyday and benefit from that!

groups.C_DescriptionC: 乒乓社以宣扬中国传统文化为核心，通过乒乓这一种大众化运动方式，提供学生们强身健体的机会。我们进行基本功训练，包括旋球、削球、搓球和抽球。社员互相学习交流打球经验，进行模拟对练，在实战中进一步提升水准；体能训练，包含折返跑、小步跳跃等，提升心理素质；定期举行社内单打，双打比赛。期待你的加入！
groups.C_DescriptionE: The core of P.P. Club  is to promote traditional Chinese culture. Through the popular sport of table tennis, it provides students with opportunities to strengthen their bodies. We have basic skills training, including spin, slice, rub and draw. Members learn from each other and exchange playing experience, carry out simulation practice, and further improve the level in the actual combat; Physical training, including folding run, small jump, etc., to improve psychological quality; Regular in-club singles and doubles matches. Welcome！

groups.C_DescriptionC: 随园跑社自创设以来就以帮助学生养成运动习惯，舒缓学业压力，增强体质为目标，每周定期举行慢跑活动。社团不定期举办城市越野等活动，将体育运动不止局限于放学后的慢跑。社团氛围轻松愉悦，社团成员们在一起相聚十分融洽。
groups.C_DescriptionE: WFLA Running Club aims at help student develop the habit of exercise, release study pressure, and improve the immunity. Every week, we run after school. We also have city hiking and other activites as well. Our club is relaxing. Club members get along with each other very well.

grecord.C_Reflection: This happened on 10/2.Jogging, for me, is more than just a physical activity; it's a holistic experience that touches my mind, body, and soul. Each step on the pavement feels like a beat, syncing me with the rhythm of life. The rhythmic thud of my shoes against the ground becomes a meditation, quieting the chaos within. It's a journey where my breath mingles with nature's whispers, reminding me of my place in the vast universe. Jogging teaches me resilience; every uphill climb mirrors life's challenges, urging me to persist. The wind against my face, the steady thump of my heart, and the world passing by in a blur - jogging is my moving meditation, a path to self-discovery and enduring peace.

This happened on 10/2. 
Jogging, for me, transcends mere physical activity; it's a meditative rhythm that connects my body and mind. Each step resonates with a heartbeat, grounding me in the present moment. As my breath synchronizes with my strides, I find clarity amid life's chaos. Jogging isn't just about fitness; it's a personal odyssey. It teaches discipline, resilience, and the beauty of progress. In the rhythm of my footfalls, I discover strength, both mental and physical. Jogging isn't just a workout; it's my sanctuary, where I find peace, balance, and the freedom to be wholly and unapologetically myself.

Jogging at school has been an enriching experience that extended far beyond physical fitness. The rhythmic pounding of shoes against the track became a metaphor for perseverance and determination. It was not just a routine; it was a daily lesson in discipline and self-care. Jogging, amidst the academic pressures, provided a therapeutic escape. It cleared my mind, invigorated my body, and instilled a sense of accomplishment. Moreover, it fostered friendships, turning classmates into running companions. In those laps, I discovered resilience, camaraderie, and the profound impact of a healthy lifestyle on overall well-being.

This happened on 10/15. Assisting in blind running activities has been a profoundly humbling experience, illuminating the resilience of the human spirit. Guiding visually impaired runners, I learned the importance of trust and communication. Every step, every word became a connection, fostering not just physical but emotional support. Witnessing their determination, I was inspired by their courage to embrace challenges. In their darkness, I found light – a reminder that barriers, even blindness, can be overcome with teamwork and empathy. This experience taught me that with understanding and guidance, one can navigate any obstacle, making a difference not just in running but in life's race as well.

This is the first formal regular club activity of the WFLA Running Club for the first semester of the 2023 academic year. I am very happy to see several new members at the event. At the first event, I introduced the activities of our club, explained the club's philosophy, and encouraged everyone to participate in regular activities and weekend side events. After the introduction, we played a small ice-breaking game. Although it's not long, it's enough for us to get to know each other better. I hope that the club activities this semester can be carried out smoothly.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 在世外学生走向世界之前，让我们的学生更加了解我们自己的文化，同时爱上我们的武术文化，并且相映地习得一些武术的技能。以及在跆拳道，散打盛行的今天，通过传统武术这门冷门艺术带给学生并不亚于其他武术门类的反应力和身体协调力。同时通过我们的公众号让更多人和学生了解我们华夏文明自身产出的功夫。我们希望让同学们能够在了解世界前，首先更加了解我们自己。另外，我们结合了西方健身文化的元素，每周武术与健身的交替活动让同学们从中西两种文化中能够得到熏陶以及身体素质的提升。

grecord.C_Reflection: The date was 11.25. This Monday, I decided to teach the students in the club karate. I have learned karate since the beginning of the summer holiday of ninth grade. The punches are similar to the ones in the martial art. There are straight punches and hooks. For legs, there are front kicks, forward kicks, side kicks, and back kicks. These are not easy to learn, it depends on the body balance and the proficiency of the action, otherwise, you might lose balance and trip to the ground.

The date was 11.4. On this Monday after school, we went to the school's physical training room, I lead the students to do some exercises to train our physical agility. The training include dead bug(which looks like a bug struggling to death), push-ups, plank, bird dog(focus on the balance and harmony of our body. It was a very tiring process, but through this training on body agility, we all enhanced our strength and it helped us go further on the way of traditional martial art.

The date was 10.21. Under my leading, the students learned some of the traditional Chinese martial arts. We learnt the simplest routine. There are simply punches and kicking, but the strength it contains is enormous. Through the teaching, I understood the beauty of traditional martial art and also worked out myself. It was a very tiring activity, but I enjoyed myself a lot through teaching to do traditional martial art as well as protecting myself. And I was glad I can

The actual date was 11.4.This time we learned about kick, hit, fall, and take. Strike, stab and other martial arts actions are the main content, and the ability to attack and defend fighting is demonstrated by the physical movement of the hand or the instrument. Most of the kick methods involves jumping, which also require the core power of the body. In this time’s practice, we first learned about how to jump in Chinese Kungfu’s way. I think that we all learnt very well. For the rest part of this activity, we reviewed the basic Wushu routine.

The actual date was 11.4. As the new leader of the club, i told my members about the origin of the martial art.The origin of martial arts can be traced back to the primitive society. At that time, humans began to fight with the wild beasts with original tools such as sticks! First, in order to defend themselves, one was to hunt for living materials. Later, in order to compete for wealth, people created more lethal weapons. For example, in the "Shan Hai Jing Great Wilderness North", there is a record of "Wu You are a soldier in the Yellow Emperor". such! Through fighting, human beings not only created weapons, but also gradually accumulated skills with certain offensive and defensive meanings. Martial arts belong to traditional Chinese techniques. It is to kick, hit, fall, and take. Strike, stab and other martial arts actions are the main content, and the ability to attack and defend fighting is demonstrated by the physical movement of the hand or the instrument. Whether it is a confrontational capture movement or a routine of generations, the traditional Chinese techniques are the core of technology. As far as human social life is concerned, martial arts cannot be unique to China. Compared with martial arts around the world, martial arts is not only rich in martial arts methods, but also contains rich cultural connotations and health effects that other martial arts do not have.

groups.C_DescriptionC:
弈语棋斋原名围棋社，由2017级学长何一多、薛訾丰创建，为现围棋部。象棋部由颜稚轩同学创建于2019年。
本社旨在为同学们提供棋类学习的机会，为棋类爱好者们提供比赛以及切磋棋艺的平台，提高棋艺。
日常活动有对弈、复盘、做题等。若参加人数足够，会代表学校外出比赛。
获得团体奖项：第一届上海名校围棋联赛 冠军

活动时间：
围棋部：每周五16:00~18:00
象棋部：每周五16:00~17:30
groups.C_DescriptionE:
Go & Chinese Chess  club（former name: Go club） was founded by He Yiduo and Xue Zifeng, students of Class 2020.  Department of Chinese Chess was founded by Jenny Yan in 2019. 
 
The club aims to provide opportunities for students to learn chess, and provide a platform for chess lovers to compete and learn chess skills, so as to improve their chess skills.

The daily activities include playing chess, playing games, making questions and so on. If there are enough participants, they will go out on behalf of the school.

Time: 
Go Department: 16:00 ~ 18:00 on Fridays
Chinese Chess Department: 16:00 ~ 17:30 on Fridays

grecord.C_Reflection:
(regular activity) The actual date is 6.04.
Today is the ninth club activity in this semester. We continued our routine study of Chinese chess openings and puzzle training. First, we again, did 10 puzzles and analyzed them one by one. Then, we learned another new sub-opening of the screen horse defense. Using this new opening, the members played some training games. Analysis of the games were also carried out by me and another adept club member. I can see from their games that all of them are still improving. The atmosphere was still very enjoyable.

regular activity) The actual date is 5.21.
Today is the eighth club activity in this semester. We came back to our routine study of Chinese chess openings and puzzle training. First, we again, did 10 puzzles and analyzed them one by one. These 10 puzzles are less difficult than the 6 ones we did last time, but are more challenging than the 10 we did in the first time. The time taken to finish these 10 puzzles shortened, which proves that the club members all improved. Then, we learned another new sub-opening of the screen horse defense. Using this new opening, the members played some training games. Analysis of the games were also carried out by me and another adept club member.

(brainstorming) The actual date is 5.14.
Today is the seventh club activity in this semester. After the routinely practiced 10 puzzles, we continued discussing the school tournament. Everyone gives out their own ideas, and the discussion is full of sparks and inspirations. Finally, referring to my and Julene’s experience of participating in hundreds of tournaments in the past ten years, and attributing to the other member’s great inspirations, we finally designed a tournament that is different from all the past games we’ve seen, but is entertaining and challenging enough

(brainstorming) The actual date is 5.07.
Today is the sixth club activity in this semester. We still practiced some puzzles at the beginning of the activity, taking us about three quarters to solve and analyze. Then, in the rest of the time, we kept on discussing the affairs related to the school tournament. This time, based on the first simple version we achieved last week, we added more details to the plan. We confirmed the time to a weekend, and derived the pattern of the game: regular and challenging

(brainstorming) The actual date is 4.30.
Today, we didn’t conduct the same activities as we used to. We first carried out the conventional puzzle training - it had to be admitted that endgames are extremely important in Chinese chess, and solving puzzles strengthens the endgame ability very
        
     effectively. Then, me and Julene broached an idea of holding a school Chinese chess game. The others were excited when hearing this idea, feeling it very interesting and meaningful. All the members discussed this idea in class, and we created a first version of the competition.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 世外中学羽毛球社团（轻羽飞扬）致力于为在校喜爱羽毛球的同学提供良好的运动环境，从而让每一个喜爱羽毛球的同学有条件更好地参与到这项运动中来，强身健体的同时收获乐趣。同时，我们也提供专业的校队训练，有意愿的同学能在羽毛球社提高自己的羽毛球水平，我们也会组织社团内部的羽毛球赛，以及参加校外区级的羽毛球比赛。
groups.C_DescriptionE: WFLA Badminton Club aims to provide more professional court and equipment for all students who are interested in badminton, and to help them have fun as well as keep fit while playing badminton. Also, we provide professional training, helping students improving their badminton skill. We also organize badminton match in our club, and take part in the badminton matches outside school.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 世外飞镖社旨在培养同学们对于飞镖的兴趣，从而愿意接受、挑战新事物，开拓自己的眼界；飞镖运动讲究礼仪，在社团活动中，同学们有机会提高个人素养，培养社交礼仪；飞镖运动有助于缓解同学们学习时的身体疲劳以及精神紧张，是放松心情、释放压力的不错选择；飞镖运动强调技术和意志力，同学们在活动过程中将提升排除外界干扰的能力，培养抗干扰能力和心理耐受力。
groups.C_DescriptionE: WFLA Darts Club aims to develop students' interest in darts, so that they are willing to accept and challenge new things, and to develop their own horizons; darts is a sport that emphasizes etiquette, and in the club activities, students have the opportunity to improve their personal qualities and develop social etiquette; darts helps to relieve students' physical fatigue and mental tension when studying, and is a good choice for relaxation and stress release; darts emphasizes skills and In the course of this activity, students will improve their ability to eliminate outside interference, and develop the ability to resist interference and mental endurance.

grecord.C_Reflection: The club organized an exhibition match featuring skilled players from within the club. This event provided an opportunity for members to observe high-level gameplay and gain insights into advanced strategies and tactics. The match was followed by a post-game analysis, where participants discussed key moves and strategic decisions, further enhancing their understanding of advanced Go play. The exhibition match not only showcased the talent within the club but also inspired members to elevate their own gameplay, fostering a spirit of continuous improvement and dedication to the game of Go.

Members engaged in an in-depth discussion on advanced tactics and strategic approaches in Go. The session involved analyzing complex game scenarios and exploring various strategic options. Participants actively shared their insights and experiences, contributing to a vibrant exchange of ideas. The discussion not only deepened members' understanding of advanced Go tactics but also fostered a collaborative learning environment, enabling them to refine their strategic thinking and decision-making skills.The discussion not only deepened members' understanding of advanced Go tactics but also fostered a collaborative learning environment, enabling them to refine their strategic thinking and decision-making skills.

End-of-Month Review and Social
The club held an end-of-month review session, summarizing the month's activities, progress, and achievements. This was followed by a social gathering, allowing members to relax and interact in a casual setting, strengthening bonds within the club. The review and social gathering provided an opportunity for members to reflect on their progress, celebrate achievements, and foster a sense of community within the club. It was a fitting conclusion to a month filled with learning, growth, and camaraderie, setting the stage for continued enthusiasm and engagement in the game of Go.

The club organized a mini-tournament, providing members with the opportunity to test their skills in a competitive yet friendly environment. The tournament included multiple rounds, with participants showcasing their strategic prowess and adaptability in various game situations. The mini-tournament not only provided an avenue for friendly competition but also allowed members to apply their skills in a more formal setting, gaining valuable experience and insight into their gameplay. The event was a culmination of the members' efforts, fostering a sense of camaraderie and achievement within the club.

The club hosted a guest lecture by a renowned Go player, who shared insights into advanced strategies and game analysis. Members actively participated in the Q&A session, gaining valuable knowledge and inspiration from the expert's experiences. The guest lecture enriched members' understanding of high-level Go play, providing them with new perspectives and strategies to incorporate into their own games. The interactive nature of the session allowed for a deep dive into advanced tactics, leaving members inspired and eager to apply their newfound knowledge in their future gameplay.

groups.C_DescriptionC:
象棋社每周活动一次，主要是社员之间互相下棋。同时也会以公众号的形式去发布有关象棋的文章
象棋社主要以宣传象棋文化为主旨，希望同学在彼此之间下棋的过程之中，可以体验到下棋的乐趣和中国传统文化的魅力。象棋社的活动氛围轻松快乐，不注重胜负，只注重下棋过程，更能体验到互相博弈的精髓。在这样的氛围下，社员也可以以棋会友，成为朋友，享受象棋，爱上象棋。
groups.C_DescriptionE:
The chess club plays chess with each other once a week. At the same time, we will publish articles about chess in the form of official accounts 
Chess club mainly aims at propagandizing chess culture, hoping that students can experience the fun of chess and the charm of traditional Chinese culture while playing chess with each other. The atmosphere of chess club is relaxed and happy, paying more attention on chess itself instead of winning or not in order to feel the essence of mutual game. In such an atmosphere, members can also use chess to meet friends, enjoy chess and fall in love with chess.

groups.C_DescriptionC: VOICE有声书项目由上海市世界外国语中学中学一群热爱阅读的学生发起，旨在致力于发展有声读物。在让人们从别样的角度感受阅读之美的同时，我们关注社会上有阅读障碍的群体。希望在我们的努力之下，能让更多人因为听，爱上读。
groups.C_DescriptionE: VOICE, initiated by a group of students who enjoys reading and hopes to share the joy of reading with others, is started with the idea of making audio books to help people who have problems on reading while providing people who are interested in both reading and listening more enjoyment. Considering that sound is a cyclic resource as well as a convenient way to spread information, we soon notice that currently in China, people have not yet realized the importance of producing various audio books. People who suffer from disabilities or still are not able to read therefore are lack of reading resources. It’s worthwhile for us pay more attention on the development of audio books and help them. While producing audio books, we also enjoy a unique way of reading by telling and speaking, enhance our recordings by certain post-processing, and brainstorm how to apply audio works to favor people in more aspects.

grecord.C_Reflection: This actually happened on Nov 14th. A transformative day with the school Voice Club unfolded during our collaborative event, "Color of Sound," in partnership with the Origin Association. Members immersed themselves in literary expressions, exploring the vibrant hues of sound through readings and performances. The synergy between our clubs fostered a unique atmosphere, echoing the diverse perspectives of our combined talents. This day epitomized the power of collaboration, leaving an indelible mark on the rich tapestry of experiences within the Voice Club this semester.

This actually happened on Oct 21th. In the heart of our school's Voice club, a remarkable day unfolded with the themed event, "Approaching Lu Xun." The air resonated with the richness of literary voices as the Thinker Line Reading Society and the Line Reading Society collaborated. Members immersed themselves in the profound words of Lu Xun, exploring his works with thoughtful line readings. This special gathering not only celebrated literature but also exemplified the harmonious collaboration within our club, making it a day of intellectual resonance and shared passion.

This actually happened on Nov 4th. An enriching day with the school Voice club unfolded, emphasizing online activities rich in content. We delved into sorting and anticipating future endeavors, reviewing the splendid content from the previous issue. The session included a practical tutorial on public number typesetting, enhancing the synergy between sound and text. To embrace the Halloween spirit, we organized a spine-chilling story reading activity, immersing ourselves in the holiday's mysterious atmosphere. Excitingly, a Lu Xun theme reading event, in collaboration with the Chinese group and thinkers, is on the horizon, promising more literary exploration.
This actually happened on Nov 24th. A day with the school Voice club was a literary journey, highlighted by our rendition of "Vanity Fair."

Thia actually happened on Nov 18th. In a special day with the school Voice Club this semester, we celebrated the essence of classic literature with a profound focus on "Vanity Fair." The VOICE Classic Appreciation event was an immersive experience, where members passionately discussed and appreciated the nuances of this English masterpiece. From insightful analyses to captivating readings, the day showcased our collective love for literature. It was a poignant celebration of words, bringing the timeless charm of "Vanity Fair" to life and fostering a deeper connection within the Voice Club community.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 社团宗旨在于帮助学生找到心仪的大学并且寻找适合自己的CAS项目。首先作为即将出国的同学，我们需要对未来自己将面临的众多大学有所了解，但是大家有没有太多的时间去一所一所的了解，于是我们社团的存在就有了意义。在活动中我们会帮助大家收集并分析大学的资料，并在一定时间内将至公布，并提供给大家以供参考。第二部分，就是CAS项目的协助，新加入DP大家庭的同学在开学的第二周就要面临社团的选择，对于他们来说，一切的社团都是陌生的、不熟悉的，他们的选择也是盲目的，那我们的社团给他们提供的信息能够帮助到他们寻找到适合自己的社团，或者创立属于他们的社团。而在之后的学习过程中，同学们也要开展自己的CAS Project，那这时候我们可以通过我们的经验，来帮助他们找到自己的兴趣，并开展有关的Project。相信着一定能帮到之后的学弟学妹们。
groups.C_DescriptionE: Our goal is to help students find the college they want to attend and help them with their CAS activities. Many students at our school will be heading towards an international direction, so it is important that they learn as much about colleges as possible. Unfortunately, this is a time consuming process. Our club will research these colleges and then give this information to students. We will also be contacting school admission councilors in international schools and inviting them to our school to speak. We hope to create more student-councilor interaction and create a more entertaining and creative way for councilors to present the information about their school.  We will also be striving to create more people-friendly ways to interact with the councilors even with a tight schedule.Secondly, we also help students in CAS activities. To those students who are new to the international campus, they have to choose their clubs on the second week of the new semester. However, they even never heard about the name of the club, how could they choose a suitable club without knowing anything about them? Our club is going to provide the information of clubs and categorize them into different groups. During the study in the IB program, students have to create their own CAS Project, and we will help them find their interests and create a suitable CAS Project.

grecord.C_Theme: Overall summary of the entire semester
grecord.C_Reflection: In the last meeting of this semester, we reviewed and summarized what we have did in this semester: publishing articles regularly on the official account (IB subjects introduction, studying advices, learning experiences, college research and introduction), volunteering for various activities (education exhibitions held by many different organizations, WFLA Christmas sharing session). All in all, it has been a great year, and every club member has worked very hard. In the next year, we will keep doing what we ought to do, meanwhile also trying to start some new projects.

grecord.C_Theme: Reading, analyzing and discussing sample interview articles
grecord.C_Reflection: In order to help club members to form a brief idea about how to write an interview, several interview articles written last year have been read, analyzed, and discussed. Each club member is required to select one of the interview articles that they are interested in and answer the following questions based on that specific article: What are the basic components of an interview? What is the logical relationship between paragraphs? Which part of the interview impressed you the most? What are some standards or assessed criteria that a good interview (article) should meet? By sharing ideas about these questions, I believe everyone shall be ready for the upcoming interviews in December.

This time we introduced our project to the newcomers and invited them to participate in our project. My project is divided into the part. The first part is to interview the prize winner in different competitions from various aspects. The goal of this is to let the experience in the WFLA to transport to a different generation. The second part is to make a short video about the daily life of the student and then post it on the website. The goal of this is to let more people get to know the life of the student. However, it is a little bit hard to do it.

grecord.C_Theme: A mini lecture about how to design the layout for an article
grecord.C_Reflection: During this meeting, the club president gave a mini lecture to the new club members about how to design the layout for an online article. The mini lecture started with a brief explanation about the significance of a well-designed layout and the effect of layout on audiences' reading experiences. Then, the club president dissected the layout of an online article into several parts (components), such as the font size, color, margins, paragraphing etc., and specific examples have been provided in order to visualize them and hence make them clearer to understand. Besides these theoretical elaborations, the club president also showed everyone the actual operation interface of a commonly used website for layout designing (Xiu Mi) and taught about the basic ways to use that.

Today，most of our club members come to this graduates‘ application experience sharing exhibition to do volunteering work. This is SWFLA's annual tradition to invite some outstanding graduates back to SWFLA to give speeches about their study and apply experience, including their CAS activities, hobbies for their future major and how they overcome the difficult process of the applying season. As volunteers, our job was to help lead the crowd to the right classrooms they want to go to and listen to and answer parents' questions. Through the process, we all feel the happiness of helping each other and obtaining a deeper understanding of SWFLA and their perfect graduates. As applicants ourselves, we also gain knowledge ourselves by listening to those sharing experience and ask graduates' some questions puzzling us face to face.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 微笑社一直着眼于“教育”与“社区”两大元素。我们认为，在将目光投向遥远的青藏高原或是大别山区之前，我们不应忘了，我们自己的社区就急需我们的帮助。所以，我们致力于关注身边居民们的需求，解决他们的不便，真正成为细致观察，敢于实践的Careholists。我们的理念就是希望教育能够紧跟新时代的潮流，英语是全球化的象征，程序设计和手机是信息化的象征，这些都是在新时代必不可少的技能。我们希望能够通过自己的努力，帮助小朋友尽快适应新时代，帮助老年人努力赶上新时代，将知识与微笑传递给更多的人。
groups.C_DescriptionE: Careholic has been focusing on the two elements: "education" and "community". We believe that before we turn our eyes to the remote areas far away, we should not forget that our own communities are in urgent need of our help. Therefore, we are committed to paying attention to the needs of the residents around us and solving their inconveniences. Our objective is that education should keep up with the trend of the new era. English is the symbol of globalization, programming and mobile phone are the symbol of informationization. We hope that through our own efforts, we can help the children adapt to the new era as soon as possible, help the elderly to catch up with the new era, and pass knowledge and smile to more people.

grecord.C_Reflection: During the summer vacation, I held a meeting with Core to complete the handover with the last president, and got a more comprehensive understanding of the current situation of the club. Now the society is facing transformation and fewer projects. I have chosen to change the way of classes or cancel the project for the project that has lost some social significance and the club that has not had a good effect for a long time. I plan to held another meeting with the new cores. I was still prepare for how to tackle the issue.

On nineteenth of November, the domestic program English teaching class is first started. I, as the person in charge is the first to be the lecturer to set up an example for the new members of the club. So the others students were being assistants, which can assist in answering the students’ questions. On this class, I taught lesson 21 of the New Concept English three. The content included new vocabs in the passage, meaning of the passage and some grammar points. For extra, I taught them a poem of Byron, She Walks in Beauty.

On tenth of December, the third domestic English teaching program is held again online. At this time, a new member of our club volunteered for this time’s main lecturer. All the other students are assistants. In this class, he taught lesson 23 of the New Concept English three, the content included new vocabs in the passage, meaning of the passage and some grammar points. For extra, he taught some information of French snails. The overall class lasted for more than an hour.

On seventeenth of December, the fourth domestic English teaching program is held again online. At this time, Tina is this time’s main lecturer, and all the other students are assistants. In this class, she taught lesson 24 of the New Concept English three, the content included new vocabs in the passage, meaning of the passage and some grammar points. The overall class lasted for more than an hour. And some accidents of WIFI happened before the class and these incidents should be eliminated later on.

On tenth of December, we again held our supposed weekly club activity about some issues in our club. Most of the club members attended the activity and we majorly discuss about how the programs should be carried out on that week. To be more specific, each person in charge of different programs gather their members together to give out jobs and work. The activity is very useful, as it helps some club members who were not actively engaged to come and chose the program they want to attend.

groups.C_DescriptionC:
世外根与芽创立于2006年，在世外本部与国际部都开展了活动。根与芽的理念其实很简单，关心环境、关爱社区，但求通过我们的活动，倡导身边的人们为改善环境做出贡献。
根与芽的活动主要分为两大类：常规活动以及短期大型活动。常规活动有如：healthy diet，ecolife生活小物和ecofarm。短期有各种和沪上环保社团的合作项目以及和上海根与芽的合作。
groups.C_DescriptionE:
Roots and Shoots is an international environmental organization. Our club in WFLMS is a member of Shanghai Roots and Shoots.Protect the environment, Care for the community---That’s what we think. We want to use our action to propagate our idea. 
    There are two parts of activities in our club: routine activities and short-term event. Routine activities includes: ecofarm, ecolife and healthy diet.  Short-term events includes cooperations with Shanghai R&S and other eco-friendly organizations in Shanghai.

grecord.C_Reflection: We continued to make ornamental widgets out of waste printing paper, the products we designed for the Charity Fair. At today’s fair, we received many more orders than we had expected, which meant that we may have to spend multiple activity periods working on it. Prolonged periods of working on making art out of recyclable material had helped us gain skills in handicraft as well as better understanding of how to link creativity and beauty to the least expected topic - recycling waste.

grecord.C_Theme: Planting vegetables and lecture on organic farming
grecord.C_Reflection: For the activity this Friday, we got together and spent sometime planting spinach seeds into the fields we tended last week. Afterwards, the senior members of WFLA Roots&Shoots went farther to explain the meaning of organic farming and its impact on the environment. We got to know the crucial factors to starting a farming ground - soil, water, pest and weed control and seed selection - and how these aspects differ between traditional farming and organic farming. Some members of our club are going to compose a WeChat article on organic farming to spread the knowledge to people outside our club after the activity.

This Friday's main activity in the R&S club is starting the Ecofarm project. We got together to tend the spare gardening area on campus to prepare for a season of growing vegetables without introducing harmful substances into the environment. As most of us spent more than half of last semester out of school, the field was previously left untended for a long time. Therefore, it took us quite a while clearing away the weeds, pebbles and brick shards in the soil and loosening up the clotted earth. After finishing the work, we voted to decide that the plants we will grow for the fall season are spinach and Chinese cabbage. The planting and tending of sprouts will continue through the semester, and we should be anticipating a harvest in about two months.

6/4
That was the first regular activity in this semester when all of the club members gather together and had a introduction meeting on the this semester's planning. Our discussion mainly focused on how to deal with the spare land of the Dingxiang's Community and when and what we should develop another activity and corporate with the neighbourhood committee. We finally decided to set out two activities during the summer holiday as we didn't have much time before the final exam and we planned to teach the children in the neighbourhood something about planting and botanic knowledge.

6/9  
That day, we decided to classify the old clothes in sort, which we had collected from the nearby neighborhood last semester. We classified the clothes from the cropped ones to the uncropped ones and we decided to throw away the cropped ones and keep the uncropped ones. The uncropped ones would probably be sold or be given to the nearby community or the relevant corporations that we had coordinated with before. We sincerely hoped these clothes can be carefully and effectively reused.

groups.C_DescriptionC:
我们的全称是信息化社，不过我们更喜欢被称之为C社（Computerization）；我们开发并维护了校内信息化平台Enspire；

我们是一个长期在幕后工作的，以面向社团的知识性服务为主的，一个小而精的CS社团；
我们认为，代码仅仅是算法的形式载体，是Computer Scientists的思想和Algorithms造就了他/她们，而不是代码本身；因此，我们有着程序设计交流的社团文化；

此外，我们与各学生组织都有着深入的合作。我们与数学社合作，开办了面向十年级的数学建模课程；我们与Techomedia合作，为Techomedia的推文和大型活动提供技术支持；我们与学生会合作，提供社团活动教室预约平台、五星社团/新社团/末位社团答辩评分平台；我们与慈善晚会Charity合作，为他们提供拍卖的线上实时出价与竞价平台；……
groups.C_DescriptionE:
We are Computerization, an intimate Computer Science club within Shanghai World Foreign Language Academy. Our proudest work is the campus computerization platform Enspire, which is coded and maintained solely by us.

For most of the time, we are associated with the delicate and well-designed information flows behind the scenes as we provide knowledge services to various student organizations. 

We hold a strong belief that codes are only the means to present coders' ideas, and it is computer scientists' thoughts and algorithms that made them great computer scientists, not codes. Hence, we have a tradition of discussing program design and algorithms.

Besides that, we have deep cooperation with various student organizations on campus. We cooperate with WFLA Math Club to deliver the math modeling course to tenth-graders; we cooperate with Techomedia and acted as Tech Support for their WeChat articles and offline events; we cooperate with the Student Union to address the problem of club activity classroom reservation, of five-star clubs defense and scoring system; we cooperated with Charity and designed an online auction system that made real-time bidding available; and a lot more.

grecord.C_Reflection: Last Monday afternoon I learnt about the basic grammar of python. The student who taught us was patient and kind. But I found that some of the students that were listening as I was that I supposed that this was also the first time for them to know about grammar in python interacted naturally with the student who was teaching and even debated about it leaving me confused. I think I still have a long way to go to catch up with them and further my study in python.

grecord.C_Theme: A Lecture on Convolutional and Recurrent Neural Network
grecord.C_Reflection:
Real time: November 16, 2019 to November 17, 2019
Content:
Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) is a variant of neural network. It has become one of the most important tools for computer vision tasks due to its ability to process multi-dimensional data at the same time. I first introduced the way pictures are stored in the computer, and then introduced the concept of convolution. I then carefully explained the convolutional layer, pooling layer, fully connected layer and softmax layer in CNN with examples. At the same time, Recurrent Neural Network (RNN) is another important neural network variant. Its structure enables it to process sequence data. I first introduced the architecture of the recurrent neural network, combined with basic translation tasks to explain the specific process of forward propagation and reverse derivation. Later, I analyzed its shortcomings and introduced the unique architecture of sequence to sequence (seq2seq), the more complex RNN Cell of LSTM network, and the improved method of bidirectional RNN. After this class, I have a better understanding of how to explain various complex concepts in a simple way and expand the knowledge of students.
Before the lecture, I spent approximately 2 hours finding all the diagrams and math information about cnn and rnn. I wrote a detailed note about what to present and how to present in this lecture.
After the lecture, computerization members had a better understanding of the underlying logic on tasks such as facial recognization, number classification and so on.

grecord.C_Theme: The basic Math skills needed for AI (Actual date: 2020.9.14)
grecord.C_Reflection:
Here are some of the most basic math that an AI institute will need:
(1) Basic numerical calculation knowledge (Newton's method, dichotomy, linear regression and least squares, error control).
(2) Basic calculus, calculus of higher dimensional functions (especially the part of differentiation).
(3) Basic linear algebra: vector and matrix operation, matrix inverse, similar matrix, eigenvalue and eigenvector of matrix, determinant, etc.
(4) Expectation, variance, covariance and other basic concepts. Common probability distributions, conditional probability chain rule, Bayes formula, maximum likelihood estimation

These are which the AI department provided to the club members of both computerization club and math club. I am very glad to see that all of the new members are learning and participating.

grecord.C_Theme: Sharing experiences and thoughts on our projects
grecord.C_Reflection: Throughout the whole November, I shared many experiences of mine with other members, including some basic ideas of project management, of good code structures, and of the Laravel framework. Through the sharing process, I believed everyone could now have a good picture of what they each should do to form a team that communicates and collaborates with little obstacles. From what I believe, well-managed and well-kept structure and conventions could eliminate communication problems, leading to a intimate team where everyone know exactly what to do and could collectively achieve high efficiency.

grecord.C_Theme: Writing proposals and gathering needs for the next generation informatization platform
grecord.C_Reflection: In the first and second week of December, I have started several discussions with my club members on the potentials and needs for a next-generation informatization platform. We spent many hours brainstorming, both online and offline, and we have formed our ideas into a formal draft, which is presented on December 20th. On that day, we had a long meeting with school and the Student Union on the draft. Through discussions on many of the details, we have finally come up with the first version of the draft and a prototype idea for the platform.

grecord.C_Theme: Planning and conducting student representative assemblies
grecord.C_Reflection: 5/14 On May 14, the 12th Student Congress of Shanghai World Foreign Language High School was held in the ladder room of the Inbound Department. There were 30 official delegates from the International High School and 92 delegates from the Inbound Department and IC Inclusion Program Department attended the Congress. The theme of this year's meeting is "Connections". The theme of this year's council is "Connections". Connections are both internal - the continuous transmission and innovation, and external - the connection and improvement of the campus. In the past academic year, the Student Council has improved the communication channels between students and the Student Council by setting up suggestion boxes, and building a more diverse campus culture by organizing more colorful cultural weeks and other activities. We have also made breakthroughs and transformations in the form of performance and interpretation of the spirit of Charity.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 1803公里，是上海到大别山的距离。一路上的层层山峦，片片森林，却阻挡不住世外学子的爱与寄托，让这一段距离显得不再遥不可及。我们在支教的过程中被孩子们那一份纯真与质朴深深感动，并希望珍惜并保留住这份在喧嚣的世界中的宁静，但同时我们也看到了在群山围绕，略显闭塞的学校中的缺陷。我们相信，大别山的孩子们并不极端缺乏物资的支持，我们社团能做的是通过支教2.0、爱心邮箱以及寄小读者项目，给大别山的孩子们带去更多的知识与想法，让他们虽然身处大山，却能获得更为广阔的视野，从更多的角度来看待生活中的事物，并将我们对于大别山孩子们的关爱不断延续，让世外中学传统的大别山支教项目更为长期持久，只有这样才能避免做慈善的形式化而达到最终的目的，完成我们支教的初衷。
groups.C_DescriptionE:
1803 km, is the distance between Shanghai to Dabie Mountain.
Although the rough and bumpy road keeps the village isolated from the modern city, our love and hope for the children there is sincere and faithful. We realized the purity and innocence of them and we want to cherish and protect this peace in the world that filled with chaos. We believed that the children in Dabie Mountain are not in the extreme lack of financial support, but instead, the need for more open-minded ideas and thoughts, and that is the weakness we saw in the education there. We mainly designed three projects that are online teaching-assistance, the love mailbox and also the self-designed book ‘For the Young Readers’. In this way, we want to expand the children’s outlook and help them to build their own new attitude towards life. So finally we may achieve the goal that put our thoughts and passion into practice and make some real and long-term contribution to the traditional Dabie Mountain teaching-assistance projects held every year in our school.

grecord.C_Reflection: This Tuesday, we have a hot discussion about one new program of one of my group member’s. She proposes that we can two in pairs and carry out short films about different subtopics such as human and society, struggle and persist, inspiration and realize, spread and goal under the main theme of “why we volunteer.” This is a pretty much meaningful program as we all can reflect on when we start and why we should volunteer and to explain that in depth to the public.

There would be the first time of activity of our club this semester, and we would welcome new members from Grade10. So I was designing some sections of introduction and games as ice breaking for the upcoming event. I first collected some personal information from other core so that the new members can contact us at any time, and some picture and records of the activities we did last semester. and then I searched online for once breaking games including one truth and two lies.

The exciting activity finally came, and we first welcomed the new members of our club, letting them introduce themselves. And then I put on my presentation about what we did during the last whole year, including online classes, science popularization education videos, letter writing and so on. When came to the ice breaking, I found the one truth and two lies game really raised their interest and also made them better know us. Finally, we collected the intention of our new member that which section they were interest in.

It would be better to have a macro view and detailed plan for my CAS project on 1803ZD, to be more ordered and give the new members a deeper understanding of my program. The project mainly focuses on the reason why we are actively taking part in all kinds of volunteer activities and how it should be a part of our life. I planned to have about 4 videos and had a group of 4 to 5 students from the video shooting, editing and words writing. It was supposed to last for 6 months.

During the activity, we helped one of our members finished her tweet, which was the monthly recommendation of books, films, videos, musical operas, music and many other culture artifacts in our daily life and issued it through our official account. It was a great experience to see our production of 1803ZD and observe the reading amount increasing. Also, I kept in pace with the video program to make sure that they can finished it before the deadline and minimize the influence of chicken pox.

groups.C_DescriptionC: SRP科研社是一个学校，家长，社会，学生四维一体，以服务本校学生为宗旨目标的服务类平台。本社团希望成为信息的发布者，提供者，及四方的沟通桥梁，为学生们提供更好的资源平台，提高我校科创氛围我们将作为社会与学校的沟通桥梁，为学校寻找可行的科研项目；我们将在学生进行科创项目过程中提供相关帮助，以满足他们的需求；我们将集结家长群体的力量，为学生提供相关技术支持及资源；我们将通过社会宣传联络，为学生获取相关资源平台；发布相关社会科创信息，可以让学生们参与社会化科创课题，并通过推广，使国内外科创项目在本校学生群体内同部演化。
groups.C_DescriptionE: As a science and innovation service platform, WFLA-SRP is committed to becoming an information publisher and a communication bridge between schools, parents, students, and society, providing students with a better resource platform for scientific research projects.

grecord.C_Reflection:
On Dec.18, 
Three members from WFLMS came to Huaxing school, and 17 children were waiting for us. Teacher Chen took the children to school court and we introduced each other. We took half an hour subway to the school. They expressed warm welcome for our arrival. We coached the kids to warm up and make the body ready for physical training. Then we organized them in three teams to practice shooting, passing and some fundamental training. They are very excited and learn very quickly. We show them and make a example, and then let them practice one by one with correction coaching. It was getting dark in the late winter, and everyone were very hot and hope to continue the training. The parents were waiting outside the school wall. The first club activity was ended and we both hope there will be more frequency and more different clubs to help the children to develop in all rounds activities.

Oct.2020 Bridge-charity service project preparation 
There are some schools for children from migrant peasant labors who are working in Shanghai without permanent residence. Those schools are lack of resource in school clubs and education facility. We contacted a few of them, and reached agreement of cooperation on school club support project. We visited Huaxing non-government school in Dec.1, 2020, and had a meeting with school president Wu Yuan. Mr. Wu expressed high interest in the support from our schoolmates from WFLMS, and recommend teacher Chen Aichun to lead  this project.

Nov.23
With the social research issues and resources, we began to pilot some projects in field. We started to do research on social welfare fairness and effectiveness. I did lots of reading and studied the economic theory. I found it was not effective wo run charity programs because it is less efficient compared government allocation. However, why so many charity organization and programs run very well, and well-accepted by society?  With thinking and practicing, I found there are much intangible value behind it. For instance, the psychological effect for the provider and receiver, the spiritual reward for the charity deliver, and the social moral improvement. It is not a purely economic issue, and it beyond it which deserves attention for everyone’s contribution.

Nov.16

Last week, we listed lots of issues for research. We prioritized them and take those we can work on to do some research and practice to improve it. We searched for the related organizations to help us. University research department, MNC corporate center, UNICEF, charity fund and some individual studio. We plan to contact some of them thru email, phone , and meet them personally. We need more resource to sponsor the research, and some of us went back to ask help from our parents, relatives and other network.

Nov.3

We initiated meeting on social science research projects and topics. It covers and relates to social welfare effectiveness, social fairness, female equality, children care etc. As for every topic, we discussed it’s root cause and possibility of resolving. Firstly, we talked about the freedom and rule under current COVID19 epidemic. What kind of role should government play to respect individualism and to guarantee social safety and effectiveness? Compared the situation in different countries, which one is appropriate and applicable for other to learn and take action. What we students can do for it? We also have discussion on the topic to help less fortunate.

groups.C_DescriptionC:
JOL是一个由高中学生自主发起的教育组织，曾被评为上海市世界外国语中学的五星社团，活动内容均为非盈利的公益项目。至今为止，我们曾开过众多种类不同、面向各个年龄段的课程，包括心理学、设计思维、公共演讲、戏剧、英语音标等。
我们拥有轻松的社团氛围，丰富的活动，自由的平台。
我们怀抱着对知识的热忱，渴望把心中的热爱传播给更多的人。
groups.C_DescriptionE:
JOL is an educational organization independently initiated by high school students. It was once awarded as the five-star club of Shanghai World Foreign Language Middle School. Its activities are all non-profit public welfare projects. So far, we have offered a wide variety of courses for all ages, including psychology, design thinking, public speaking, drama, English phonetic alphabet, and so on.
We have a relaxed community atmosphere, rich activities, and a free platform. 
We embrace the enthusiasm of knowledge, and we are eager to spread our love to more people.

grecord.C_Theme: Cooperating with Luminosity: Topic 2 subject elitism
grecord.C_Reflection: The second collaboration between JOL and the Psychology Club was on the topic of "subject elitism," a common phenomenon in the Chinese education system. Many parents believe that science subjects are superior to humanities subjects, and this mentality can cause distress for some students. During the activity, we explored the root causes of subject elitism and its effects on students' mental health and well-being. The Psychology Club provided insights on how students can manage their own stress and negative emotions related to subject elitism, while JOL focused on advocating for a more inclusive and balanced education system that values all subjects equally. It was a thought-provoking discussion and we hope to continue raising awareness about this issue

grecord.C_Theme: Cooperating with Luminosity: Topic 3  nihilism in the campus community
grecord.C_Reflection: The third joint event between JOL and the psychology club was a discussion on nihilism in the campus community. We explored the concept and its presence on campus, and also watched a relevant documentary. It was a thought-provoking and engaging event for all attendees. During the event, we also delved into the reasons why young people may become enamored with nihilism and the potential effects it can have. It was a thought-provoking discussion as we considered the various factors that may contribute to an individual's embrace of nihilistic beliefs and the ways in which it can influence their actions and worldview.

At the beginning of the school year, JOL held an offline recruitment event led by the club department. During lunchtime, we posted posters and played a recruitment video showcasing the activities of JOL. The event was lively and successful, with many students stopping to ask questions and express interest in joining the club. The atmosphere was energetic and there was a buzz of excitement as people learned more about our organization. The recruitment video played on a loop, attracting a steady stream of curious students who were drawn in by the engaging visuals and catchy music. Overall, it was a great start to the school year and we are excited to welcome new members to our club.

grecord.C_Theme: Writing a preview of events linked to the Psychology Club
grecord.C_Reflection:
I write tweets to preview the cooperation between JOL and Luminosity psycology club. The joint project between our club and the psychology club involves writing and publishing articles about the widespread phenomena we observe within the campus and young people community. We will conduct research in the form of a discussion group to delve deeper into the issues at hand. I am responsible for writing promotional material for the project. This will be a collaborative effort as we work together to gather information, form hypotheses, and present our findings to the rest of the group. It will be a valuable learning experience as we gain insights into the mindset of our peers and the challenges they may be facing.
Through the activities, we hope to shed light on important topics and spark meaningful conversations among the participants.

grecord.C_Theme: Supervising and listening to the courses for visually impaired students
grecord.C_Reflection: As the president of our club, I supervised and listened to the second, third and fourth English classes for the visually impaired in the summer vacation. From the perspective of an observer, I noticed that there were a few areas where the volunteer teachers could improve, such as speaking too quickly and using too many technical terms. I carefully recorded these observations and discussed them with the teachers after the class. We brainstormed ways to make the classes more accessible and engaging for the students, such as providing more visual aids and breaking down complex concepts into simpler terms. In addition, we also talked about the importance of using clear and concise language, as well as incorporating more interactive activities into the lessons. In conclusion, it was a valuable learning experience and I am committed to continually improving the quality of our classes.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 天路为西藏学生提供以英语为主的网课，填补当地较为落后的口语教学和师资。社团提供线上志愿者机会，同公益组织“一扇窗”合作，在增加学习兴趣的基础上使学生更为灵活地应用英语，了解语言的文化环境。同时，天路提供一个西藏和上海学生文化交流的平台，通过实地采访、研究等手段，旨在为双方学生获得一定的文化认同感以及自我反思。学生思考在快节奏的信息化时代中维持传统文化与全球文化的平衡的必要性和意义，增加思辨能力。通过建立世外中学与上海市浦东外事服务学校的联系，消减文化刻板印象和隔阂，开拓学生的视野，使其有自我赋权的能力，建立文化自信，在平台上与世界的其他角落交流。
groups.C_DescriptionE: Canopy Bridge aims to make a connection with the Tibetan students from the culture perspective. We provide our club members with a great amount of opportunity of volunteering work and to associate with the Tibetans. In nowadays society,  plenty people adopt a curious attitude towards the minority group, ready to offer help yet with a lack of knowing how do real Tibetans live. Thus it is our duty to investigate their true needs by establishing friendship, to unveil their authentic likes and customs through multi-interactions.

grecord.C_Reflection: Now that we had our new president, we used some weekend time to collect the possibles obstacles that we might confront in the future. First, the political background contributed to some setbacks. Due to the sensitive international relationship between US and China, schools in the conventionally domestic system might reject coorperation with us regarding our identity as foreign language high-schoolers. Second, the main principle of Canopy Bridge remains as an issue. Less students participated non-profit activities for pure passion and interest. Instead, they valued the academic achievements more.
