This week, since the school CAS group assigned each club a poster to present the activities and achievements completed by the club for the past period, we hold a group discussion on what we should put on the poster of Canopy Bridge. I think one of the most impressive work we achieved is the personalized figures of Tibetan tourist attractions. We wrote the three detailed steps of how we thought about and materialized the idea. We also enclosed a picture of the products we sold on Charity last year. Another thing that we done was the preparing process of "A Window".

Although some members was at the Economics EE Panal, today we had the activity at noon. The first weekly activity this semester, I created a club schedule. We decided to basically continue the processes of the previous semester: finishing the personify project of Tibetan elements, publishing articles on the club account, and cooperating with 'Window' org. to teach kids who want to broaden their horizons. The reason why our last proposal required revision was that it was too difficult for small kids to understand. Thus we would have to lower the level, and create something that comfort with their age on the same topic.

We finally competed our design sheet for the three sacred lakes, which all possess different characteristics: YamdrokTso has an open characteristic and is curious to all new stuffs. This is supported that in real life, the lake is called “the lake of jade” and in Chinese, “碧玉湖”. Lake Manasarovar, the second one, has a more complex feature. In Tibetan language, it is named as “the lake that conquers all”; thus we decided to link it with warfare. It (she) confers blessings to those who pray to win, like Athena in Greek Mythology. Finally, for Namtso, it (he) is a boy who sinks into melancholia for not being fully understood by human beings. Yet overall, all three figures love human and protect the Tibetans on and on.

Since the project we cooperate with "THE WINDOW" is on introducing "an ordinary yet horrible person", we decided to reach out for the one that we are the closest, the counselor teacher of the canopy bridge. After preparation, we had an interview, during which we asked about his understating as leaning Chinese and the methods and articles that he used during everyday class. We took notes and planned to record the class soon. I hoped that it would bring the rural kids some new concepts and idea on learning our mother language.

groups.C_DescriptionC:
本社的名称为“CS First”。这里的CS是 Computer Science的缩写，意为是计算机科学，可以直译为“计算机科学先行者”。
社团灵感的来源是Google CS First——一套由谷歌公司研发的，适合青少年探索计算机技术的公益课程。这套基于Scratch的课程在欧美中小学已非常流行，但是在并没有引进中国，也没有适合中国学生的版本。因此，本社团争取到了与谷歌（中国）公司合作的机会，将CS First项目在我校推行，希望我校的同学能够从中获益，并且由此辐射到周边更多学校的青少年。
在计算机科学逐渐成为社会主流发展趋势的当下，更多地推广计算机科学无疑很重要。现在许多人在做的是针对高中生的计算机科学教程/科普/活动，但是中小学生，成年人乃至老年人都可以接触计算机科学，而算机科学在他们的生活中可以扮演非常重要的角色，计算机科学的普适性也能够得到体现。因此通过创办这个社团，我们希望能够填补更年轻的青少年以及部分成年人在这块领域的认知空缺。
groups.C_DescriptionE:
The name of the club is "CS First". CS here is the abbreviation of Computer Science, which can be literally translated as "computer science pioneer".
The source of inspiration for the community is Google CS First-a set of public welfare courses developed by Google that are suitable for teenagers to explore computer technology. This Scratch-based curriculum has been very popular in European and American schools, but it has not been introduced to China, and there is no version suitable for Chinese students. Therefore, this association has reached an opportunity to cooperate with Google (China) and opened the CS First project in our school. We hope that our school’s classmates can merge from it and can radiate to more teenagers in surrounding schools.

grecord.C_Reflection: The actual date of this activity is 2022/9/22. In order to prepare for the public service program, we arranged that one of the members will teach the other new members of the association about some basic C++ knowledges. During this activity, he introduced some basic algorithm and logic of the language. After that, we let the new members to try to use the language to solve some basic mathematical problems. Besides, we discussed whether to do the sharing of technological news and came to an agreement.

It’s December the eighth today. Which is the first lesson that I gave to the students. In the lesson today, I taught them the basic functions of Unity. And I taught them how to use the software in a more effective way. I prepared a lot to make the lesson not so boring. When I was showing the use of “Scene” in Unity, I used the cartoon Peppa Pig as an example. And all the tasks I gave them was using textures in popular animations.

It’s December the fifteenth today. Which is the second lesson that I gave to the students. In the lesson today, I taught them the basic functions of Unity. And I taught them how to use the software in a more effective way. I prepared a lot to make the lesson not so boring. When I was showing the use of “Scene” in Unity, I used the cartoon Peppa Pig as an example. And all the tasks I gave them was using textures in popular animations.

It is September the fifteenth today. We didn’t have a lesson but prepared for an ice-breaking event. I bought several gifts for the members, but to get the small gift, they are going to have a “test” about basic knowledge on coding. I set ten questions and every question has a score they can get that is set based on the difficulty of the question. I also introduced what we are going to do in the following semester, which is JAVA lesson for about 3/4 the semester and Unity lesson for the rest of the semester.

It’s December the twelfth today. Next week’s lesson will be the second lesson To prepare for the lesson I’m going to teach, I searched for a lot of information over the Internet. I decided that the first class is going to be about the use of “Components” for Unity. To make the lesson not so boring for the students, I tried to add something interesting into the lesson. I decided that the lesson should include parts of questioning. And I started to prepare for a animation that I will show in the lesson next week.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 当视觉成为了更加重要的传播方式时，世外频道更是紧随其后，用相机拍摄，利用高效的节目策划和视频剪辑的方式制作学生们感兴趣，可以体现世外独特故事的片子。我们是世外中学官方支持并重点培养的以学生为主体的校园视频媒体平台。世外频道的宗旨在于记录世外，宣传世外的同时，培养学生成为优秀的世外媒体人。世外频道让学生记录世外学生的日常生活，从不同角度发现世外的故事，策划拍摄自己感兴趣的主题，体验成片的每一个过程。
groups.C_DescriptionE: When visual elements becomes a more important mode of communication, we closely followed by shooting with a camera, using efficient program planning and video editing to create a film that is of interest to students and can reflect the unique story of the world. We are a student-based campus video media platform that is officially supported and focused by the WFLA. Our purpose is to record the world, to promote the world, and to train students to become excellent foreign media people. We allows students to record the daily life of students, discover stories from different perspectives, plan different topics of interest, and experience each process of filming.

grecord.C_Theme: The fourth activity day of this semester
grecord.C_Reflection: Today is the fourth activity day of this semester. Due to COVID-19, we organized the activity online via Tencent Meeting. At the beginning, the cores and BangBang gave some advice on how to organize the question. Then, each group set up their personal meeting room to further develop on their interviewees. Our group thought of four questions for each interviewee. We will organize the pre-interview after the mid-term exam. Then, each group came back to the main meeting room and shared their organization.

grecord.C_Theme: The second activity day of this semester
grecord.C_Reflection: Today is the second activity day of this semester. Our activity for today is mainly about how to film and details about filming. Eric is host for today. First, he asked new students to arrange the sequence of a program. Most students had a basic idea about organizing a program. Then, he went into the detail of filming, including camera position, lighting, sound, etc. He used our past videos as examples, which make the illustration more comprehensive. Jacob gave more addition on the topic, making the lecture more complete.

grecord.C_Theme: The first activity day of S1
grecord.C_Reflection: Today is the first activity day of this semester. Our activity includes self-introduction, the arrangement of the whole semester and ice-breaking games. First of all, all the members including supervisors introduced themselves one by one. In order to have a deeper memory, Teacher Bang suggested that we played a game, repeating the name of the previous student. That really worked! After that I went over the arrangement. Despite the traditional program, this semester I also planned to cooperate with other clubs, like OAU and La Musique. Then, we played some ice-breaking games. We knew more about each other and this helped in the working efficiency for later club activities.

Today we had our last weekly meeting of the semester. We all gathered in C207, took a group photo together, played light-hearted mini-games, and shortened the distance between each other. After going through many tasks in this semester, such as the autumn outing, sports day, Principal’s Special Award, Charity, etc, and through the process of production, shooting and editing, every one of WFLA Channel has made huge progress. I’m looking forward to see our members revealing more potential, and to be more actively involved in the activities of WFLA Channel next semester.

grecord.C_Theme: Weekly Activity: A course about doing interviews by Mr.Yu
grecord.C_Reflection: On December 30, Mr.Yu from Shanghai TV came to join our club activity and taught members of both campus’ members of the WFLA Channel. He started from introducing what is a good interview with an example, then he started to share important tips on how to raise a question to the interviewee and to continue the conversation by going much deeper. Several members raised questions that they encountered when doing the interview this semester, which was gold to see as it showed that they were reflecting on their works. Mr.Yu discussed with them together to find solutions to the problem so that they can do better next time. The course was overall helpful and interesting as Mr.Yu shared lots of personal anecdotes and the contents are relevant and useful.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 学生公司于2012年成立，社团社长一位，副社长两位。学生公司至今已开展多个项目——从“校服熊 ”项目至“Beary Pod”项目。我们秉着永远追求挑战，不断拓宽新领域的目标。 公司的理念为“创意慈善”，来源于“社会型企业”的概念。学生公司的目标是以商业为手段，集中更好的资源，提高效率，通过资助慈善机构的方法，回馈社会。
groups.C_DescriptionE: Two firm directors establish WFLMS student firm in 2012. Now we have established several projects, from “Homey Bear”, School scholarship to “Beary Pod” Project. Holding the belief of always accepting challenges and continuously broadening our market, each project hits great success. Student firm has a goal of creative charity, which is originated from the concept of enterprises of social pattern. Our goal is to collect resources, improve efficiency through business and utilize the profit to make contribution to the society.

grecord.C_Reflection: We have regular meetings every tuesday. I came to the classroom ahead of time to wait for the meeting, and exchanged my recent experience with other core members. After the meeting, we first divided the work of product design, and assigned the management tasks of online stores, and made appropriate reflection and commendation. At the same time, we also discussed some suggestions about the products, and carried out group presentation. Each group expressed their opinions on the products of other groups and put forward suggestions for modification.

We have regular meetings every tuesday. I came to the classroom ahead of time to wait for the meeting, and exchanged my recent experience with other core members. After the meeting, we first divided the work of product design, and assigned the management tasks of online stores, and made appropriate reflection and commendation. At the same time, we also discussed some suggestions about the products, and carried out group presentation. Each group expressed their opinions on the products of other groups and put forward suggestions for modification.

Today, our student company had a daily meeting and business knowledge discussion. First of all, our three presidents explained what we had done and summarized a lot of experience. At the same time, it also summarizes what the 10th grade freshmen did last week, and reflects, summarizes and encourages them. This is a good process of learning and communicating with them. In each activity, we can not only learn a lot of business practice knowledge and exchange experience. At the same time, it can also NAG and enhance feelings. The atmosphere of the club is very good and happy.

This noon, I described our plans for the new semester again to my club members. I stated them clearly with all details. I also invited two of the members of the club to the stage to tell us about their idea. Both of them impressed me greatly. I think they both did a great job. I think I am becoming more confident about our club in the new semester. I still got a lot of club members even it is in the second semester now. Lucky me!

Today is the first meeting we hold in the second semester. I told the club members about our plan for this semester. We are going to finish more projects. But I hope that the members from G10 will complete most of them as they are going to take over the place of club leaders a few months later. To cheer people up, we even bought some little gifts as a welcome present of the new semester. I sincerely hope that all will go well in this upcoming semester.

groups.C_NameC: 彩虹之下 – 关注自闭症儿童
groups.C_NameE: Under the Rainbow – Autism Awareness Campaign
groups.C_DescriptionC: “彩虹之下——关注自闭症儿童”是一个专为架起自闭症儿童和社会沟通桥梁的平台，旨在通过对自闭症知识的普及和宣传打破社会对自闭症儿童的偏见、呼吁社会对自闭症的了解及对自闭症儿童社会现状的关注，鼓励更多人加入到接纳并帮助自闭症儿童的行列中来。此外，我们也为有意愿的人们提供帮助自闭症儿童的机会，通过频繁的志愿者活动及每年定期举行两到三次大型活动，让更多人有机会真正接触到这个群体，用自己的行动真正帮助自闭症儿童融入社会，与社会沟通 – 自闭症儿童并不像彩虹之上的星星那样遥远、孤单、不可捉摸，他们只是需要多一些时间与宽容，我们会发现他们就在我们的身边，如群星般闪耀着光芒。
groups.C_DescriptionE: “Under the Rainbow – Autism Awareness Campaign”  is a platform that serves as the connection between children with autism and the society. We aim to make people aware of what autism is and how the social situation of autistic children is like, thereby encouraging people to take action by accepting and supporting them.  Leading by this aim, we also hope to provide people the opportunities including weekly volunteering activities and annual events to offer help to children with au-tism on their own by getting the children to be in contact with the society. Eventually, you will find that instead of being like lonely the stars far away over the rainbow, they are stars under the rainbow, casting a thousand beams – all they need is just a little more tolerance, patience, and time.

grecord.C_Theme: The first voluntary activity to stay with autism children
grecord.C_Reflection: This activity actually happened in the afternoon of March 21, 2023. This was the first time I went to TongYou, the organization where autism kids get helped and be taught by professional teachers. We began to know about the basic situation of these kids there including their mental state, their daily life, and their cognitive activities. According to these information, we are going to design and optimize our curriculum. It is still in the starting stage. When I stepped into TongYou, I was deeply impresses by its tidiness. The floor, the walls and the environment was comfortable and this enabled further interaction with autism kids.

This activity actually happened in the afternoon of April 25, 2023. After the stressful monthly test, finally we began to immerse into the club activities. This time, our club president introduced the concept of music remedy, hoping to design classes for autistic children from this aspect. Firstly, we watched a video about music remedy. It was related to communication, cognition, problem, repetitive and stereotypic behaviors, social skills and so on. The literature reports that most individuals with autism respond positively to music.

Today is finally is activity day! All of us were very excited. We arrived at the venue at 8:30 to make preparations. We rearranged the tables to have enough space for children to move around, and took out the dumpling materials. Once parents, children, and volunteers arrived at 10:00, they got a brochure and introduced themselves to each other. Then, volunteers and children started to make dumplings together. It was indeed difficult to control the children’s behaviors at some points, but we all stayed very patient. Then, we together played some interactive games, such as making puzzles and Radish down. After some games, the dumplings were ready, and children enjoyed the dumplings.

grecord.C_Theme: 2-9 Decorating the venue and online volunteer training
grecord.C_Reflection: Today we spent a whole day to decorate the venue using the materials we bought yesterday. We first stuck the poster at the door of the venue to make it clear for the coming parents. Then, we started to hang lantern on the ceiling. As we did not but hooks, we needed to hang the lanterns on the lights, which is actually a little dangerous for us to reach this height, but we finished it safely by helping each other. We then hanged the small decorative dolls around the venue to enhance the atmosphere. After this, we placed some stickers and paper cuts on the wall. After this, we also took out the dumpling materials and game materials to put them in the closet there for preparation of tomorrow. We also had an online volunteer training session.

Today is the purchasing day. We listed the things to buy into three categories: dumpling materials, decoration materials, and game materials. Another member and I first went to the venue early at 9 o’clock to confirm with the supervisor there about the number of tables and chairs we would have on that day to see if we need to purchase any of these. We also looked at how the venue may be decorated. Then, we headed to Carrefour to buy dumpling and game materials. However, since Spring Festival was coming to an end, the New Year decoration materials were no longer for sale. Thus, we then headed to Walmart to look for them, but again there was none. Finally, we went to a stationary store nearby and finally we found the materials! We were very tired, but also extremely excited and satisfied.

groups.C_DescriptionC: Asclepius急救医学社旨在帮助同学提高急救意识，培养急救能力，在遭遇心脏骤停、严重过敏、低血糖、脱水等突发情况时能够有能力自救和救助他人。这种能力将使同学即使不在世外校园 ，在异国的大学也可以受益。同时，也为对医学、生理解剖有兴趣的同学提供学习、交流的平台，帮助IBDP学生利用学术知识解释并理解急救原理。
groups.C_DescriptionE: Our club aims to raise first aid awareness. We advocate for promoting firs aid as a life skill. We encourage our members to take action during emergency. In understanding the anatomical and physiological mechanisms for various first aid measures, members can have a comprehensive view about first aid in addition to acquiring applicable skills.

grecord.C_Reflection: The main content of the activity is the blood system. First, the three blood vessels that make up the system are introduced: veins, arteries, and capillaries. All three differ in structure and function. Then we explained the structure of the human heart, such as the left atrium, left ventricle, right atrium, right ventricle, aorta, coronary artery, and also explained the order of blood flow through each chamber of the heart. Due to time reasons, the heart cycle and other content were put on the next event, and finally we watched "The Good Doctor"

This is our second club activity. The speaker today is Cindy. She explained the history of medical gowns. In the early days, doctors' clothing was black to hide blood stains. Doctors also wear a mask that resembles a bird's beak. Patients tend to prefer doctors with more blood on their clothes because it suggests they have performed more surgeries and are more experienced. Later, the doctor's clothing gradually changed to white and green, which was more visually comfortable. There are many aspects to the design of medical clothing, and the clothing we see now has been revised for decades.

groups.C_DescriptionC:
志愿者库旨在给热心公益、喜欢社会实践的所有志愿者们提供多元化的提升自我的平台。无论是否有经验，无论是否有特殊的才能，所有热爱志愿者工作的同学都可以参加志愿者库。因为在志愿者库，志愿者们可以实现从零到一的飞跃。在志愿者库，志愿者们可以参与这些活动：
中国文化周 | 社团大型活动 | 康健街道金婚 | Charity | 英语节 |
志愿者库鼓励志愿者们踊跃参与到活动策划和活动执行中来，实践自己的想法，突破自己的舒适圈，在志愿者活动中得到意想不到的收获。
groups.C_DescriptionE:
WFLA Volunteer Database  welcomes all the students who have passion in volunteering, no matter skilled or not, experienced or not. The Database is willing to provide different kinds of opportunities for all the volunteers. 
Previous volunteering activities includes:
Chinese Culture Week|Clubs' activities|50th Wedding Ceremony|Charity Performance|English Festival|

grecord.C_Reflection: This actually happened on November 19th. This was my first time going to the offline adoption day this semester, and this time it was mainly to find reliable adopters for the two new kittens we rescued. The offline adoption day was held at the entrance of a coffee shop, and the staff in the coffee shop were very friendly. I also met many experienced rescuers at the event, who brought new rescued puppies and kittens to the offline adoption day. The flow of people at the coffee shop was not very large, so we didn't meet suitable adopters here, and the time was not right yet. I also fed water and canned food to the two kittens at this event, and they were really nice. They slept all afternoon and were very cute.

This actually happened on November 19th. This was my first time going to the offline adoption day this semester, and this time it was mainly to find reliable adopters for the two new kittens we rescued. The offline adoption day was held at the entrance of a coffee shop, and the staff in the coffee shop were very friendly. I also met many experienced rescuers at the event, who brought new rescued puppies and kittens to the offline adoption day. The flow of people at the coffee shop was not very large, so we didn't meet suitable adopters here, and the time was not right yet. I also fed water and canned food to the two kittens at this event, and they were really nice. They slept all afternoon and were very cute.

grecord.C_Theme: A tweet documenting TNR over the past two semesters
grecord.C_Reflection: This actually happened on October 29th. I and new member Wei Yichen jointly completed a tweet documenting the results of TNR over the past two semesters. I was responsible for writing about the sterilization of three adult female cats in the previous semester. Looking back on the experience of the previous semester and seeing the results achieved this semester, I feel proud of the Animal Protection Society from the bottom of my heart. We really did our best to improve the lives of stray cats around the school and enhance their welfare. I hope that TNR and rescue will become more and more successful in the future, and that funding issues will be resolved accordingly.

The event that took place on November 28nd was the seventh official activity of the Animal Protection Society for this semester. As the upcoming charity sale draws near, we need to gear up our preparations. The tools and materials for making bracelets that we purchased last week have arrived, and this time, we'll be learning how to craft them on the spot. We followed a tutorial on the Bilibili website to create the bracelets. The group was buzzing with lively discussions about designing them and tying the strings, making for a thoroughly enjoyable experience.

This actually happened on November 21st, which was the sixth official event of the Animal Protection Club this semester. As the time for the charity sale is getting closer, we need to prepare more actively. The tools and beads for making bracelets purchased last week have arrived. This time we will learn how to make bracelets and sell them on the spot. We watched the instructional video on Bilibili website to make the bracelets. Everyone actively discussed how to design the bracelets and tie the strings, which was a very lively activity.

groups.C_DescriptionC: Renaissance艺术鉴赏社是一个旨在提升同学艺术修养、培养良好艺术鉴赏习惯的艺术社团。通过参加每月组织的观赏艺术展览以及观展后的小组讨论，社员们可以从中获取灵感并用文章记录，甚至完成自己的个人作品。Renaissance源于法语的“re-birth”,寓意社员可通过自己与他人的灵感碰撞为自己的作品带来新生。Renaissance同样也为社员的作品提供展示的平台，每次的活动都将展示在社团网页上，条件允许甚至可以为优秀作品举办Renaissance艺术展。
groups.C_DescriptionE: “Renaissance” is composed of a group of high school students that are passionate, enthusiastic towards creative arts. The club focus on increasing member's level of aesthetic knowledge and cultivating the ability to observe and explore artistic works in depth. Through the gallery trips provided by the club, members can draw inspiration in the form of personal reflection and responses, reports and personal projects, communicate and share thoughts via-internet.

grecord.C_Reflection: Today one of my members made the last presentation for this year’s club activity. As the last presentation, he went back and looked at the title of the club, art appreciation and began a discussion of this topic. First, by pulling the big idea apart into several small points, including feeling, emotions, image, imagination, etc, he made it clear to us how audience could appreciate artworks and through what methods. Then, after discussing the concepts of each methods, he presented to us the palettes of some master painters and show us how art could be different in styles, techniques, and motifs. He also discussed how art appreciation can be a very personal thing. We also ran the vote and competition for next year’s club leader. The two candidates explained their vision and plan of the future of the club and the voting result turned out, letting both candidate successfully elected as the club leader and vice club leaders.

Today one of the members presented on a product designer and contemporary artist, Peng Zhong. The designer is famous for his product designs that use original materials from the nature such as wood, one of his most iconic products is a pair of chopsticks and products for perfumes. He is inspired by his own personal experiences and childhood memories. He also wish to explore a harmonious relationship between human and nature. He also uses excessive material from the production process to make art pieces. Then we discussed how the theme of nature is explored in other artists’ works and how nature could be an inspiration for our own art.

Today we visited the Exhibition of Christian Boltanski, Storage Memory, curated by Jean-Hubert Martin. The exhibition explored life and death of people. One piece named Personnes is consists of tonnes of used clothes and a crane equipped with a claw that repeatedly grabs the clothing, lifts it into the air, and releases it. According to Boltanski, the used clothes represents human bodies and the crane is a metaphor of destiny. There was also a piece called the Humains, which is consisted of more than 100 veils on which images from various sources that the artist has previously used are printed. The veils drift through space and, for the artist, evoke the spirit of the missing souls.

grecord.C_Theme: Presentation: Walking on the Fade Lines
grecord.C_Reflection: Today one of our members presented on a recent exhibition she has been to. The exhibition is named Walking on the Fade Out Lines, and the exhibited pieces are from different contemporary artists using a variety of media and methods of presentation. Our member introduced some of her favourite pieces, including a large scale spatial piece where a part of the museum is transformed to an interesting, bathroom-liked space. The sense of not-fitting-in and being twisted attracted many of our members. The member also introduced a film project called the Last Tour that explored a future chance of natural sceneries being shut down as tourist sites and discussed with the other on this topic.

Today one of our member presented on her dream major, interior design. She first cleared the difference between two professions that were commonly misunderstood and confused. Interior design is the art and science of understanding people's behaviour to create functional spaces within a building. Decoration is the furnishing or adorning of a space with fashionable or beautiful things. In short, interior designers may decorate, but decorators do not design. Then, she briefly introduced the history of interior design. After that, she introduced a few interior designs types that she appreciates, including art deco, industrial, and scandinavian. She explained her own connection to these styles and the reasons she likes them. Finally, she gave us some recommendations of documentaries about interior design and websites that provides information about the major.

groups.C_DescriptionC: Radiation Studio (RS)聚集了所有艺术爱好者，是一个多元化、无拘束的分享、交流与创新实践平台。在这里，你可以学习各种与专业绘画、设计软件相关的知识与技巧，获得新技能，提升自我；也可以尝试运用不同媒介制作海报、插图等创新实践，展现与突破自我。
groups.C_DescriptionE: We are an art studio which provides students chances to try out new ways to represent their artworks, encourage their passion about art and cooperate with other organizations. Our goal is to create a professional design group in our school. We will teach them usage of different software and basic idea of graphic design.

grecord.C_Reflection: The first club activity of the semester We summed up the success factors of last year's club activities and began to plan what we can do for the next semester. For example, we plan to cooperate with other clubs and produce a set of craft-themed soap products. In this semester, our club The official account should also start to run more actively. We discussed a lot of themes at the beginning and set the time for the launch of the first few official accounts and assigned some simple tasks.

At the beginning of the semester, many activities are still in the process of preparation, so we will continue to take some technical courses. In this club activity, we also taught some skills of using AI and let everyone find the videos that they are interested in and follow the imitation. We give some help in the process and finally everyone has a certain harvest and growth. This is the first time that many people use IA software to complete an independent work in our community, so it is also a good experience.

In order to adapt to the online community mode, we plan to start with some manual materials and use materials that everyone has at home, such as white paper tape glue. We found some pop-up book tutorials and distributed them to the community group in advance for your reference and understanding of some basic content In the process of the club, each of us has our own output, and we also shoot the video and animation of the output, so in addition to the time of the club, we also continued to work after the club for a long time to complete this task.

After investigation, we found that everyone in the community can use iPad to complete some community tasks, which will be more convenient for our online teaching. So in the first attempt, we first asked everyone to send out a single song or album that they like. By using the iPad to design the cover of the single to initially integrate our ideas and get in touch with the community. After the end, everyone explained the connection between their song and the design, such as What emotions do you think the song is trying to convey, and how that has influenced her color matching.

We can often see news of AI painting on online platforms, and our community, as a community that combines the form of communication and art, believes that this phenomenon is very worth exploring whether art can be completed by robots and robots can complete art to what extent? So we will do some exploration on this topic and actually operate some AI painting software, including exploring how to select different artists and authors to enter different keywords to lead to different styles of works. What is the success rate, etc. Waiting for this process to be very fun, we will also make some conclusions in the future.

groups.C_DescriptionC:
La Musique音乐社是围绕音乐的综合性社团。音乐社的日常活动主要涉及三个方面：音乐实践、音乐探索与不同领域中的音乐拓展。
在音乐实践部分中，我们每周都有乐队的排练（室内乐乐队、摇滚流行乐队和民乐队）和各类技能性指导。
音乐探索会注重更多与音乐有关的社会、历史等问题。可能的话题包括艺术史、艺术流派的发展、音乐社会学、音乐对心理学的影响等。
在音乐拓展板块中，我们会增加在跨学科方面的探究。社团成员也可以参与一些成果性产出，如写推文、做歌单、采访、录唱片等。如果条件允许，我们会增加更多演出或参与支教等社会活动。
groups.C_DescriptionE: La musique focus on music practice, music development, and exploring in the music context. In our weekly activities, students attend workshops and discuss with others to learn more about music. We also provide many performing opportunities.

grecord.C_Theme: Rock band performance on charity sale:
grecord.C_Reflection: The band gets to showcase their music and gain new fans, while also supporting a cause they care about. The audience members get to enjoy a great show while also contributing to a good cause. And, of course, the charity or non-profit organization receives much-needed funds to continue their work and make a positive impact in the world. Next time, we can also consider designing products like hats or badges to encourage the audiences to pay attention to the band in the long run.

grecord.C_Theme: posting video on public account during spring festival
grecord.C_Reflection:
This happened on 1/27 and 1/28:
I collected new year celebration ideas from club members. Finally we came up with two songs: the traditional Chinese music "Spring festival overture" and “Ode for the lost“. The first is played by double piano. Our member recorded the melody two times, then edited them together to form a harmony. The method was very creative. As for the second song, I posted the video of the rock band singing. The harmony was appealing, especially at a time that people are reminded of their past family members and all that they’ve lost or gained during the past year.

The "Link with History" event is a unique opportunity to bring together music and history in an engaging and educational way. The event kicked off with a discussion about historical songs, their significance, and how they can provide insight into the past. To make the event even more engaging, a cover band was be invited to perform historical songs from different time periods. To further enhance the educational aspect of the event, students are encouraged to research and present on a historical song of their choosing. They discussed the song's historical significance, the cultural context in which it was created, and why it continues to be relevant today. Overall, the "Link with History" event is a fantastic opportunity to bring together music and history in a way that is both educational and entertaining. It can help students develop a deeper appreciation for the role music plays in shaping our understanding of the past, and inspire them to explore historical events through the lens of music.

The actual date is October 25. Today we are Halloween themed and listened to a lot of songs about Halloween! I also watched tsv's video about Halloween!

The actual date is November 1. Today we talked about kpop. What impresses me the most is about tsv complaining about blackpink's new song, because it adapts La Cappella into a very sacrilegious version, especially for people who like classical music, it is very uncomfortable to listen to, I have the same feeling, I don't like this song.

grecord.C_Theme: 2nd rehearsal of Rhapsody on a Theme of Paganini
grecord.C_Reflection: The actual date is November 18. The only problem with the cello part is that it is not loud enough, it is difficult for the audience to hear the specific cello melody, and the contrast between forte and piano needs to be more obvious. The most important thing to pay attention to is the intonation of the first violin part, because many tones have a large span, and most of the important melodies are in high positions. If the pitch is not accurate, it will seriously affect the melody of the music. We get the recording today and sent it to the review of Charity.

groups.C_DescriptionC: OAO摄影社(Obsessionstudio OAO)，以技术与设备为基础，以Photography for Everyone为宗旨，鼓励社员将生活与摄影结合，为社员培养摄影风格、分享摄影作品、交流摄影理念提供平台。社团不仅注重技术，在户外拍摄活动或校园活动记录中锻炼社员摄影技能，更注重社员观察与想象生活的能力与意识，成就艺术摄影与纪实摄影的充分融合。
groups.C_DescriptionE: Adhere to the belief of Photography for Everyone, Obsessionstudio OAO establishes activities upon decent techniques and reliable equipment to encourage members to spice up their routines with photography. OAO provides its members with the opportunity to develop their OWN photography styles, to share their OWN photography works, and to confer their OWN photography beliefs. For club members, OAO not only emphasizes your familiarity with the parameters developed through both outdoors recreational photography activities and campus-based recording practices but treasures your talent and awareness to observe and conceptualize reality over and above. It's now or never for you to spice up YOUR routine with YOUR photography!

grecord.C_Reflection: I recently had the pleasure of presenting at the Club Micro Forum, where I reviewed the activities organized by the OAO photography club over the past semester. These activities included taking photos of school award winners, documenting events during the English Festival, and photographing the campus to capture the essence of school life. I spoke about the challenges of balancing artistic expression and factual representation in photography and encouraged members to actively participate in capturing their school memories. I emphasized the importance of preserving these memories for high school students, as they are valuable reminders of the experiences that shape us. I believe that photography is not only an art form, but also a powerful tool for storytelling.

As the president of our club, I recently announced the results of our election. I am pleased to announce that Yueheng Ni has been elected as the new president and Yunqi Lou and Yiyang Qi have been elected as the new vice presidents. I was particularly impressed with the innovative ideas they presented in their candidate applications, and I am confident that they will be able to successfully lead the club in the coming year. I am excited to see how they will continue the great work we have done in the past and how they will bring a fresh perspective to enhance our existing programs. Under their leadership, I am confident that our club will continue to thrive and provide a supportive community for all members.

I recently organized a club meeting where we discussed the progress of the "Friends" project. The project involves using film cameras to take pictures of close friends around campus. I am happy to report that we have achieved a balanced budget for the project and all participants are excited to have a tangible record of friendships on campus. Many members expressed a desire to see the project continue and to have it on display again during graduation. It was inspiring to see how our project brought together students from all walks of life and how it provided a way to preserve memories that they will cherish for years to come. I am proud to be a part of a club that values creativity and fosters a sense of community among its members.

As I was browsing through the photos I took at my school's English festival, I noticed that some of them were so dark that it was hard to see the faces of my classmates. Determined to salvage these photos, I used Photoshop to brighten them up. Using the software's exposure adjustment tools, I was able to enhance the brightness and contrast of these photos, revealing details that were previously hidden in the shadows. Once I was satisfied with the results, I distributed the photos to the students in the room. To my delight, they were thrilled with the results and thanked me for my efforts to enhance their hard work. It was a worthwhile experience to see the smiles on their faces and know that I was able to capture their accomplishments and share them with others.

I had the pleasure of capturing the school's English Festival on camera and was thoroughly impressed by the enthusiasm and dedication my fellow classmates put into decorating the classrooms and warmly welcoming the teachers and students who came to visit. The atmosphere was electric, and everyone was beaming with joy. The festival showcased a variety of activities, including introducing German bread in English and creatively describing different countries' cuisines through rhyming poetry. It was a fantastic opportunity for everyone to showcase their language skills, cultural knowledge, and creativity, and I am grateful to have been a part of such a wonderful event. The English Festival was truly a testament to the hard work and talent of my fellow students and a celebration of our diverse community.

groups.C_DescriptionC: ——你想触摸戏剧的魅力吗？戏剧是人类表演艺术的起源。从戏剧大师莎士比亚笔下的“To be or not to be”到现代戏剧之父易卜生所创作的《玩偶之家》，戏剧的魅力已经在跨时代的艺术长河中织起一道淳厚而唯美的精神底蕴——作为延续和弘扬艺术创作的我们，戏剧是开启一切更是承载梦想的基石。在上一学期中，我们戏剧社自编、自导、自演的首部处女作《往生天堂Rebirth in Heaven》在上海话剧艺术中心进行了首次银幕亮相。我们在聚光灯下感受艺术与真实世界的结合，享受表演过程以及掌声与喝彩。当我们一起携手谢幕时，没有现实的束缚，没有舞台的界限，每一位演员的激情与付出已足以证明我们整个团队的凝聚力与生生不息的艺术之魂。日后，我们将以更为精彩的作品向所有人展示团队宗旨：我们的创作之路是疯狂的，我们的表演空间是自由的，我们对戏剧艺术的追求与热爱是永无止境的——Drama Kaleido永远闪耀！
groups.C_DescriptionE: “The word, the word above all, is truly magical, not only by its meaning, but by its artful manipulation.” Drama is the foundation of human art forms. From William Shakespeare to Henrik Johan Ibsen, thousands of play writers have led us into the charm of drama. And now it’s our obligation for us to inherit their legacy. In the last semester, we brought <Rebirth in Heaven> on the stage of Shanghai Drama Art Center, which is written, directed, and acted all on our own. Incidentally, that debut ended up being one of the most magical and pivotal performances of all in the history of Drama Club. From Drama Club to Drama Kaleido, diverse genres and forms will be blend into this kaleidoscope of performing art. From the international campus to the home campus, we are a bigger team and family. No matter where we are, and no matter what we are called, our passion and devotion for drama will never change. Vive la Drama Keleido!

grecord.C_Reflection:
Feb.22
Today’s our first club meeting. Percy introduced this year’s plan to rest of the members. We’re not rehearsing any plays this term, but we will look into classic works written by famous playwriters coming from ancient Greek to 20th century America.Then we took a few minutes checking the list and chose our four favorite topics. The next part was the reading session where we all read through the first and second chapter of The Anatomy of Drama (1976) by Martin Esslin. And for the first time, we discussed the nature of drama based on questions “what is drama?” “why must we act out a story rather than telling it?”... Those were all fun questions that I never thought about in the past, which seems strange cuz we named ourselves Kaleido Theatre.

Feb.29
We played an impromtu drama game called “Hey, Catch this baby!”, from a book that introduces all sorts of impromtu games.The rules are when everybody stands in a circle and randomly choose another person, shouting “ Hey! Catch this (_)”, pretending they’re throwing this thing to that student. And the student come up with another object and continue the process. This game is desigend to train actors’ ability to react to random things happened on the stage and also a practice for no object performances. Then Amber and Percy introduced three types of ancient Greek dramas, the origin, their special staging, characteristics, and Sophocles the playwriter.

May 8
We had no choice but to turn to online activities. We played an impromtu drama game called “Blind Line”, from a book that introduces all sorts of impromtu games. The two impromptu actors would be kicked out of the meeting room where the rest of the audience come up with 10 random words, phrases or short sentences, and two characters. Then the actors join in the group and act impromptously while must put those ten words in to sentences and act naturally. This trains the creativity and ability to make up staging conversations. Then Tiger, Robinson, and Justyce introduced the Greek play Oedipus by Sophocles, and later we acted several parts of the play.Greek plays love the theme of the combat between Human and Gods, and almost always eulogize the human nature.

Mar.22
We played an impromptu drama game called “Blind Line”, from a book that introduces all sorts of impromptu games. This trains the creativity and ability to make up staging conversations. Then Percy and Amber introduced the British renaissance dramas and Mr.William Shakespeare. His life was so twisted and dramatic and created so many famous lines and scenes and characters, which all inspired the later play writes. Entering the theatre at 20s and stood up straight in London theatres for 40 years, creating so many classics.He could turn a really boring and tedious poem to a classy play, with deep connotation, dilemmas like 2Bornot2B .

Mar.29
We played an impromptu drama game called “Blind Line”, from a book that introduces all sorts of impromptu games. This trains the creativity and ability to make up staging conversations. Then Thomas, Howard and Selina introduced Shakespeare’s play Antony and Cleopetra. It was not a common play that we hear of, but a play based on historical events that Shakespeare wrote in his later life. Thomas brought us into the background of the war between the “triumvirate” , while Selina and Howard dug deep into the characters. This was a long play with 5 scenes, and Shakespeare wrote it under a very broad context but could balance the complexity between wars and love.

groups.C_DescriptionC:
Hello 这里是工学美感社！
- 校内活动通过项目制作、社长和社员们的小讲座等，拓宽对于艺术于科学的看法，学习一些把科技与艺术结合的技能，理解现代艺术
- 校外活动工作坊，与上海久牵志愿者服务社和樱花园合作，以艺术为媒介，提供stem课程（science technology engineering maths），启发小朋友们、拓宽他们的视野
- 学期期中期末后参观艺术展，放松心情的同时，拓宽视野
groups.C_DescriptionE:
Hello here is staAm!
-School Activities Broaden the perception of art in science, learn skills to combine technology with art, and understand modern art through project production, small lectures by presidents and members
-out-of-school activity workshops, in collaboration with Shanghai JiuLong Volunteer Service and Cherry Blossom Garden, provide stem courses (science technology engineering maths) in art to inspire and broaden the horizons of children
-At the end of the semester, visit the art exhibition to relax and broaden your horizons

grecord.C_Reflection:
6/4 
That day we continued to made a mechanism equipment that we haven’t finished in last semester. This equipment looks like a labyrinth and is designed to made a small ball roll down by using numbers of gears and devices. We first planned to cut the cardboard into thin and long pieces and use them to made the edge of the gear, and we also draw circles on the cardboard to made the main part of the gear. That day, we mainly cut these circle down and we planned to made their edges next time.

6/11
That time, we continued the work that we hadn’t finished the previous time and finished the making of the gears. We planned to make four gears in all and last time we’ve already made the main parts of these circles. Therefore, this time we made the edges of the circles and stick them all together to become the gears. Since this was the last time of our club’s regular activity in this semester, we also told the 10th graders that they would become the club leader and vice-leader in the next semester. I .sincerely hope that they can become a responsible leader in the next semester

3/12
That was the first online regular activity in this semester. Due to the covid-19 epidemic, we were forced to try a new way of organizing the club activity, which is the online meeting by using an application named zoom. It allowed us to see and hear other via network and everyone are able to download it freely, which is one of the reasons why we chose it as our online meeting application. That day, we made a basic introduction about our plan in this semester and also recorded the online lecture that we’ve designed for the primary school children last semester.

3/19
The online lecture, which we used to called as “workshop”, was designed for primary school children and taught them the knowledge about both arts and physics. We recorded the lecture last time and this time we set out everyone’s role and I was in charge of editing the recording clip and turn it into a complete online lecture clip. The video would be sent to the Dingxiang Community and Jiuqian Volunteer Community so that they can play the video for the children.

4/2
That day we made some small adjustments towards the detailed plot which was given by the R&S club, and we decided to delete part of the plot and add some more information about the scientific knowledge such as physics and chemistry. For example, we add a plot about washing dishes which used the knowledge of detergent. It contains surfactants and emulsifiers, which are lipophilic and disperse the oil. The surfactant has the emulsifying ability, which can emulsify the oil into small oil droplets and disperse them in the water to prevent the oil droplets from re gathering.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 社团旨在通过推荐解析⾼质量电影、普及电影界近期活动、介绍优秀演员、导演，以及科普专业电影术语和理论等方式，让同学能够脱离“娱乐休闲”的框架来看电影。 我们希望能够培养这样一种意识：不要只看电影，要尊重电影，要质疑电影，也要颂扬电影。借助社团活动，本社将会在校园内宣扬一种不一样的电影态度，并拓宽同学的眼界以及对艺术、⽣活乃至世界的认知。
groups.C_DescriptionE: By recommending and analyzing high-quality films, popularizing recent activities in the film industry, introducing excellent actors and directors, and introducing the terms and theories of popular science films, the club aims to enable students to watch films outside the framework of "entertainment and leisure". We want to foster an attitude of not just watching movies, but respecting and questioning them . With the help of club activities, the club will promote a different attitude towards film on campus and broaden students' horizon and cognition of art, life and even the world.

grecord.C_Reflection: It is our last club meeting this semester. We conclude our jobs within this year. Due the pandemic effect, our microfilm "Bubble" was delayed and planned to continue next semester. We also watched the micro film we shot together last semester as inspiration, hoping that after the epidemic we can successfully continue the shooting. Finally, as we all agreed, Lucy will be the club leader next semester. We promise to help her finishing the microfilm project. Thanks for the whole year hard work for Dogma 95.

This is our last club meeting of the term. We will finish the work within this year. Due to the impact of the epidemic, our mini-film "Bubble" has been postponed and is planned to continue next semester. We also watched the micro film we shot together last semester. I hope we can continue shooting smoothly after the epidemic. Finally, as we all agreed, Lucy will be the leader of the club next term. We agreed to help her with the microfilm project. Thank you Dogma 95 for your hard work throughout the year.

After finishing online quiz, Dogma 95 gave all the club members an opportunity to relax and entertain. We watched a few classic iconic scenes such as Hitchcock's bombs under the desk, Leonardo DiCaprio's cheers in The Great Gatsby. Then we had a little discussion about the reason behind those scenes and why these scenes are famous among the world and can be recorded for a long time. All the members gave their own perspectives and understanding about the techniques, the meanings of the film.

After completing an online test, Dogma 95 gives all club members a chance to relax and have fun. We watched some classic iconic scenes like Hitchcock detonating a bomb under a table and Leonardo DiCaprio cheering in The Great Gatsby. We then discuss the reasons behind these scenes and more things like why they are famous around the world and can be recorded for a long time. All members give their own personal views and understandings of the technology and meaning of the film.

The microfilm “Bubble” will be continued this semester, so we had a discussion about most things we need to finish. First, the theme is planned to connect to the school and a miserable male high school student. Thus, the scene is going to take place in our school. Then all the members came up with different ideas about this topic, such as the boy believed in Christ, the boy is broken in heart by a girl, the boy only loves piano in his life. All the ideas are fascinating and inspiring.

groups.C_DescriptionC: Museholic翻唱社的创办旨在给予喜爱音乐、唱歌的高中生展示自我的平台，结识志同道合的音乐爱好者。用音乐和歌声点亮校内外生活，用音乐和歌声发光发热。
groups.C_DescriptionE: Museholic Singing Club aims to provide a platform for every students who love music and singing to show their strengths and passion. We use our songs to lighten the campus, and we use our songs to do charity work as well.

grecord.C_Reflection: I am really excited to meet everyone of Museholic 2021. It is my pleasure to be the club leader this semester. During the recruitment we saw so many candidates’ passion to music and their passion to get into our club. I arranged some little games at the beginning of the club meeting to let people get to know each other. I am lucky to have rappers, acapella, so many can play musical instruments so I am very happy to see a great variety of talents. I can’t wait till the the next club meeting.

After nearly one-year of work and activities, finally, we come again to the point that we reelect our club leaders, which are two vice-presidents and one president. Four of our members applied for the reelection, and today, during the meeting, we let each of the candidate present their thoughts, which include why they want to be the club leaders of our MuseHolic singing club and also what they wish to do if they become the club leaders. Each of the candidate provides us with great ideas and builds grand and seemingly feasible blueprints. The voting process will be online-voting, and for our club advisor, we also send him video recording of the candidates’ speeches to invite him to vote. No matter who are going to be the club leaders, I believe MuseHolic will keep getting better.

grecord.C_Theme: Second time of preparation of charity
grecord.C_Reflection: This is the second time for us to prepare for our performances of Charity. We feel very honored to have our advisor as well as music teacher with us to give us advice. It’s very obvious that every member of our club had practiced their performances during this week, and quite a lot of problems which we pointed out last time have been solved and improved. Therefore, it’s now the time to make the performances near “perfection”. Our adviser really gives us a lot of precious ideas about our shows. For example, one suggestion for us is to try to interact with the audiences instead of just recreating ourselves on the stage. We believe that if we’re able to make changes in all those aspects which we still have room for improvement, we’d do a good job and perform well on Charity.

2017.10.9
Today we had our first club meeting. We started with self-introductions about our basic information, favorites and type of music we prefer. The new members were still a little bit shy and awkward, but the others activated the mood well.
Then I started telling them the activities we planned for the future. 
First is the weekly activity, we would have a meeting on every Monday. Which I would randomly select 1-2 members to do presentation about the singer, band, song, lyricist or any type of musician they adore. The form of presentation could be with PPT, or simply sing songs of the musician. But it has to be at least 5 minutes. 
Second is the monthly task, members have to post a song every month on any singing app available. Also, we would hold 1-2 lunchtime performance in a semester.
Third is the annual activities, we would make 1-2 albums in a year. Also, we would plan and hold the annual MuseHolic charity at the end of the 2nd semester.
At the end of the first meeting, we decided that one of the new member and myself would give presentation next week.

Today, we had a club meeting. We discussed about several things. 
All the club members were reminded about the routine rule because they sometimes play phones when others are talking and performing. I think it is necessary for everyone to show their respect to their peers.
Furthermore, I found that most of our club members do not have enough enthusiasm on our club so that they all felt boring when we are having meeting. I reflected a lot. So I decided to have a discussion with all the members in order to make a better meeting methods. During this meeting, we had some solutions, such as a medley of songs, topic-songs, Arabella and games. In next club activity, I am going to establish our new planning.
At last, I let all the people to think about whether we should hold a charity next semester and think about some forms of charity.

groups.C_DescriptionC:
O-Original 最初的 A-Ardent 热爱的 U-Ultimate 最终的 
本社团致力于帮助热爱舞蹈的同学找回最初的初心并达到最终的目标
本学年的活动时间为每周五下午17：00-18：00
groups.C_DescriptionE:
O-Original A-Ardent U-Ultimate
We are committed to helping students who love dancing find their original heart and reach the ultimate goal.
The activity time of this academic year is every Friday 17:00-18:00.

grecord.C_Reflection: We practiced our dance for the performance for the clubs admission day, Ahead of our recruitment performance, we dove into rehearsals with full-on dedication. The practice space was buzzing with everyone contributing their unique skills to refine choreography and tunes. We hashed out the nitty-gritty, from perfecting dance moves to getting dialogues spot on. It wasn't just about the stage; these sessions strengthened our bonds. When the curtains finally lifted, our collaborative effort shone through, leaving us and the audience buzzing with the energy of a well-executed showcase

At noon on February the twenty-third, we finally meet each other at school after the long winter break. We discussed what we are about to do for the next semester and we all expressed our opinion on the arrangement of activities. As leaders and seniors in our dance club, we help the other students gain confidence in expressing their future plans. Then we encourage them to actively run for the next chairman or president of OAU Dance Club. We hope everyone could have high morale for the new semester and enjoy dancing as well.

The actual date is the second of march. We gathered again for practicing the dance we are about to perform for the charity sell. We choose an emotional song called “cry for me” which fits the topic of the charity sell. We want to express that we should shed tears for the less fortunate and we should unite together when we face difficulties. The dance has a difficult movement and it is consist of nine people altogether. As the leader I had a tough time arranging the changing of formation. But my friends in the club helped me out. I couldn’t have finish the dance without anyone missing.

grecord.C_Theme: Preparing for the performance at charity sell
grecord.C_Reflection: The actual date is the third of march. I went to OA Ultimate Dance Studio with my classmates. We would have a performance soon and we have to prepare for the performance in a short time period. We first reviewed the dance "Cry for me" by the Korean pop group twice, because we had already learnt it yesterday. It was fun remembering what we used to dance and I enjoyed it a lot. "Cry for me" is a very lively but emotional song. Dancing to it is also interesting and relaxing. I practiced it and we finally gained the confidence to perform on the next day . I was very looking forward to it.

The actual date is the afternoon of the 15th of December. We practice all the dances together. For me, perhaps the most difficult is to remember the actions. Most of the time , I need to practice slowly and over and over again in front of the mirror to achieve the best result. Especially the La Vie en Rose dance, the number of people was up to 13. The formation and movements were quite complicated. The rehearsal could not be completed within two weeks without the participation of OAU members.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 为游戏正名，我们希望更多人能够理解并研究游戏中的艺术。游戏不仅仅是一种娱乐，更有作为第九艺术的潜质。

grecord.C_Reflection: By designing the character of the game, i can see how the character influences the story and  make the story better. While looking at the good character, which have complex characteristics, the twists and turns of the plot can be shown. Additionally, the set of the background can also contribute the the devbelopment of the character. I create a virtual background :In 1789, the supposed success of the French Revolution was interrupted by an unexpected visitor. The royalists have been given an epic boost by a group of time travelers of unknown purpose, who are suspected to be psychic beings from the age of 30k. At that age, the character might have some special ability or have the heart to resist those time travelers and overthrow the crown.

First, we designed the game around a verb, which is called "扎". Around this word "zha", we decided to design a game on the basis of fencing.  At first, we thought of designing the stage  in 2.5d vision.  Then, we choose to use the blood volume measuring instead of score measuring in reality in order to bring the entertainence. The background sits in an arena. The whole body is the target, and there are some weaknesses throught the body: Head, neck, cock, joints. The main method of attacking is thorning. Thorning are seperately light stab and heavy stab. The direction of the attack can be controlled by the mouse and the hand shank.  Some combo can be made through interesting combination.  The effect is limb fracture, blood  explosion, camera shake.

This activity is about experimenting with game design. We design around the theme of Rock Paper Scissors, divide into groups, and create novel games with various elements that we love. At the same time, we have to design a variety of complete game Settings, mechanics, gameplay, etc. At the end of the day, what we're showing is a dominant FPS game, where both sides and AI are in an opposing, rock-paper-scissors relationship. The attacker is the scissors, the defender is the rock, and the AI is the paper. At first, the attacker will have fewer reinforcements, but as the number of points increases, the reinforcements will increase. However, the defense starts with a lot of reinforcements, but this amount is fixed. Finally, as the number of points held by the defender decreases, the Ai held by the defender increases. These three relations form a kind of antagonistic relationship

groups.C_DescriptionC:
MoDi (Modeling Dimension) 3D建模社旨在用数字化的形式和无尽的想象力进行新的创造；在这里我们将进一步探索其魅力，去了解更多的建模技术，亲身体验其中的乐趣。我们会学习建模软件以Blender为主，也会了解建模相关技术如VR，3D打印等等以及其他建模方式如航拍扫描测绘技术。
在活动中，那些看似遥不可及的梦想都将转换成为触手可及的目标。MoDi 3D建模社为世外所有热爱建模的同学们提供一个机会和平台。
groups.C_DescriptionE:
MoDi (Modeling Dimension) 3D Modeling Club aims to create new things with digital forms and endless imagination; here we will explore the fascination, learn more about modeling techniques, and experience the fun. We will learn about modeling software, mainly Blender, but also about modeling-related technologies such as VR, 3D printing, and other modeling methods such as aerial scanning and mapping techniques.
Our club provides an opportunity and a platform for all students who love modeling.

grecord.C_Reflection: As the inaugural club event of the academic year, students had the opportunity to introduce themselves and gain insights into each other's modeling abilities. The club president (who is me) presented the activity plan for the semester, generating excitement and anticipation among the members. There was a shared sense of curiosity and enthusiasm towards the first unit of the new school year, which focused on wearable devices. Everyone was eager to delve into this fascinating topic and explore its possibilities.

During this club activity, the president not only unveiled the activity plan for the semester but also introduced the captivating fashion unit to all members. The president began by outlining the timeline and assigning tasks to everyone, ensuring a smooth and organized workflow. To enhance understanding, a video demonstration was presented, showcasing the process of transforming tangible objects into abstract designs. This creative approach allowed members to explore their artistic abilities and create unique works of art. The combination of practical skills and artistic expression ignited a sense of excitement and inspiration among the participants, setting the stage for a memorable and productive unit.

During this club activity, we had the privilege of following the guidance of a professional modeling teacher. Under their expert instruction, we delved into the intricacies of nomad modeling software, learning its fundamental operational functions. With newfound knowledge, we embarked on creating our own simple headwear designs. The teacher's comprehensive teaching enabled us to grasp the techniques required to express our unique design concepts through the software. It was an empowering experience as we discovered the power of digital tools in bringing our creative visions to life. This activity served as a stepping stone for us to explore further possibilities in the realm of digital modeling and design.

New Anime Screening and Review
Members gathered for a screening of a newly released anime series, followed by a review and discussion session. The screening provided an opportunity for members to immerse themselves in the latest anime content, while the subsequent discussion allowed for the exchange of opinions and analyses. Participants shared their impressions of the series, discussing characters, plot development, and visual aesthetics. The event not only enriched members' understanding of contemporary anime but also sparked engaging conversations and diverse perspectives within the club.

Anime Dance Collaboration
The club facilitated a collaborative anime dance project, where members worked together to choreograph and perform a group dance routine. The project encouraged teamwork, creativity, and coordination, as members combined their individual talents to create a captivating performance. The collaborative nature of the project fostered a sense of unity and mutual support, leaving participants energized and inspired by the collective effort and the joy of dancing together.The collaborative nature of the project fostered a sense of unity and mutual support, leaving participants energized and inspired by the collective effort and the joy of dancing together.

Anime Adaptation Discussion
Members delved into discussions about anime adaptations of popular manga, light novels, and games. The session involved exploring the challenges and opportunities in translating source material to the animated medium. Participants shared their perspectives on faithful adaptations, creative liberties, and the impact of adaptation choices on storytelling. The exchange of ideas sparked thoughtful reflections and deepened members' understanding of the adaptation process, leaving them eager to explore and analyze future anime adaptations.The exchange of ideas sparked thoughtful reflections and deepened members' understanding of the adaptation process, leaving them eager to explore and analyze future anime adaptations.

Anime Dance Performance
In a culminating event, the club organized an anime dance performance, showcasing the skills and enthusiasm of its members. Participants presented choreographed routines from various anime series, captivating the audience with their energy and passion for anime culture. The performance not only celebrated the art of anime dance but also provided a platform for members to express their creativity and dedication. The event left both performers and audience members exhilarated, fostering a sense of community and shared appreciation for anime-inspired dance.

Anime Plot Development Showcase
The club hosted a showcase where members presented their developed anime plotlines. Each team shared their unique story concepts, discussing character arcs, thematic elements, and narrative twists. The showcase not only highlighted the diverse creative talents within the club but also provided an opportunity for constructive feedback and appreciation. Members engaged in thoughtful discussions, offering insights and suggestions to further enrich each storyline. The event left participants inspired by the collective creativity and eager to refine their plotlines for potential future development.

groups.C_DescriptionC:
我们是中国舞社，旨在给所有热爱中国舞的同学一个展示的平台，宣传中国舞的故事性和古典美。
我们有丰富的A时间和C时间，欢迎所有热爱中国舞的同学。平时活动包括但不限于：舞蹈排练，欣赏舞蹈节目，参与活动表演……
我们用舞蹈讲述故事。

汉文化，不局限于汉族文化与汉服，而是中华五千年文化的包容。在“衣食筑行”四方面，我们从今天的视角，回溯它的变化。样式纷繁的汉服饰，寄托心意的传统食物，具有地方特点的民居，都是我们生活在汉文化中的体现。基于学期中开展的活动，我们还会在学期末制作汉文化旅游指南，将汉文化的影响力进一步扩大，使大家真正了解、参与、传承汉文化。

与汉文化社一起，在这场浩大的文化浪潮中寻找新的立足点。
groups.C_DescriptionE:
Chinese culture is not limited to Han culture and its clothing, but the composition of 5000-year-culture. In the four aspects of Clothing, Food, Architecture and Transportation, we look back on its changes from today's perspective. The various styles of the costumes, traditional food and houses with local characteristics are the symbol of the Chinese culture. Based on the activities carried out, we will also make a guide to Chinese culture tourism at the end of the semester, to further expand the influence of Chinese culture. So that our people can truly understand, participate in and inherit the Chinese culture.

Together, a new foothold will we seek in this huge cultural tide.

grecord.C_Reflection: This time, the activity of the Han Culture Society was held outside the campus. It was a teahouse for tea tasting, and there was also a place for photography in the shop. Most of the students who participated in this activity changed into different types of Han clothing or han element clothing, wei jin style, terminalia chebula skirt, Ming dynasty horse skirt, etc. The hair accessories on their heads included frifria, coloured glaze, paper silk and other materials. In addition to the planning of the theme of "Six arts", there is also an investigation and report on the theme of Chinese herbal medicine. Because mathematics was included in the six arts, it was replaced by medicine by consensus. The arrangement of "six arts" is as follows: Ritual: Xu Changran is responsible for the instruction and teaching of embroidery in addition to the basic content and movements. Music: Tang Sui Xin will be in charge, traditional repertoire and instruments will also be involved. Royal: Director Hu Tianpei, in addition to the equestrian part will also expand to include fairy tales and comparisons. Archery: Xu Ruiyuan is in charge of archery. Besides, ancient recreation methods and architectural styles can also be explained in this unit. Book: Calligraphy is run by xu Pan students, the evolution of font can also be discussed in this section. Medical Science: Compendium of Materia medica is in progress, and later possible compilation of related perimeters or stories can also be placed in this unit.

This activity is a large lecture of our Chinese Culture Club, and then Tang Ruixin, a student from grade 10, will give us the main explanation, and the president and vice president will supplement her. She shared Musical Instruments with us, and the instruments we shared were chime bells, pipa, guzheng, guqin, and suona. Through her lecture, I know that Chinese classical Musical Instruments are generally classified by "eight tones". "Eight sounds" refers to the earliest method of classifying Musical Instruments according to their materials, which was first described in The Book "The Rites of Zhou: Chungong". It is divided into eight categories: jin, Shi, Earth, leather, silk, wood, pao and bamboo. "Soil" : xun; "Leather" category: drum; "Silk" category: qin, sere, erhu, pipa and so on; "Pao" category: Sheng; "Bamboo" : xiao, flute, etc. Looking forward to the next event!

At noon, in order to prepare for the community fair the next day, we went to make tea bags for a whole noon. In the process of making tea bags, we read books about tea and tried to mix tea recipes ourselves. The president brought us the raw materials of tea, including medlar, lemon slices, dried rose, etc., and we used these raw materials to make the tea we wanted. In the process of blending, we had a lot of problems, we didn't know what the specific effect of the medicine was, and at the same time, we were worried that the tea wouldn't taste good. However, under the leadership of the president and vice president, all of us finally prepared very delicious tea, and we also prepared strange tea with rich imagination. This activity greatly exercised our creativity! Looking forward to the club show the next day!

At noon today, there was a community fair. As a part of the participating community, we sold our own tea recipes and tea bags. The drink was immediately welcomed with open arms. We gave the cups with tea materials to the students, and then asked the students to brew them with the hot water of the school. Many students have come to buy our tea bags because of their unique taste and strong fragrance. Meanwhile, freshly brewed steaming hot tea is perfect for warm hands in winter. Not only students, many teachers also came to buy our drinks, and one foreign teacher bought ten cups of these drinks and said he would share them with his classmates. We were very happy about this and gave him a 50% discount. This kind of activity is really very interesting! Hopefully there will be more!

The activities of the club in this issue are about herbal medicine and the market afterwards. We asked everyone to investigate and understand the herbal medicine. Everyone introduced a herbal medicine and tried to mix the tea with the help of herbal tea and other auxiliary books. We tried the proportion of the herbal medicine at home and made efforts to prepare for the charity CAS market later. Related reference books also include compendium of Herbs.In addition, the previous tweets about relevant content are also in preparation. At the same time, the information about the ancient musical instrument in China has also been in progress.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 我们是世界外国语中学的GI服装杂志社 (Grab It Fashion Design and Magazine)，在两年前由一群热衷时尚的人们创建。社团主要分划为两个部门：设计部，模特部。每一次活动都有两个部门共同参与完成，传统项目分别为：一年一度的Fashion Show，以及出版一年一辑的Fashion Magazine。为了这两项目的进行前期准备活动为：设计师与模特分组，量身设计一套服装，画草图，选面料，找裁缝或自己动手完成服装的制作；设计师为模特搭配服装并集体外出街拍，街拍照片、设计师手稿及采访类文章由编辑部统一制作成杂志。
groups.C_DescriptionE:
We are Grab It Fashion Design and Magazine, founded by a group of students passionate in fashion two years ago. 

GI is mainly divide into two departments: Design and Model conducting all activities together. 

Traditional Activities: Fashion Show conducted every school year (designers team up with the models to create a wearable outfit for the show); Fashion Magazine every school year (designers match clothes for models’ street snap; photos, sketches and articles will be edited into a magazine by the editors). 

Routine: Fashion Sketches every month for discussion; meeting of all three departments; lectures from seniors.

grecord.C_Theme: 2.18 Wechat Article and the idea development.
grecord.C_Reflection: art for the art sake it probably the sentence that can best express our idea for this zine. We want to have a revolution for the magazine. We make zine instead of magazine which zine is a more creative and personal publication. We thought about this idea for a long time and finally we decided to make a wechat article to collect everyone's soul instead of just showing our's. We are really looking forward to all the works we will receive in the future.

This is the most difficult and time-consuming part for the zine. We- the GI designers used our knowledge learned from the zine work shop and created our own zine. Each designer has their own style for collage which I think it fine. We wanted to show the variety of human including ourselves. We spent hours to due In Design a Software by Adobe to do it. It is very time-consuming. The only work let is to organize all the collage together and present the finally work.

All designers are required observe very well about their life and the life of others in order to collect the different souls of different individuals. On weekends we asked for the sole artists or photographers to ask them for their works or just some daily pics. The collection process is very interesting since we can get to know more about another individual, another soul. We did this for every weekends and collected a huge range of pics for different people.I am really looking forward to the zine we are going to make out of these materials

Since  we had collected so many pics from all the different people. We have to record all the credits and the sources. We spent a lot of time to download and organized them. Then, we separate them in to different groups in order to do further distribution. Every designer took a part of it and do their own creative collage by themselves. I am really looking forward to the work them created.I am really looking forward to the zine we are going to make out of these materials as well

grecord.C_Theme: 5.29 catch up conference and show video
grecord.C_Reflection: We watch the 2020 Hi-ED show from Martin Margiela by John Galliano. It is a very impressive and visually impactful showed. John reused some of the iconic elements created by Martin Margiela such as the use of transparent tapes to show the process of a garment was made. Lately, we brainstorm about the show. Everybody comment on the show. In the following time, we catch up about what we are going to do and what it our future plan.I am really looking forward the zine we are going to create

groups.C_DescriptionC:
围炉夜话，诗色漫旅。
因爱而寻找星辰掩藏的碎金，
因梦拾起那些看似脆弱的创作梦，让它们重获新生。
设计与文字，让轻率得如打草稿的生活苏醒；
毕竟，文学是人学。
groups.C_DescriptionE: We picked up scattered fragments of stars from the depth of the abyss. “ The Stargazers is a campus club which devotes in original literature and art. Explore our uniqueness in expressing your thoughts and imaginary pieces with the pencil in hand. We strive to create a wonderland for art and literature lovers. We are one of the only clubs on campus who focuses on designing peripheral products. Our products sold in Charity Fair and online services are also available. Stargazers conduct two theme events each semester. Including honor story conducting for Halloween and antique personification last year.

grecord.C_Reflection: I and the president planned related matters concerning our company's participation in charity market, and I also participated in product design and pattern drawing. However, my job involves more than simple drawing. Finding sellers, determining the material and quantity of products, controlling prices and issuing invoices are also my tasks. In this club fair, we try to restore the plot and world view of the play through our original products, so that non-club members can also experience the theme atmosphere. One of the most successful is a bookmark called Moon Lottery, which is also a laser lottery ticket with a chance of winning other items for sale at half the price or less. The marketing strategy was very successful, the product sold well and made our club a lot of money.

This activity is an experimental linkage with GI Society. I and the president of THE GI Club were in charge. We were classmates. One day, we came up with an idea in tacit agreement and successfully realized it.
