Autumn this year is much longer than usual, there are many fresh leaves on the streets in December, plus the end of the year, we decided to combine the two elements of the fallen leaves and the New Year, to make a tree. This is an experimental interactive art installation, and there will be more similar activities in the future to enhance the humanistic atmosphere of the campus.
We spent plenty of time collecting leaves and sticking them onto the tree and decorating it.

Today during the night-talk section we came up to an idea of the monthly club campaign of October. To arouse the activity of our new fellow club members, and to experience the charisma of literature as well, we decided to run a campaign call the Desolate Island Plan. In this activity, there are 9 characters, each will have contradictions and hostility against one another. The students will pick up (sub in) one character and play that part due to our story basis, yet they're also allowed to make their own decisions as long as it fits in the personality of the character. Today we basically determined the form of this campaign.

On April 28th, we continued to share the short stories. This time we first read the revised version of Jenni’s story about a boy and a dragon. Her initial version is a little bit plain, and I advised her to change the narrative order, and add a song sung by the dragon to add to the feeling of fantasy. The second story shared is a science-fiction written by Amanda. She made a slide to share her story herself, and she introduced her inspiration at first. She shared some of her opinions on science-fiction, and showed a paragraph written by Cixin Liu. Then she read her story. I thought it was beautifully written. She wrote about an astronaut who grew in a world with a force called “dexter force”, and after the astronaut broke the record of space-travelling and arrived at a planet when forces completely balanced with each other, she realized how beautiful this equilibrium was. I thought it shows human’s pursuit for a higher state of reality in all forms. Other club members discuss interesting innovation in science fictions.

On March 17th, I informed my club members of my plan for poetry festival this semester and asked for their opinion. I told them that the change we made this year is that we were going to collaborate with YK Pao school so that we might have more contributors from different regions. After I discussed with the leaders of the poetry society of YK Pao, we decided to increase the type of contribution. This year we are also going to collect poem translation, poem recitation, and poem calligraphic work besides original poems. The main issue is that whether we should ask contributors of other types of work create their work based on the showcase competing poems, or they can select their own poems to translate, recite and write. The advantage for the former is making the different components of the competition more closely connected, but it has the disadvantage is that the re-creators will be deprived of much freedom in creation. In the end we chose the latter.

groups.C_DescriptionC:
香蕉屋是在2018年由三个热爱美食的男人创立的，作为世外唯一一个美食类社团，我们的主要活动有新品测评、美食制作以及视频和推文。社团创建的初衷是让同学们体会到料理的乐趣，领略各式各样的美食，并提高大家的动手能力。我们会在学校的各种节日周中制作食物，也会定期举办活动，活动场所在学校或是邻里汇。微信公众号：BNNY香蕉屋，B站名称：香蕉屋バナナ，在这里可以查看我们社团过去的活动。
提供C与S的时间，欢迎你的加入。
groups.C_DescriptionE: Hi! This is BNNY, which is created by three men in 2018, we are the only food club in WFLA. The original intention of the club was to allow students to experience the joy of cooking, to appreciate all kinds of food, and to improve everyone's practical ability. Our main activities include new product evaluation, food production, videos and tweets. We will make food during the school's various festival weeks, and we will also hold regular activities. The venues are in the school or in the neighborhood. We can provide time of C and S, welocme to BNNY.

grecord.C_Reflection: Today is the club demonstration day on which every club in WFLA possesses a chance to show its achievements in one-semester time. It is not an exception for our club. In advance, we discussed the production of what kind of food could represent our club best, and the first idea was to bake a dessert that is quite complicated with an appealling appearance. However, after the teacher reminded us that we can't make food at the locale to present. Hence, we rediscussed and determined to shoot a video on the production of cookies, because we believed that it is the food that can brings people with pure happiness and enjoyment. On the club show, our exhibition stand was visited by quite a few students and teachers, and their smiles made us believe that our work in this semester should be  worth that.

"Pie day" is near at hand. As a club that celebrates the festivals worldwide, it's a good opportunity for us to demounstrate something related to the "pie". What we pay attention is the production of pies, since there's a common tradition abroad to enjoy pies on this day. Blueberry pie seems to be an interesting choice, and we soon purchased all the ingredients we need, marching to the Lin lihui. Although the introduction on how to make a blueberry pie is quite simple, when it comes the time that we need to figure out by our hand, challenges come. For instance, the butter isn't likely to melt. However, we aren't overwhelmed by the problems, and different club members work out different solution while confronting these problems. Eventually, a fresh blueberry pie is baked and we don't miss the chance to have a taste on our "fruits of labour".

We’ve long planned to make a big “deal”. After surfing on the Internet in the weekend, we came to an agreement to make Souffle together. Souffle is a kind of French dessert, and it is well known as the most difficult dessert to make worldwide. We prepared all the neccessary ingredients and brought it to Lin Lihui early in the afternoon. Very soon, all the club members turned from chatting nonsense into taking responsibility for their own jobs in that place. Some are washing ingredients by hands, some are beating the butter with sugar and the others are watching the video as well as preparing the following steps methodically. Finally, we accomplish our common goal to make good-looking and delicious Souffle cake. During the process, we realize the essence of collaborating on completing a task in a group.

groups.C_DescriptionC:
一起去窥探翻页间的秘密
去寻找隐藏在城市角落的俗世故事
一起在街角，行读人文
行读社是一个以人文行走为主要活动的可爱社团。我们希望够让虚构的文学世界能够照进现实世界，让同学能够不仅仅从书中去看到一个个故事，更能够通过一次次实地走访，通过倾听一段段口述的过往，去了解，去感知作者当时的经历。由此，对生活、对阅读的作品，都能够有更为深入的感知。我们将从上海开始，记录与宣传即将消失的文化与物质，并将其重新呈现在大众眼前。通过但不限于：地点走访、作者采访等方式，发扬上海的传统文化，留住文化中美妙的记忆。
groups.C_DescriptionE:
Let's peep into the secrets between the pages
To find the secular stories hidden in the corner of the city
On the street corner, let read together 
The Thinker is a lovely community with humanistic walking as its main activity. We can not only understand the real world through the oral interview, but also understand the real world through the oral interview. Therefore, we can have a deeper perception of life and reading works. Starting from Shanghai, we will record and publicize the disappearing culture and material, and re present them to the public. Through but not limited to: site visit, author interview and other ways to carry forward the traditional culture of Shanghai, retain the wonderful memory of culture.

grecord.C_Theme: March 7, 2023 - Thinker's CORE Semester Planning Event
grecord.C_Reflection: On March 7, 2023, the members of Thinker's CORE gathered for a highly productive semester planning event. With a shared vision of organizing captivating activities, we engaged in thoughtful discussions to determine the focal points for the upcoming semester. Through collaborative brainstorming, we identified intriguing topics that would challenge our intellect and promote personal growth. Moreover, we meticulously outlined a series of exciting side projects, including the planning of an Oridebate competition in collaboration with the debate club. This event served as a solid foundation for an enriching and impactful semester ahead.

grecord.C_Theme: 2022.11.15 core member meeting about the City Walk route
grecord.C_Reflection: After the meeting with Mrs. Wan, we had a general plan for the City Walk. On the evening of November 15, the three core members had a meeting online. During the meeting, we discussed for a long time, taking into account the architecture and roadside food, and finally selected four connected roads as the main route, including Huaihai Zhong Road, Wukang Road, Fuxing Zhong Road, and Hunan Road. These four roads are connected, so it's easy to move around. Then, we each divided the work to find out the places worth visiting on each road.

The Humanities Walk gathered at the Hengfu Landscape Museum and led the members to learn about the history of the Hengfu neighborhood on a macro level. After the macroscopic exploration, we will go deep into the buildings in the Hengfu neighborhood and visit the buildings that we have researched in preparation so that we can feel the old buildings that used to shine in history. Those who were interested in photography brought their own cameras to form a visual record for later output in the neighborhood. At the same time, local residents (residents of the lanes or old stores, shopkeepers, and grocery owners) were interviewed at random and recorded in the form of audio recordings to bring history "alive" through communication.

grecord.C_Theme: 2022.11.2 Discussion with the instructor about the City Walk
grecord.C_Reflection: After the prep work for City Walk was basically done, our core member had an online meeting with Mr. Wan in the evening. In the meeting, we talked about the plan for the City Walk with the teacher. Our plan was still preliminary and not very in-depth. Ms. Wan gave us very detailed feedback after listening to it. First of all, she mentioned that the City Walk should not just be a casual walk, but should have depth and goals, and should be rewarding at the end of the event. Secondly, we can use a more innovative and diverse format for City Walk, such as group activities, otherwise, a large group of people will not move freely. Interviewing local residents is also a good idea.

grecord.C_Theme: 2022.9.25 Preparation for the introduction of Sheng Xuanhuai's residence
grecord.C_Reflection: I was given the task of introducing the architecture of the Hengfu neighborhood, which was also the first task of my cas project, the architecture of the sea culture. So, as a pioneer, I prepared this task very seriously. I need to introduce a building to everyone in the second club activity. I looked up the architecture handbook, which recorded the characteristic buildings in this neighborhood. I found a Spanish-style building that was the former residence of Sheng Xuanhuai. I analyzed the exterior of the building, the exterior environment, and the interior environment from an aesthetic level, and went to look up some information about neoclassicism, hoping to give you some science.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 本社团由有共同兴趣爱好的同学们组建，在世外已有较长的建社时间。社团目的意在由兴趣出发，以动漫文化为载体，通过校内校外的大型活动组织以及社团内部的小型活动的详细规划安排，发挥社员的创新能力、组织能力和合作能力，宣传社团相关文化并在各项活动项目中取得成绩，为校园文化建设和其他相关项目进行服务。社团现在正在努力使同学重新正确认识动漫的意义及其所带来的价值观，提倡同学们合理安排课余生活。
groups.C_DescriptionE: The club is built by the students with the same hobbies and has quite a long history in WFLMS. The club uses the hobbies as starting points and uses the Anime culture as a platform to develop club members’ the ability of creation, organization and cooperation through the detailed plans of the organization of the important activities in and out of the schools, the propaganda of the related culture and the other daily activities. The club hopes to continue to service for the creation of the culture of the campus in WFLMS. The club has made its efforts to bring the correct values of the meanings of the anime and promoted the students to plan their spare time in reason.

grecord.C_Reflection: Recently a board game is popular on the internet. Youtubers play the old game, who’s undercover, but with animation question banks. We try this board game online. At first the game master will send each participant a name of animation or character. One of them will get a different word. Each round every participant has to describe the word they get, and they can communicate with each other to guess who has the different word. Who’s undercover. The game is interesting, and it recalls memories about some animation that I watched a long time ago.

This week’s activity is an announcement. Due to the covid-19 pandemic, many activities in the plan cannot be in progress. So we want to plan for a unique journal. Usually, our journals will recommend some good animations or analyze the animation that has important meaning to the subculture. But this time we want to focus on our own engagement. Why we like this subculture and how are we attracted? Everyone has the chance to tell their own experiences and then they will be arranged by the journal department.

The April is coming, and many new animations are coming out soon, so this week’s activity we watch the preview video of the animation that will published in the April. At beginning we watch the preview of popular works, like SPY x FAMILY, and Summer Time Rendering. The original works of these animation are approved widely before the animation is made, so they have already a group of audience waiting for the broadcasting. The preview videos have another important role. People can see the level of production and the money the animation company behind it put in. So, before the broadcasting, the preview is the most important way for use to know the possible good works and bad works.

This week we play an online game, draw and guess, which is very popular among many clubs after the pandemic. We customize a question bank about popular animation. Every round one person is chosen to draw the animation that the computer showed, and drawing down anything that can help other people to guess out the answer. The people who get the correct answer can get points, and the person drawing can get points when other people answered correct. The one with the highest points after a round win the game.

Today is the second day of the Japanese dubbing competition, and there three groups that will perform different abstracts from animation. The one that left me the deepest impression is the group from Japanese club’s president and vice president. They chose a scene that had become a widely used joke on the internet, so many people had watched that part. It was a challenge, but their proficiency and vivid performance perfectly carried the scene out of the screen. At last, they won the first prize and they worth it.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 世外传媒是世外目前最大的非官方校园新闻互动传播媒体。世外传媒的意义在于带着已有的资源和口碑，传承发扬一个属于世外学生创造自我价值、产生影响力的平台。我们负责报导校内外的新闻，有效有质地传播校园资讯、宣扬校园文化。社团栏目例如学长学姐说希望可以帮助大家找到努力与热爱的意义，去激励个人成长；还接收同学老师的来稿进行互动，让世界倾听世外学生的声音。
groups.C_DescriptionE: WFLA Media Networks is currently the largest non-official campus news interactive media. The significance of WFLA media networks is to carry the existing resources and reputation, inherit and carry forward a platform that belongs to the WFLA students to create self-worth and exert influence. We are responsible for reporting the news inside and outside the school, effectively disseminating campus information, and promoting campus culture. In the community column, for example, The Seniors is aimed to help everyone find the meaning of hard work and love, to stimulate personal growth; they also receive contributions from classmates and teachers to interact, so that the world can listen to the voices of WFLA students.

grecord.C_Theme: 5.11 Make preparation for the traditional activity in our club that to make annual review
grecord.C_Reflection: The new semester is soon coming and the club will have new president and new members. As a tradition in the our club, we always ask students to make a short annual review of this year's work and also give the prospect towards next year. So in the two semesters during 2019-2020, we also decide to continue the tradition. As club president, I gathered all of our club members and then everyone make a short summary for about 3-5 minutes. I think it’s a meaningful tradition in our club to review what we have done and I hope it can continue in the following years.

grecord.C_Theme: Making vlog of the rehearsal of the drama club for the coming charity
grecord.C_Reflection: In December, as a traditional activity in our school, charity is expected by all the students. As a school network, WFLA media network will also take the responsibility of recording the program that will performance on the stage. This year, we focus on the drama club which is preparing a musical, and we will use professional camera equipment to record their rehearsal. Also we will interview some of the club members about their feelings and their impressions about the hard reversal.

grecord.C_Theme: summarize the  Han Dynasty culture week activity
grecord.C_Reflection: In the October, school held the Han  Dynasty culture week activity in school, and GI club did the walking show to show students a combination of modern clothes and clothes of Han Dynasty. To give a summary to this activity, our club decided to make a tweet and record this activity. So, I was responsible for making the tweet and also write the plot of the article to make it clear and easy to understand. I also took a lot photos and put them in the article. Besides, I let my club members to interview some of the models that attended the walking show, about their understanding the designing about the clothes.

In the meeting of this semester, we discussed several issues and share our progress of our current work. The meeting of student union is gradually becoming more efficient to a large extent. Altogether, we held 8 meetings. The first meeting, we were easily carried away by some small issues which is not important, and left a lot issues not discussed. Now we controlled our time precisely, and also, we made clear schedules of the meeting and accurate time of discussing each problem. In this way, every issue can be discussed and the meetings become more efficient.

The report of Chinese culture week is the first official report made by WFLA media group. We held several meetings to decide the topic of this report. Firstly we did lots of research about Chinese culture to get familiar with Chinese culture. We then decided to write an article about Qunqu, but we found out that the group which were supposed to perform didn't show up. So we quickly change our form of the article. Finally, we decided to make an imitation of the article of Luxun's work and it was a great of success.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 历史社坚持以历史为主、其余文科为辅的活动方式给所有社员带来共同进步的快乐。本社除了以讲座为代表的学术活动外，亦有诸多分享式的交流（如人文行走、击剑、辩论、研讨会等）。历史社运营的公众号更是每一位社员创造、锻炼的平台，同时也是社团面向大众分享知识的窗口。历史社还时常结合其他学科的知识（如哲学、社会学等）拓展我们的视野。简而言之，历史社是历史、社科爱好者的不二选择。
groups.C_DescriptionE: The History Club adheres to an activity strategy that emphasizes history and complements other liberal arts in order to provide its members the joy of collective advancement. In addition to the academic activities represented by lectures, there are several opportunities for sharing, such as humanistic walks, fencing, debates, seminars, etc. The History Club's official account provides a platform for each member to create and exercise, as well as a channel for the club to share its knowledge with the world. To broaden our horizons, the Historical Society also explores knowledge from other disciplines (such as philosophy, sociology, etc.). In short, History Club is the finest option for history and social science enthusiasts.

grecord.C_Reflection: As the first club activity of this semester, we did not discuss some actual historical topics, but had a general discussion of the entire activity plan for this semester. In this event, we have provided a more realistic plan and content for the historical festival that was originally conceived, and we are committed to balancing academics and fun. In addition, in this event, we designed more community activities that did not exist before, similar to you draw me guess, kahoot and debate activities. I believe that a good start will lay the foundation for our successful club activities throughout the semester.

groups.C_DescriptionC:
生物社希望给学习生物的学牲带来扎实细致的IB生物讲解、富有挑战性的竞赛辅导和有趣的前沿知识讲解；带曾经对生物不感兴趣的同学领略生物的之美。兼顾学术性和趣味性，我们会和大家一起学习、成长、找到自己的心中所爱。

生物，生物。
是生命，是万物。
这里是生物社，聚集着热爱生物的人们。
我们会带着这份热爱走下去，也衷心期待——

和你一起。
groups.C_DescriptionE: Bio Club aims to provide fellow biology lovers with robust academic knowledge, challenging Olympiad training, and glimpses into state-of-the-art biological research, while also consistently trying to reveal the beauty of biology to those yet to perceive it. Uniting academic splendor with the delightful appeal, at Bio Club, the science of life is embraced with lively passion. With such passion, we shall be endeavoring, ever deeper, into the path of biology. With your succession, our pilgrimage is far from being solitary.

grecord.C_Reflection: This was the 11th activity of this semester. During this activity, I held a lecture about the reproduction, lifecycle, and germination of angiosperms, or flowering plants. I have always found planned biology very interesting, as it is so different from animal biology. For example, a female plant gamete undergoes mitosis for three times, giving rise to 8 haploid nuclei, and each one of them is responsible for a different part in fertilization. Although some may find botany more boring than animal or human physiology, I find all branches of biology equally intriguing.

This was the 12th activity of the semester. During this activity, I briefly talked about the thermoreceptor TRPM8 and its mechanisms, and also analyzed with my club members a paper written by David Julius, a Nobel Prize laureate, concerning the topic. Although feeling hot or cold seems to be a most familiar concept in our daily life, the exact mechanisms where obscure until very recent times. In learning about this topic, we can know how our body perceives the world, and in reading the paper written by a Nobel Prize laureate, we can gain insight into how a successful experiment is orchestrated.

grecord.C_Theme: mRNA vaccines and research paper analysis (5.25)
grecord.C_Reflection: This was the 13th activity of the semester. I have listened to the advice of two of my club members and decided to talk about mRNA vaccines, in response to the recently growing COVID-19 pandemic. I briefly stated the mechanisms of mRNA vaccines before showing my club members three research articles dedicated to investigating the effectiveness of these vaccines against COVID-19 as a whole and against the Omicron variant. This is just an instance how biology can be closely related to life, especially in times of pandemic.

This was the 4th activity of the semester. During this activity, we played an interesting little game online using the website gartic.io. It was a drawing and guessing game. I devised over 200 biology vocabularies, and for each turn, a participant would randomly receive 2 vocabularies and pick one to draw. The rest of the participants are responsible for guessing what vocabulary the drawing actually attempted to portray. It was a fun game, including many hilarious moments. When a club member is drawing me, some people guessed “idiot” and “mental disability”. I will never forget these two club members. I hope that they don't sleep too tightly at night.

This was the 14th and penultimate activity of the semester. During this activity, I first showed all my club members the newly drafted constitution of Bio Club, involving directive ideas of how the club should be operated, the limits of powers of club presidents, financial details, and more. I believe that the club should be operated under a strict guideline to avoid future problems. After the constitution was passed unanimously, I went on to briefly touch the topic of microbiology, talking about Gram stains and detailed structures of bacteria. Through this lecture I have finished addressing most, if not all, of the topics involved in questionnaire survey that I had released last semester.

groups.C_DescriptionC:
嘎嘣脆动物园语言社®创立于2013年，是DP第一批正式社团，同年荣获五星社团。
我们探索语言、探究哲学、探讨文学、探寻古典。以“人类观察员”的视角，我们透过语言文字现象格物致知，捕捉并关照这个世界。
Crunchy Zoo不只是学语言！我们在社团活动中分享“奇词妙字”，开展“哲学咖啡馆”，举办和参与语言学比赛，搬运并翻译文化类视频，带读文学作品，撰写文学评论……
groups.C_DescriptionE:
Crunchy Zoo Language Club was founded in 2013 and awarded the FIVE STAR CLUB◊◊◊◊◊ the very first year of its establishment.
Our activities are divided into four departments:
a) Linguistics: devoted on linguistic olympics through LING 101 workshop
b) Literature: producing captions for YouTube videos
c) Philosophy: online symphilosopheín (seminar on philosophy)
d) Classics: Hellenic and Roman philology with Latin ab intio We are Crunchy Zoo. WE DO MORE THAN LANGUAGE.

grecord.C_Reflection:
Giving a lecture on phonology to the linguistics club as the club president was a truly enriching experience. As someone who is passionate about language and linguistics, I was excited to have the opportunity to share my knowledge and insights with others.

The lecture focused on the basics of phonology, including the way in which sounds are organized and used in language. I began by introducing the concepts of phonemes and allophones, and explained how these sounds function within a language system. I then went on to discuss the various phonological processes that occur in language, such as assimilation, dissimilation, and deletion, and how these processes shape the sound patterns of different languages.

As I gave the lecture, I was struck by the level of engagement and curiosity of the club members. They asked thought-provoking questions and participated actively in the discussion, which made the lecture even more enjoyable. I was also grateful for the opportunity to learn from my peers, as their insights and perspectives helped to deepen my own understanding of phonology.

Giving a lecture on morphology to the linguistics club as the club president was a truly enriching experience. As someone who is passionate about language and linguistics, I was excited to have the opportunity to share my knowledge and insights with others.

The lecture focused on the basics of morphology, including the ways in which words are formed and how they are used to convey meaning in language. I began by introducing some of the key concepts in morphology, such as root words, affixes, and inflections. I then went on to discuss the different types of morphemes and the ways in which they can be combined to create complex words.

As I gave the lecture, I was struck by the level of engagement and curiosity of the club members. They asked thoughtful questions and participated actively in the discussion, which made the lecture even more enjoyable. I was also grateful for the opportunity to learn from my peers, as their insights and perspectives helped to deepen my own understanding of morphology.

Overall, giving a lecture on morphology to the linguistics club was a truly fulfilling experience. It allowed me to share my knowledge with others and to learn from my peers. I am grateful to have had the opportunity to lead such a meaningful and educational event, and I hope that it will inspire others to continue exploring the complexities and beauty of language.

Giving a lecture on linguistics introduction to the linguistics club as the club president was a truly rewarding experience. As someone who is passionate about language and linguistics, I was excited to have the opportunity to share my knowledge and insights with others.

The lecture focused on introducing the key concepts and ideas in linguistics, including the study of language structure, language use, and language change. I began by explaining what linguistics is and why it is an important field of study. I then went on to discuss the different branches of linguistics, including phonetics, phonology, morphology, syntax, and semantics, and how these subfields contribute to our understanding of language.

As I gave the lecture, I was struck by the level of engagement and curiosity of the club members. They asked thoughtful questions and participated actively in the discussion, which made the lecture even more enjoyable. I was also grateful for the opportunity to learn from my peers, as their insights and perspectives helped to deepen my own understanding of linguistics.

Overall, giving a lecture on linguistics introduction to the linguistics club was a truly fulfilling experience. It allowed me to share my knowledge with others and to learn from my peers. I am grateful to have had the opportunity to lead such a meaningful and educational event, and I hope that it will inspire others to continue exploring the complexities and beauty of language.

Today, All in One Gaze Astronomy club and our club held a cooperative lecture. Taking the theme of the linguistics-related science fiction film "Arrival", we elaborated respectively on the human exploration of alien civilization, the linguistic elements in the film, and how the linguists will cope with the possible communication with alien species in the future. The parts about linguistics mainly involves Chomsky's Universal Grammar theory, basic methods of field linguistics, the contrast between the language Heptapod A / B used by the alien creatures and human language, neurolinguistics, the Sapir-Wolf hypothesis, etc. During this period, the students expressed their own views and held intense discussion on the authenticity of the Sapir-Wolf hypothesis. We also designed various experiments to verify whether the hypothesis was valid. Finally, we summarized that languages vary in limited and constrained ways by linking to the Universal Grammar theory and show that all languages are equal. My preparation to this lecture really takes time since I did do much research and read many papers on this topic. All the materials I went over is shown in reference list in my PPT.

Today, we held an online workshop on Tencent Meeting. We invited a linguistics club member from Pinghe High School to share her learning outcome from her philosophy courses. She primarily elaborated on Jean-Paul Sartre work Existentialism is a humanism. During the workshop, our club members actively interacted with the host in the chat box and asked meaningful questions. And club president Li Xiangtiange also took brief notes and shared it in our group chat. After the session, the club members all gave us positive response and voluntarily offered to write review articles.

groups.C_DescriptionC: LET'S MAKE MUN GREAT AGAIN!!! 模联辩论社为2014,2015,2016年的五星社团，宗旨为“持续不断地为世外培养模联、辩论、演讲方面的人才”；我们的社团不仅会利用平日活动来锻炼社员们的能力，还会提供校级到国家级的模联大会与英语辩论比赛供社员们自行选择。我们的社团活动会涵盖但不局限于下列内容：辩题的brainstorm、新闻的分享与讨论、模拟辩论、模拟法庭与模拟参议院的党派辩论。通过这些活动，社员们锻炼了公共演讲能力，提高了解决问题的效率，培养了对于时政的兴趣，并积累了比赛的经验。然而真正给大家带来变化的其实更多的是自信心的增强：模联及辩论都要求我们自信地将自己的想法展现给他人。在进行学术活动之余，我们还会定期玩一个叫做“强权外交”的桌游，来培养社员们对于国际关系及国家间战略的感觉。总之，模联辩论社为喜欢模联、英语辩论、演讲及国际政治的同学提供与同好交流，进而展现、提升自己的平台。
groups.C_DescriptionE: LET'S MAKE MUN GREAT AGAIN!!! The motto of MUN/DEBATE club is “speak for yourself, speak for all”, and through this club, members can gain access to various MUNs and debates ranging from local scales to international scales. During weekly-held club meetings, members can gain experience in debating and public speaking by participating in different club activities, including but not limited to mock trials, mock senate debates, debating brainstorms, and news sharing and discussing. However,MUN/DEBATE club is not only about MUNs and debates; it is more of an attitude, an attitude of constantly caring, thinking, and presenting with confidence. Neither is MUN/DEBATE club all about academic activities: we periodically play a game called “Diplomacy” in order for members to develop abilities to strategize with regard to international relations. What MUN/DEBATE club offers is more like developing a new hobby; every single experienced club members would say that as long as they become familiar with MUNs and debates, they know for a fact that they are already obsessed and that this obsession is never going to cease.

grecord.C_Theme: The third activity of the club
grecord.C_Reflection: (Actually happened on October 16th) In this club activity, the club leader first intoduced some new international Model United Nations competitions that would take place outside of Shanghai. We asked the club members whether they want to participate in any of those conferences. Later, the club guidence teacher William started introducing the position paper. He included the ways of research, details of position paper, and other necessary contents of the document. Then, the club leader mentioned the way to make a openning speech at the beginning of a conference.

grecord.C_Theme: The fourth activity of the club
grecord.C_Reflection: (Actually happened on October 23rd) In this activity, moderated caucus and unmoderated caucus are intoduced to the club members. Teacher William mentioned the structure of the words motioning for a caucus. He also explained the things delegates should do in a speech of the moderated caucus and a unmoderated caucus. After that, the club members had a try. Started by the club leader, the members had a detailed practice of a moderated caucus and a unmoderated caucus under the topic of the school lunch. Some think that school lunch is good but some disagree. The discussion is helpful for the beginners.

grecord.C_Theme: The fifth activity of the club
grecord.C_Reflection: (Actually happened on Octerber 30th) In the fifth activity of MUN club in this semester, the club leader introduced two essential documents that delegates should write during the conference -- the working paper and the draft resolution. groups.C_DescriptionC: 本社团是上海市世界外国语中学的FTC竞赛的参赛队。最初建队的五名学生选择队名“The BOLTS”象征着速度与坚固，亦代表着社团对于高效与可靠机器人的期许。社团从2012年开始参加FIRST集团主办的面向16岁起的青少年的科技型比赛FIRST Tech Challenge，这是一项结合了数学、物理、工程、机械和计算机科学等学科的诸多实际技能的国际性赛事，队伍代表学校获得多次奖项，包括2013-2014中国冠军与启迪奖, 以及2015-2018每年上海赛区的冠军联盟奖等。目前谷歌，思科和上海汽车为本社团赞助商。 同时我们还活跃于在上海的其他地方, 基于丰富的科目经验，向青少年科普机器人，工程学的知识。
groups.C_DescriptionE: The BOLTS robotics club was founded in March 2012, with the help from students, parents, and teachers in school. It was the FIRST Tech Challenge club in Shanghai World Foreign Language Middle School. The five founding students of our club choose our name because “The BOLTS” has the meanings of both lightning and fasteners, which represents our wishes for our robots to be efficient and reliable. The BOLTS has won dozens of awards in FTC, which is a competition requires the best combination of engineering, physics and computer science, our achievements including 2013-2014 Chinese Championship and Inspire Award and we won the Champion League award from 2015-2018, and is currently sponsored by Google and DigiSoft. Furthermore, we also teach high school students all over Shanghai based on our rich knowledge and experience.

grecord.C_Reflection:
Actual Date: 2020-1-14
Task: debugging I2C bus. In the application of Mk Sein, the I2C bus is used to transfer the data of the movement of mouse to the Hub and communicate with the main programming that is running to control the robot moving. 
I2C (Inter-Integrated Circuit), pronounced I-squared-C, is a synchronous, multi-master, multi-slave, packet switched, single-ended, serial computer bus invented in 1982 by Philips Semiconductor (now NXP Semiconductors). It is widely used for attaching lower-speed peripheral ICs to processors and microcontrollers in short-distance, intra-board communication.

The actual date of this activity is 2019-10-30
In today's activity, most of the members have finished their configuration and installation of Android Studio environment.  I provides some additional tutorials on Java programming for the fresh club members along with the Git.
In the last half period of this activity, I led the new members to write and build their first java program. I also restated some operation of git, including pull, push, commit and merge, and provide them a empty new git repository for them to have actual practice.

grecord.C_Theme: Test of the level-converter board and navigation module
grecord.C_Reflection:
The actual date of this activity is 2019-12-14
The principle of level shifter restricted its ability to elevate the voltage level by itself, indicating that it requires a external voltage supply of 5V. I plan to redirect the 5V source of the power supply wire between the smartphone and the REV hub, and I put them into the test in this activity.
I also building and installing the sample navigation module and put it into a test by showing the navigation targets to the camera of the phone. The result shown that its relative precise and is able to perform some functions in navigation.

We have planned to connect the hub and the arduino with IIC bus. IIC is an type of internal bus protocol, which is the only external digital protocol we are able to use to connected the REV hub to other devices.
Since the protocol can only transmit 8 bits at a time and the IO ports of Arduino has only 8 bits register while we need to transmit at least two "double" floats (32 bits each), a split and re-construct of the data is essential.
Base on the discussion, We decides to encode the data by the following sequence: Start code - Address bits (IIC required) - A ASCII code (8 bits) - A double (32 bits) - A ASCII code (8 bits) - A double (32 bits) - stop code, which is able to transmitted to numbers with decimal points and two alphabets to distinguish the two datas.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 上海市世界外国语中学经济社基于拓宽学生知识面，为学生提供经济学科交流平台，帮助学生在经济学科的学习以及将书本内容应用于现实世界中的理念于2014学年建立，至今已有长达四年的历史。本社团于2016学年开展了多个附属项目以切实达成社团理念及建社目标，目前开展的社内项目包括经济教学视频录制、模拟股市分析以及书籍注解撰写等。并且，本社团与华泾社区共青团关爱农民工子女志愿服务行动项目组织“七彩小屋”达成了长期合作项目，在七彩小屋进行周期性的免费教学，切实为社区服务做出贡献。
groups.C_DescriptionE: The World Foreign Language Academy Economics Club is founded in 2013 based on the idea of broadening students' horizon, providing a platform for communication between students around the subject of Economics, offering assistance for students' study of Economics, and taking theories into reality. The four-year-long history of the club enables the multi-program system to be carried out. Current sub-programs of the club include Crash Course Video Recording, Mock Stock Market Analysis and Book Analysis & Reflections, which all serves to accomplish the goal and the idea of The WFLA Economics Club. In addition, the club also established a long-term cooperation relationship with CYL Migrant Worker Children Caring Voluntary Sevices Program "The Polychrome House", to hold classes at "The Polychrome House" periodically, and earnestly contribute to Community Services.

grecord.C_Theme: Unemployment with Karl Marx's labor theory
grecord.C_Reflection: This actually happens on 10/23.  The lecture began with a deep dive into Karl Marx's labor theory of value, exploring concepts like commodity production labor, estimation of value, and the interplay of supply and demand in market value determination. The latter half focused on the historical context of Keynesian theory formation, driven by post-World War I economic challenges in the UK. We covered Keynes's notable contributions, spanning effective demand, psychological laws, multiplier principle, and policy recommendations. The session provided a fundamental understanding of value and employment dynamics in economic theory.

The actually happens on 10/16. We first have a preview of IB pre-content, focusing on market structures—perfect competition, monopolistic competition, oligopoly, and monopoly as a basis for today’s lecture. We emphasized the absence of pricing power for firms in perfect competition, contrasting with the varying degrees of pricing power in the other structures. Notably, the PED in monopolistic competition, oligopoly, and monopoly decreases sequentially. The session delved into the relationship between MC, MP, AC, AR, and MR, underscoring the pricing principle (MR=MC).After talking about the IBs micro economics topic, we talk about Keynesian.  Critiques surfaced against classical economic theories, particularly the assumption that wages equal marginal product, highlighting discrepancies between real and monetary wages. At last, the session concluded by challenging classical employment theories in light of these discrepancies.

This refer to the date of 2020,04,01. This refer to the planning section (over 2 hours) of the first activity in club, and also the actual activity time (1 hour). I shared my thoughts during the club activity section and the struggles that I had been though. I made a bullet point lists and told my club member how should them overcome the challenges in the future.

It’s the end of this semester’s Econ Club! Everyone had a wonderful journey throughout the year of learning economics, sharing knowledges, experiences, impressions and ideas on business, economics, and finance. People are so talented and crazily interesting, so devoted and truly enthusiastic about Econ Club and the world of economics. It’s probably the last time for the old presidents to stand to the front, saying all those grateful words to each member, because from a brand new Econ Club to what we’ve created throughout a year, it’s our effort and love that build the Econ Club the best Econ Club forever!! And next year, it’s not the end, and it would never be the end. It would be a better club with more opportunities and more members. It would be a fresh start.

This corresponds to 3/26. Today is also the Tedonomics day! As our first video was released on both youtube and bilibili, we had our WFLA Econ Club channel! One talked about the double eleven marketing, linking to the effect of sheep flock, irrational exuberance, saying that people would tend to affect each other’s emotion, leading to falser prediction of the whole market. Here is the youtube video link of the first piece of #Tedonomics#, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x6MbzuNXqZQ
hope you enjoy it!

groups.C_DescriptionC: “法语社”，给世外学习法语的人群提供法语角。法语阅读，制作海报，撰写微信号、集体外出活动的发掘自己法语新高度的活动，以能提高自己本身的法语能力为基础和动力，让法语社成为能够让本校甚至校外学习法语的同学们提升法语水平的平台！了解法国文化是其中的重要一环。在世外中学，不乏被法国文化深深吸引的同学。围绕法国文化的浪漫气息，法语社将通过艺术、历史、歌曲、电影以及美食等方面让同学们更好得通过自己的感官发现法国的“美”。暂定每个月都会有一个特定的主题，每周法语社将会开展维持1小时的互相交流时间。期间，社员将通过看书、看电影、品尝美食等各种自主学习的方式，预先了解与本月主题相关的法国历史、文化、美食、电影等多方面，也可以有感而发为感兴趣的主题写一些随笔和心得。我们将通过绘制海报和“FranceFranche”的微信号的平台来汇报社团活动从而展示社员成长心得。
groups.C_DescriptionE: Our purpose of holding French Club is to gather students studying French in WFLMS to develop the ability to use French as a speaking language. We provide the chance for students studying French to read proper French story books, to create a French corner, to express own thoughts about French, etc. Familiarizing with French culture is another important process of learning French. In our school, there are plenty of students who are totally fascinated by French culture. In order to know France better, we will advertise French culture by combining our French salon inside school with activities organized by Shanghai French Alliance outside school. We tentatively decide to set one theme per month. Club members will preview the theme of the month by reading, watching movies, having snacks, etc. During the every-week sharing time, we will then discuss the theme in groups. We will also offer site visits once a month according to the plan. We plan to show our activities and members’ learning experience by designing posters and writing some articles on wechat at the end of the first semester.

groups.C_DescriptionC:
"离开化学实验室，我的心脏就无法跳动。"
                                                                                                                                                                              ——维勒
化学社是一个传承已久的社团。创社之初，本社便以培养同学们对化学的热爱为己则，并以将自然科学的客观真理性和人文性贯彻于本社组织的活动之中为始终的目标。
本社的活动主要为：化学实验、化学应用和化学理论科普。
化学实验是本社的主要活动，通常通过做实验来使同学们了解一种物质的特性，或者了解一个很有特征的化学反应。
本社偶尔也会举办小workshop，各社员可以运用自己的化学理论知识来制作一些作品，例如变色墨水等，用严谨而不失趣味的方式一同学习化学。
最后，化学社能够容纳怀有不同目标的同学：无论是希望感受化学的乐趣或是想要提高管理能力，我们都非常欢迎！


"世间最大的快乐，莫过于发现世人从未见过的新物质。"
                                                                                                                                                                              ——舍勒

衷心希望各位能在化学社感受到身为化学学习者的骄傲与快乐。
