grecord.C_Reflection: Today we commenced with a brief overview of the Chemistry Club and its activities planned for this semester. Subsequently, we delved into the IB Chemistry syllabus, providing insights into its content outline, along with competition participation guidelines. Below, you'll find links to e-books and videos for further reference. Concluding the session, our focus centered on the 2023 Nobel Prize, where we explored how quantum dots leverage quantum effects and electron arrangement in crystals to achieve size-dependent color variation. We also delved into the primary applications of quantum dots. For more information, refer to the provided e-resources.

In this event, we delved straight into the most captivating realm of chemistry - organic chemistry. In the mini-lecture, we shared insights into the mechanisms of two substitution reactions, namely Sn1 and Sn2, and elucidated their manifestations in chemotherapy drugs. Furthermore, we provided a brief overview of all functional groups in organic chemistry, offering a comprehensive introduction to the diverse molecular structures encountered in this fascinating branch of science to prepare for the upcoming competitions in chemistry and biology as well.

During this activity, we undertook our first experiment, dubbed "Violet Rain." The focus centered on the intricate interplay of colors within complexes as the guiding reaction principle. Delving into the reactions of copper with diverse ligands formed the core of our exploration. The culmination of the experiment revealed a visually enchanting spectacle - elegant purple crystals gracefully adrift in a vibrant blue solution. This captivating display not only marked a successful experiment but also underscored the aesthetic allure inherent in the chemistry at play.

"Today's acitivty is a collaborative exploration between our Chemistry Club and the Biology Club, focusing on the theme of pigments. To sustain the momentum from our joint venture on BioBio3.0, we proceeded with an in-depth theoretical discussion. The Chemistry Club elucidated the principles of coloration involving transition metals and pigments in compounds. Concurrently, the Biology Society showcased the real-life applications of these pigments, demonstrating their significance in our daily lives. This multifaceted approach aimed to bridge the gap between chemical theories and biological applications, fostering a comprehensive understanding of pigments.
"

In our second organic chemistry lecture today, we embarked on a comprehensive exploration of benzene reactions and various synthesis pathways. We delved into the intricate world of benzene's reactivity, dissecting the mechanisms behind its transformations. The discussion extended to encompass diverse synthesis routes, unraveling the methodologies employed to craft intricate molecules from benzene derivatives. This lecture aimed to provide a nuanced understanding of benzene's role in organic synthesis, shedding light on the versatile strategies employed in creating complex compounds within the realm of organic chemistry.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 辩论，是精湛的逻辑、美好的表达，是语言和灵气的搏斗，是寻找答案的艺术。辩论带给我们的不仅是绽放光芒的赛场，更是自我认知的机会，真正认识自己口中语言的深度和力量。汉娜·阿伦特说：“有辩论的地方，权威就暂时失声。”在辩论场上，我们磨去心中带有海拔的固见、念想，旋转起内心认知世界的方向，为所有看似荒谬的事物辩护，为一切需要辩护的立场伸张价值。在观点和表达的碰撞中，你终究会懂得那件事、那个人、那个你寻找的答案。
groups.C_DescriptionE: Originated from the Axial Age, from the time human beings first valued knowledge and truth, DEBATE had always been the way for us to express the voice in our hearts, to question and challenge authorities, to chase after truth and justice. We rub out the established thoughts and stereotypes in out minds on the stage of debate, to defend a position that may seem absurd, to pursue a impossible chance to convince. Eventually, you will know what you are chasing after.

grecord.C_Reflection: 12.28 // Today, our coach delivered an insightful session on the art of cross-examination in debate competitions.  The emphasis was on constructing compelling counterarguments backed by evidence.  The engaging class captivated everyone's attention, fostering active participation and interactive learning.  Exploring intriguing topics, such as the statement "People who run red lights should be sentenced to death," allowed us to put into practice the techniques we had just acquired. The lively discussions and exercises provided a platform for honing our newfound skills, encouraging us to present well-supported rebuttals.  The collective progress made during the session not only showcased the effectiveness of evidence-based discourse but also reinforced the importance of continuous improvement in our debating abilities.

grecord.C_Theme: Return of Graduates & Xmas Special Events
grecord.C_Reflection: 12.21 // Amidst the Christmas break, graduates from London returned to campus today, joining our club activity. As we engaged in self-introductions, the sense of legacy within our club, passed down from one cohort to the next, became palpable. The spirit of togetherness took a delightful turn as we immersed ourselves in engaging and lighthearted games.   Beyond the laughter and shared joy, these activities served as a platform to exercise our powers of persuasion and eloquence, contributing to the cultivation of enduring memories.   The exchange of stories, coupled with the playful banter during the games, created an atmosphere where friendships were rekindled, and new bonds were formed.This reunion wasn't just a momentary gathering;   it was a celebration of the enduring spirit of our club and the warmth that accompanies the holiday season.   As we bid farewell to the day, the shared laughter and cherished moments etched into our memories made this occasion an invaluable and heartwarming chapter in the ongoing story of our club's legacy.

grecord.C_Theme: Debate competition between g10 and g11
grecord.C_Reflection: 12.14 // Today marked an intellectually stimulating event as four debaters from the 10th grade engaged in a riveting debate with their counterparts from the 11th grade. The focal point of their discourse revolved around the intriguing inquiry into whether the beauty of life resides in ephemeral moments or enduring eternity. The stage was set for a clash of ideas, and both sides brought forth compelling viewpoints, weaving a tapestry of insights through the collision of thoughts and the illustrative power of vivid examples.As the debate unfolded, the exchange of ideas not only showcased the eloquence of the participants but also deepened their collective understanding of the profound subject at hand. In the denouement, the senior students and coaches offered invaluable feedback, providing a reflective lens through which the participants could further refine their debating skills and enhance their capacities for thoughtful analysis.

11.23 // Today, we held an award ceremony to honor all participants in the freshman debate competition.  The three-month journey through the novice tournament is sure to become an unforgettable high school memory, as it not only honed their time management skills and fostered debate proficiency but also facilitated the formation of new friendships.  Exquisite medals and keepsakes were crafted, tangible tokens to etch this experience into their memories.Together, we celebrated the collective success borne from everyone's dedication, with participants sharing personal stories that added depth to the occasion.  The latter half of the session featured an engaging debate, injecting joy into the club activity as everyone participated with enthusiasm, ensuring a delightful and memorable experience for all.

11.16 // In our club, we recently organized a captivating debate showdown, introducing a range of amusing and relatable topics to spur spontaneous discussions. The event encouraged everyone to showcase their prowess in impromptu debating, drawing upon personal experiences and stories to articulate their points persuasively. It was a dynamic platform where participants honed the skill of making their arguments more vivid and accessible through relatable anecdotes.Amid the spirited debates, laughter and applause echoed in the room, underscoring the enjoyment everyone derived from the lively exchange of ideas. The witty and insightful remarks not only tickled our funny bones but also highlighted the creative and intellectual flair within our club. This event not only enhanced our debating skills but also fostered a vibrant atmosphere of camaraderie and shared amusement.

groups.C_DescriptionC:
STEM圈氛围浓厚，却似乎像一个围城，城里的技术宅们各司其职，城外的小白们望眼欲穿，却又望尘莫及。于是, techo的初创团队 针对这一现状，在五年前，创建了Techomedia 拓科传媒。

在过去，Techomedia发布380余篇科技推文，总阅读量逾38万；我们也出席各类展会和宣讲会10余次，协办5场大型科技赛事；

未来，Techomedia将不受限于从前，一如既往地跳出舒适区，发起更具多元化和包容性的STEM活动，扩大组织的全国影响力；同时Techo希望与更多的学生科技社团、学生组织、社会科技企业、民非组织展开合作，组织更具影响力的科技活动，给更多的中国青年带去科技的乐趣，让每一个创新的想法，都能得到不容小觑的力量。
groups.C_DescriptionE:
Established in August 2015, TechoMedia is the very first student-oriented STEM student media in China. Our mission is to provide a platform to unite talented students interested in STEM-related areas and combine their efforts together, so that they can find their peers and improve together by communication and cooperation. What’s more, TechoMedia also devotes to gathering the best available resources for those who are interested in STEM-related subjects and majors, offering them a chance to start their journey along this path. 

As a STEM-related media, TechoMedia is using various online platforms to spread influence among the students. Meanwhile, TechoMedia engages in STEM activities such as Google App Inventor Contest, HackShanghai Hackathon, Invention Convention Worldwide, etc., serving as the partnered student media and co-host.

TechoMedia is not merely an influential student media. Our ultimate goal is to build a platform and a nationwide student STEM community. This year, we’ve partnered with several influential social enterprises and student organizations to help us move forward and spread our philosophy.

grecord.C_Reflection: I spent a lot of time helping club members to write the first draft of the documents for our YIBC Hackathon, which was scheduled to be held this summer. The documents include an overall prospectus for the entire hackathon, separate prospectuses for each section, on-site activity execution instruction, emergency handling methods, and so on. Another core member was responsible for the translation of the documents, so I went over the translated version as well. We then submitted the first drafts to the YIBC committee and received further revising instructions.

On March 8th, our YIBC hackathon project launched. We had a thorough meeting with Cesar, the person in charge of contacting Techomedia for the hackathon. We went through the details of the contest and discussed potential problems that may arise, and finally, we separated our work and Cesar told us in detail the document we needed to write later. We also discussed quite a bit about Techomedia, what our club had done and what we hoped the hackathon would be like. Some of the documents Techomedia wrote for past hackathons were still very useful, such as the sponsor SOP.

I planned to hold the TedxWFLA event in July and we've had multiple discussions with Esther's club on which we would cooperate. Our most important meeting was on May 17th. Since soon both clubs would soon have new club leaders in a month or so, Esther and I assigned tasks to every single person within the two clubs and divided them into several departments, such as marketing, visual art, and so on. I stressed the importance of finding a sufficient audience and appropriate lecturers, so we discussed people that we could select potentially. We also brainstormed ideas on the poster of Tedx as well as subject details of the core theme - "Hello World".

grecord.C_Theme: Oridebate scoring sheet and time table
grecord.C_Reflection: On May 13th, I had a long discussion with various core members from the English Debate League and the Chines Debate Club. In the past week, we had discussed which teachers and students should be selected as judges for the Oridebate, and by May 13th all judges have agreed to come to the Oridebate. Together we made a table containing all information including the time and topic for each debate, judge and host names, as well as information about all teams. We later posted that table up for contestants to see. I myself also made a scoring sheet in both Chinese and English versions and distributed it to all the judges.

On the first day from 14:30 to 18:30,  two former first rounds will end and two more will begin. One of them is the Chinese debate round, and three of them are English. The topics include "Whether technology is hampering freedom of speech",  "whether live animal export is ethical", and "whether indulgence in metaverse would be a disaster". These rounds feature teacher judges such as William and Catherine as well as student judges such as Yunqing Wang and Jiayue Li. The debates are very heated and everyone is able to learn something from the debaters.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 本社团将通过同伴教育，将生理健康的知识对我校十年级及以上的学生进行普及，使他们在毕业之前对于“性”这一一直以来被隐晦起来的字眼拥有正确的认知，而在之后的大学生活中具备这方面的自我保护能力。本社团的主要活动分成两个部分，其一是对社团成员对于收集的资料的讨论与整理，再通过学校展板、微信公众平台等方式进行宣传与普及。其二是通过大量的社会调查问卷数据的采集，以此形成一套对于当下学生对于性意识的认知体系以及相对的心理框架。
groups.C_DescriptionE: Our club is going to devote itself popularizing the physical health knowledge through the peer education, towards to the tenth grade students and above in our school. In this way, they can have a better understanding on the word "sex" with the right knowledge, and with the ability to protect themselves in this regard after the college life. The main activities of the society is divided into two parts, one is for community members to discuss information gathered and improvement, through a powerful dissemination, using the school boards, micro-channel public platform, etc. The second part is to form a cognitive system for current students and opposing psychological framework consciousness through a large number of social survey questionnaire collected data.

grecord.C_Reflection: This time we further discussed our projects. The restart and operation of the sanitary napkin support box project, the follow-up of in-school publicity, the development of sex education workshops and the promotion of exhibitions in social magazines or art forms are the main things we will focus on afterwards. I distributed the tasks of publicity, writing tweets, writing lesson plans, being a teaching assistant, etc. to each member of the club to ensure that they were all involved in the club's activities.

This time, as it was our first event, we each introduced ourselves briefly and then I, as president, introduced the main ideas and past activities of our club. After getting to know the club well, I introduced the activities and tasks that I planned to accomplish this semester, and the usual activities of our club. After this introduction, we did some ice breaking game, in order to get to know each other well and further discussed the project we will do this semester.

Today four club members get together at the community center of Kangjian Street to held the community class. The class began at 9.30AM. We first start with a ice-breaking game. The students got familiar with us very quick during the game. Then we start with the gender discrimination. We involved contents about discrimination in childhood and in adolescence.After  the recess, we watched an excerpt from the movie flipped and changed the subject to gender discrimination in adulthood. We involved many different topic, adn used a lot of stories to interact with the students.

In recent club activities, we have been preparing for the community activity we are going to hold n 12.12. The theme of the community activities is to provide a class at the community center of the Kangjian Street. The class is mainly about the gender stereotypes. We involved three sub-topics in the class, discrimination in childhood, in adolescence, and in adulthood. We aim to let more young children learn the essential and indispensable knowledge they would need in their future life

We had our first community class of the semester.Since we didn't have a community class last semester, it was the first time for me and the President to have a community class.This community class involved me, the President and three members, and we completed the preparation of the course together.The President and I decided on a theme for our community class, which was about adolescence. Each of us worked on half of  the class content, I prepared for the physiological issue in adolescene, and she prepared for the psychological issue. We spent lots of time on it, since it was the first time for us to hold a class for children. It was challenging but meaningful for me.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 模拟法庭是以英美法系为基础的当庭辩论，是一项美国高中非常流行的课外活动。一支队伍由6名学生组成——3位律师和3位证人。参赛者在比赛之前要仔细研究下发的案例，从证物、证人之间找出对于自己最有力的证据，同时准备好控方及辩方去引导法官做出最有利的裁决。对于那些将来不从事法律专业的参与者，这是非常具有价值的一项活动。模拟法庭在思维逻辑，公共演讲和临场团队合作都十分具有挑战性。在模法社，参与者将有丰富的机会通过不断地研究案件，团队讨论和文件写作来提升自己各方面的能力。对于以后乐意从事法律专业及对纯粹学术研究的学生，模法社是最好的选择之一。
groups.C_DescriptionE: Mock Trial is an extracurricular in American High schools in which students participate to take on the roles of attorneys and witnesses to compete against each other in courtrooms. Every team consists of 6 members, 3 attorneys and 3 witnesses. All contestants study the case beforehand, draw favorable evidence from the exhibits and witnesses’ testimonies, prepare for both prosecution and the defense side and serve the justice to persuade the judge to make the most favorable final verdict. For those students who following paths other than being lawyers, it is a very valuable experience because Mock Trial is very challenging in critical thinking, public speaking and team collaboration under immediate pressure. In this Mock Trial Club, members have abundant opportunities to improve their own abilities to logically think and write by studying cases and group discussing. For students whose interests in having a legal profession or academic research, Mock Trial is one of their best choices.

grecord.C_Theme: Case Analysis and Constructing Compelling Arguments for Trial
grecord.C_Reflection:
Title: Case Analysis and Constructing Compelling Arguments for Trial
Today's session was dedicated to the analysis of a complex legal case and the preparation of arguments for both the prosecution and defense. This exercise was a challenging yet rewarding experience that demanded the application of legal reasoning and evidence to construct a compelling case. The process emphasized the significance of thorough case analysis, effective argumentation, and the ability to think critically and strategically. It was fascinating to witness how legal theories and evidence were woven together to build persuasive arguments, further reinforcing the practical application of legal principles in a trial setting.

This week during mock trial club, we watched an episode of a TV show called the good wife. In this TV show, we had a glimpse of what American court was like and how U.S. law firms operate. Although TV shows have dramatic effects to some degree, but still, we learned about the basic information on life of law practitioners in the United States. Then, we had a small discussion of the contrast between U.S. law system and China law system. Both have codified constitution, but there are other differences. We thought that this activity is both relaxing and educational.

as the semester is coming to an end, we are having a re-election day of our mock trial club. There were several candidates, each delivered a small speech about what they would like to carry on doing and where they would like to improve. Looking back to this wonderful year, I think we, the core members, have successfully constructed a mock trial family and even somehow enlarged it. At last, we selected a member who I believe have more than enough skills and passion to take our mock trial club to the next level.

This week during mock trial club, we watched a video clip about professionals at Harvard doing a mock trial and then discussed over some of their tactics and higher level strategies that they used. The case we watched is the same case that we did last summer, the case where an undergraduate was accused of murdering a police officer. In the Harvard mock trial, the attorneys were more confident and professional. In direct and cross examinations, they would not dwell on little unnecessary objections, but pose objections to compromise their opponent’s logic chain. We definitely learned a lot from it.

During the winter holiday, we as a club participated in the peer potential mock trial winter tournament. Before the competition, we gather together daily to discuss the strategy and case we want to use in the competition and rehearse the examinations. These preparation helped us to deliver convincing speech during competitions. We also reviewed the rules of evidence which we went over last semester, since most of our team are new to the competition, we had to ensure they can all raise and response to the objections properly.

groups.C_DescriptionC:
世外英语辩论社的宗旨是“持续不断地为世外培养辩论方面的人才”；在打好每一场辩论赛的同时，不只是传授辩论技巧，更是要将辩的热忱以及态度传递给后继的世外学子。
我们的社团不仅会利用平日活动来锻炼社员们的能力，还会提供各种高含金量的国际辩论比赛供社员们自行选择。日常社团活动会涵盖但不局限于下列内容：辩题讨论，即兴演讲联系，补充相关学科知识，辅助备赛，模拟赛练习和导师点评。通过这些活动，社员们不仅锻炼了公共演讲能力、议题分析能力和思维辩证能力，更能够在一次次探讨、学习与比赛中不断进取，积累经验，得到成长。
我们的社团不仅仅是关于英语辩论，更是关于一个思考者的态度；一种严谨思辨的态度，一种不断探索的态度，一种持之以恒的态度。我们希望能够发现并培养一批真正热爱辩论的人，一批真正着眼并洞察着世界的人，一批真正在探索真理的道路上掷地有声的人；我们更希望将这份真诚且热忱的态度传递给每一届世外人，启迪他们心中作为世界公民的责任感。
groups.C_DescriptionE:
The motto of WFLA Debate League is “speak for yourself, speak for all”. Through this club, members can gain access to various renowned debate competitions across international scales. During weekly-held club meetings, members can gain experience in debating and public speaking by participating in different club activities covering topic-based discussions, impromptu speeches, supplementary subject knowledge, competition preparation, mock competition exercises and tutor comments. 
Nevertheless, WFLA Debate League is not only about winning debates and competitions; it is more of an ATTITUDE, an attitude of continuous caring, thinking, confidence, and exploration. We hope to discover and cultivate a group of people who truly love debate, a group of people who truly scrutinises the world, and who are truly courageous in exploring the truth; we also hope to pass on this enthusiastic attitude to more students, inspire them with a sense of responsibility as world citizens. In the end, we hope that every single experienced club member would say that, as long as they engage in debates, they know for a fact that they are debaters, and their passion and enthusiasm for debate is never going to end.

grecord.C_Reflection: Today, we held our third club meeting during the semester. We invited two club members, Eureka and Bob, who attended the competition last week to share some of their feelings and tips for other debaters. They mentioned that the judge was really aware of the definition in this particular debate topic, and they are also expecting to see some really strong impacts coming from both sides. After that, we discussed some other viable options to be used as contentions in the debate competition in November. At last, I shared some of the sources with topic related information.

Our club activity this week is quite different from previous week. Instead of preparing for NSDA topic, we let some club members who has already participated in regionals this semester to share some experience during competition. Some of them mention some confusing arguments for both pro and con side; The others mention some interesting judges and opponents throughout debate. At last, as the club leaders, three of us give some useful advice on during debates, including some tips on making speeches and ways to persuade lay judges. Honestly, it was a really funny club activity. We should have more club discussion and sharing period in the following activities

This week our club activity is mainly divided into two sections. During the first half hours, we mainly prepare for the upcoming NSDA regionals. The format of out preparation is Q&A. Club members will raise questions toward the topic and club leaders will try our best to answer. During the next one hour of the club activity, we prepare ppt for debatewizz with some club members in the teaching group. We discuss the content of the class and the teaching assistant for each class. In order to guarantee the outcome of each class, club members need to hand in their opinion for the upcoming class by Friday. It is an really important club meeting.

This week is the last week before NSDA Shanghai novice tournament, and we mainly focuses on mock debates. Four teams are involved in the mock debate. After selecting the side, the debate starts, both team revise their case according to our previous comments and they are much better than before. Moving on to rebuttal, the are still come problem in their constructive speeches. We give them some feedbacks, which include some improvements on the organization of speeches, and some tips throughout the debate. Hopefully, our club members can do well in their upcoming tournaments.

This week our club mainly focuses on preparing for the upcoming NSDA tournament. To start with, I briefly introduces the format of final focus and we discusses about some arguments. Moving on, we talks about some useful tips during tournaments, which include: do not yell over you opponents，slightly change your strategy depending on your judge, and taking advantage of your preparation time tactfully. Lastly, we share some interesting experiences during past debates and give some tips for novice on how to prepare more efficiently.

groups.C_DescriptionC: Teleskop（德国镜象）是世外中学学生建立的德国文化传播媒体，为上海乃至中国热衷德语和德国文化的学生搭建了解德国，接触德语并进一步提高语言水平的平台。
groups.C_DescriptionE: Teleskop (Teleskop) is a German cultural media established by students from WFLA. It provides a platform for students from Shanghai and China who are interested in German and German culture to learn more about Germany, get in touch with German and further improve their language skills.

grecord.C_Reflection: Summarizing the Goethe Shanghai Citywalk in our public post was a delightful reflection. I aimed to convey the unique blend of language learning and real-world application, highlighting key moments like language interactions and cultural exchanges. The post emphasized the charm of combining German learning with practical experiences, fostering a sense of community. Through this reflection, my goal was to allow readers to feel the laughter, learning, and growth we experienced during the activity. It wasn't just a stroll through Shanghai but a journey of linguistic and cultural exploration that left an indelible mark on our language society.

Crafting a post about Daniel's summer internship at Langsheng Corporation was an opportunity to share valuable insights. I focused on showcasing the practical application of German language skills in a professional setting, emphasizing how the experience contributed to both linguistic and professional development. The post aimed to inspire readers, illustrating the real-world impact of language proficiency in a corporate environment. It wasn't just a job but a transformative experience that broadened my language proficiency and provided a glimpse into the corporate world's demands and opportunities.

The commencement of the new semester on 10/20 wasn't just a meeting; it was a collective venture that laid the groundwork for an enriching and purposeful journey with the German Society. The session served as a dynamic platform for collaborative planning, where members actively contributed to shaping our shared learning experience. We deliberated on upcoming events, objectives, and goals, fostering a sense of community and excitement for the semester ahead.
The inclusive planning approach empowered each member, creating a space where ideas flowed freely, and everyone felt invested in the society's growth. This collaborative spirit infused our plans with diversity and innovation, ensuring a semester filled with engaging cultural experiences and linguistic progress. The session, therefore, marked not only the beginning of a new semester but also the start of a collective exploration into the richness of German language and culture.

On 10/27, the German Society embarked on a unique language learning adventure by introducing German board games. This session transcended traditional learning methods, providing an immersive and interactive experience that went beyond vocabulary enrichment. The incorporation of gaming into our language study not only elevated our language proficiency but also injected an element of joy and engagement.
Exploring these games served as a cultural immersion, allowing us to understand not just the language but also the social dynamics embedded in German gaming culture. It was an innovative approach that turned language learning into a dynamic and enjoyable endeavor, illustrating the society's commitment to providing diverse and effective learning experiences.

The cultural and linguistic odyssey continued on 11/3 with the viewing of the first part of "Hamilton." This immersive experience seamlessly blended entertainment with language acquisition, creating a unique educational experience. As we sharpened our German language skills, the musical offered a captivating journey through historical and contemporary facets of German-speaking cultures.
The session went beyond traditional language learning, providing insights into societal norms, historical contexts, and linguistic nuances. It exemplified the society's commitment to holistic learning, where members not only acquire language skills but also gain a deeper understanding of the cultural tapestry woven into the German language.

groups.C_DescriptionC:
光度心理社是一个为心理学爱好提供一个学习交流的平台，促进学生群体对心理学的了解，学会用科学的知识和方法帮助自己和他人。 
        我们会通过社团活动，提高同学们的自主学习和探究能力，同时也锻炼同学们的与组织和表达能力。在社团活动中有社员带来的Luminar社内分享会，科普心理学的实验和现象；也有由core成员们和老师带来的心理学讲座Lum Lecture。我们为社团成员提供心理学相关的校外项目，如每年暑假的自闭症儿童志愿者活动进行实践体验。上述的社团活动能培养同学之间的团队合作能力，实践能力，以及沟通能力。
         在我们的公众号上我们会不但对活动进行整合记录，而且有面向所有同学的心理学书单和电影推荐以及其他丰富的活动。 光度心理社也会联合校内心理室，举办世外心理健康周活动。
         光度心理社的眼界不单单停留在心理学理论的层面上。我们更希望能够以社团为媒介，在社团和校园内宣扬一种学术精神：一个探究者，调研者和团队一员的精神——勤奋、热情、专注。我们希望在找到志同道合的同伴时也能给对心理学有兴趣有热情的学生提供一个来继续探索这个神奇的领域的机会，并将这种学术精神传递下去。
groups.C_DescriptionE:
Luminosity Psychology Club is a platform for learning and communication for psychology hobbies, promoting the understanding of psychology among students, and learning to use scientific knowledge and methods to help themselves and others.
      Through club activities, we will improve students' independent learning and inquiry skills, and at the same time exercise students' organizational and expressive skills. In the club activities, there are Luminar sharing sessions brought by members, experiments and phenomena of popular science psychology; there are also psychology lectures Lum Lecture brought by core members and teachers. We provide community members with psychology-related off-campus projects, such as volunteer activities for children with autism every summer vacation for practical experience. The above club activities can cultivate the teamwork ability, practical ability and communication ability among students.
       On our official account, we will not only conduct integrated records of activities, but also have a list of psychology books and movie recommendations for all students, as well as other rich activities. Luminosity Psychological Club will also organize the Mental Health Week outside the world in conjunction with the school's psychological room.
       The vision of the Luminosity Psychology Club is not only at the level of psychological theory. We also hope to use the club as a medium to promote an academic spirit in the club and campus: the spirit of an inquirer, investigator and team member-diligence, enthusiasm, and focus. We hope that when we find like-minded peers, we can also provide students who are interested and passionate in psychology with an opportunity to continue to explore this magical field and pass on this academic spirit.

grecord.C_Reflection: This activity actually happened in the afternoon of April 24, 2023. This time we focused on the schools of psychology group which was a brief theoretical introduction of psychology. The major schools of psychology were structuralism, functionalism, behaviorism, psychoanalysis humanism and cognitive psychology. Among them, psychoanalysis impressed me a lot. It was a method of therapy in which the patient talked about their experiences, early childhood, and dreams. It referred to both a theory and a type of therapy based on the belief that all people possesses unconscious thoughts and feelings.

This activity actually happened in the afternoon of April 17, 2023. This was a very exciting activity because the topic subtle expression was many people’s interest. One of the groups in our club had a presentation about this topic, including some analysis of the motivation behind the expressions and moods. Besides, we started to design the plans for the Psychology Week. The date was approximately at the middle of December. We referred to last year’s program, hoping to have a series of joyful activities.

This activity actually happened in the afternoon of April 4, 2023. Firstly, we summarized the topics and activities of the questionnaires that our cub members were interested such as debates on social topics and tips on micro-expression psychology. Then, our president introduced the schedule of activities in the semester for example the psychological week and weekly activities. Today we focused on the social debate in which two key words “enrolling” and “lying flat”were raised. Besides, the book “the courage to be hated” was introduced. Finally, our activity was over and every member enjoyed the time very much.

grecord.C_Theme: the first collaboration with the JOL club
grecord.C_Reflection: This activity actually happened in the afternoon of May 15, 2023. Today was our first collaboration with the Joy Of Learning club and we all felt very excited. The topic was ‘involution’ which was famous on the Internet in China. The inner part of it was "a kind of blind learning conducted by individuals participating in competition only for the purpose of surpassing others and winning others", and it can also be understood as a kind of meaningless and irrational internal consumption at the group level in order to compete for limited resources or avoid falling behind in fierce competition.

This activity actually happened in the afternoon of April 10, 2023. This is the first activity taken by the Luminocity club. We introduced the activities we have held  in the past to let our new members know about us. Besides, we held a classic ice-breaking game. On a piece of paper, there were various descriptions such as “I like listening to music”. We needed to find people who met the relevant descriptions to sign their names. These names need to be practiced into three line thus the Bingo game could succeed. The first activity let us get to know each other better and be motivated to take an active part in our club.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 日语社旨在让更多同学能认识并了解日语以及日本文化，同时给对日本文化和日语学习感兴趣的同学提供一个交流平台，让大家能够表达自己的观点与兴趣爱好，也希望能够帮助正在学习日语或想学习日语的同学们。社团活动主要有：每月专题文化研究、HIBIKI字幕组、大型线上/线下活动+总结推文、日语学习和文化普及系列推文。
groups.C_DescriptionE: Japanese club aims to let more students know and understand Japanese and Japanese culture. We provide a platform for students who are interested in Japanese culture and Japanese learning, so that they can express their views and interests. We also hope to help students who are learning Japanese or want to learn Japanese. The club activities mainly include: monthly thematic cultural research, HIBIKI subtitle group, large online/offline activities + summary tweets, Japanese language learning and cultural popularization series of tweets.

grecord.C_Reflection: This activity actually happened on October 19,2023. Today, we taught the pronunciation of the first four lines of the 50-tone diagram, so that the students had a visual understanding of the 50-tone diagram, learned a few basic 50-tone pronunciation group words, learned a few common Japanese expressions, and learned to introduce themselves in Japanese. They learned more things about Japaneses and its culture through the 50-tone diagram learning activity. I’m really looking forward to the following activities in Japanese club.

This activity actually happened on September 21, 2023. We have regular meeting today. Today, we held the first club activity. As the president of the club, I introduced the daily activities of the club in the future to them. I consulted the other club members for suggestions. I supplemented and adjusted the club activity plan. By playing sword jade ball, fencing and other activities, the members broke the ice among themselves. I’m looking forward to the following activities of Japanese club.

Today, I prepared my favorite theme - the introduction of Japanese TV series. But I think it's boring just to explain the plot. You can also go to see the play by yourself. So I'm preparing more about the culture behind the TV play. For example, this time, I have introduced three major themes through different TV series, focusing on the knowledge behind the three themes of "Japanese campus violence", "Japanese police system" and "Japanese customs and culture". Through data and real cases, I have described the dark side behind the Japanese campus, and through well-known plays like detective Conan, I have brought out the unique characteristics behind Japan Police system and so on, let us have a more understanding of Japanese culture.

grecord.C_Theme: The Introduction of Hokkaido, Kyushu and Chiba
grecord.C_Reflection: This is the first activity in this semester, I introduced two remote areas in Japan: Hokkaido and Kyushu. To me, these two places are very special. They are not as international as big cities like Tokyo, but they are not as traditional Japanese as some small inland places. They are more like the embodiment of another national culture in Japan. I introduced the famous mayor of Hokkaido and his changes to Hokkaido. I also discussed with my classmates the advantages and disadvantages of his approach, and deeply analyzed the purpose behind a series of changes. Then, I think it's boring to introduce cities one by one, so I introduce various cities in Kyushu in the form of separate keywords. Some cities are known as Hawaii in the East, and some cities have very famous mascots. Each city has its unique and attractive place, which is worth exploring.

The idol session is also very interesting as I know the whole structure of the different types of idol in Japan and some of the famous idols. We also watched the videos about their performance and we even learnt about the way fans would encourage and support their idols. It’s a good preparation for my future study in Japan as this is one of the most important recreations, isn’t it? 
Another part of today's activity is we finally passed on the club to the new president and Vice President of HIBIKI. We hold a party and a ceremony to celebrate the perfect ending for this year's CAS activities all HIBKI members've participated in. Cheers for the future of HIBKI!

groups.C_DescriptionC: 物理社旨在增加学术的普及性和趣味性，在探索新知的同时挖掘自己的兴趣，发展自己对物理的见解。在这里，你们不会见到满黑板的复杂公式，在这里，你可以在实验中结识新交，在这里，你可以与学长学姐同享物理乐趣，同时，你也可以体验浪漫，感受艺术，体会物理背后的万物之美。在物理社，每个人可以畅所欲言，可以天马行空，可以肆意探索。物理可以是光，照进每个人的世界，欢迎每一位前行者的到来！
groups.C_DescriptionE: Physics society aimed to increase the universality of academy and the enjoyment brought by learning physics. We encourage you to explore anything new and in the meantime motivate personal interest and develop understanding about physics. Here, you won't see boards filled with complicated formulas, you can meet like-minded people and make friends with them, what's more, you can share your thought regarding physics with any of us. In physics  society, no one is limited to share his/her own idea, so feel free to explore and challenge yourself.  Last, welcome to the field of physics, dear forerunners!

grecord.C_Reflection: I was excited to attend the afternoon activity where we listened to a lecture on gravity. It was presented by members from both the Physics society and All in one gaze (astronomy club). The lecture was informative and engaging, and I learned a lot about gravitational lenses, gravitational waves, and the effect of gravity on space crafting. The presenters used visual aids and interactive demonstrations to help us better understand the complex concepts. I was impressed by their knowledge and passion for the subject. Overall, it was a great learning experience, and I left feeling inspired and enlightened.

As the club president, I was responsible for organizing the activity of campaign speeches and selecting the next club president. We held the activity after school. Almost all members of the club were present. The candidates for president had prepared their speeches well, and they all spoke with enthusiasm and conviction. After the speeches, we held a vote inside the club core, and the winners were announced. The activity was a success, and it was great to see so many students interested and involved in the election process. I was proud to be a part of such an important event for our club, and I look forward to seeing what the new presidents will achieve in their roles.

As the president of the science club, I organized an after-school activity to give a lecture mainly on the DIY hovercraft experiment. The lecture covered the principles and introduction of the experiment, as well as the changeover introduction, the astrophysics club linkage lecture introduction, and the relativity theory introduction. The event was well-attended, and participants were eager to learn about the science behind the hovercraft experiment. We had a lively discussion, and I was impressed by the engagement and enthusiasm of the attendees. Overall, the activity was a great success and showcased the dedication and passion of our science club members.

I attended an after-school activity where we listened to a lecture about particle physics delivered by former club president Wu. The lecture was fascinating and I learned a lot about quarks, leptons, and many other subatomic particles. The former president was an expert in the field and was able to explain complex concepts in an easy-to-understand manner. The lecture was interactive, and we had the opportunity to ask questions and clarify our doubts. It was a great experience to learn about the mysteries of the universe and the building blocks of matter. Overall, the activity was informative and engaging, and I can't wait for the next one.

As the club president, I was thrilled to organize the activity of delivering a lecture to our club members. The activity was held after school and focused on three fascinating topics including the basic introduction to string theory, the air gun principle and dynamic pressure, and the introduction to general relativity. We had an expert speaker who delivered an informative lecture, and our members were engaged and attentive throughout. It was fantastic to see our members learning and asking insightful questions. Overall, the activity was a success, and I was proud to lead such an intellectually stimulating event for our club.

groups.C_DescriptionE:

grecord.C_Reflection: I run WeChat official account of calligraphy club with hundreds of subscribers, and regularly write some Knowledge popularization and typefaces tutorials. As an international student, I have made full use of my English ability in this activity, translating these articles written in English into Chinese and issued by official account numbers, which has a great influence on the circle of Western calligraphy lovers, and plays the role of popularization and dissemination.I'm also typesetting articles written by other members， and published on the official account of WeChat.

THE REAL DATE IS: 5/5
I run WeChat official account of calligraphy club with hundreds of subscribers, and regularly write some Knowledge popularization and typefaces tutorials. According to the activity plan made at the beginning of the semester, as well as the shortcomings of interest group activities in last semester, this semester's activities are based on the cultivation of our basic writing ability and good writing habits . After the meeting, I think the timeline is a little bit too strict for nice works to be done. Therefore, more things are going to be adjusted and decided on in a whole-team meeting next week.

grecord.C_Theme: 3/14 Wednesday workshop: Teaching new teammate Blackletter
grecord.C_Reflection: During this Wednesday’s activity, I taught a new member how to write blackletter font. Unfortunately, the previous members who have learned English calligraphy in our Wednesday workshop all gave up and quit. (Maybe they just have a rest from calligraphy). Since I didn’t not experience the “learning” process in my calligraphy career, I was not able to feel the difficulty for new members to learn gothic blackletter. However, I’ve been trying very hard to assist their learning by making a copybook on my own, and asking them about their feelings about the letters. I have to reflect on the issue that now many people can persist on learning English calligraphy in out Wednesday workshop.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 脑神经科学是当今世界上最热门，也是最有发展前景的跨学科领域之一。Brainbee club的成员们因为国际脑神经大赛Brain Bee 而结识，为了能够共同探究，并普及脑神经科学的相关知识而创办了此社团。我们的目标不仅仅只是提升参加brainbee的团队的学术能力及团队凝聚力，更希望能够让更多的人了解到神经科学的奥秘，将我们对于神经科学的热爱感染到更多的人。
groups.C_DescriptionE: WFLA BrainBee Club is an academic club focusing on studies in the field of neuroscience and cognitive science. Neuroscience is one of the most cutting-edge and promising interdisciplinary subject in this century, yet it is one with the most mysteries need to be unveiled—the human brain is delicate, complex and ever changing. The club is here for students who are attracted by biochemistry, philosophy, psychology and artificial intelligence. We hope that after one year of study the club members can comprehend basic neural theories, brain structure, and on top of that, understand how organisms recognize the world and why it matters.

grecord.C_Reflection: During the last few weeks of the semester, the Psychology club's president invited me to corporate and make a video about neuroscience. Since most of our club members are interested or currently studying music, we decided the central topic to be ' Explain the aesthetic realization of music from a neuroscience perspective.' For each student engaged in the project, the first mission is to find 4 researches or findings that is about acoustic perception. Then, each student will read the resources provided by other students and write a brief summary. Finally, two students are responsible for the body writing, two students will do edit, and 3 students will edit the video.

On 2020.10.15., BrainBee club began the first club activity offline. We basically introduces our club, a basic introduction to neuroscience, and the schedule throughout the whole semester, that we will keep on reading the tell-tale brain until mid term, and then detailed academic will be further analyzed in future activity. And we did some ice breaking games to help we know each other better. We’ve known that most of the club member have basic knowledge and foundation for relevant information due to personal interest or neuroscience competition in middle school

On 2020.8.25. The final book club activity in summer holiday focus on the topic of beauty and the brain: the emergence of aesthetics. Monica and I led the club member to discuss about how different aesthetic perspective is explained by neuroscience, including grouping and peak shift. As usual, we let members to share their finding on artistic product that used these two way of expression, and brainstorm what possible impact can be if human beings explain aesthetics rationally. Will it break the pureness and mystery of beauty.

On 2020.8.14., Monica and I took charge of Book Club activity. We focus on the chapter 4: the neurons that shape transfection, discussing about how mirror neuron can be linked with human’s different senses, as well as the formation of culture. Together, each club member express their own feeling about this concept in daily life, giving examples as yawning when others yawn, feel sick when biology class mention syndrome of different diseases and so on. Meanwhile, we also evaluate the effectiveness of different experiments stated in the book to test whether mirror neuron is innate or learned.

Cognitive Psychology. This may be the largest field, ranging from the study of a single nerve cell (single neuron research in some cognitive experiments) to social cognition, although social psychology It also studies social cognition, but because of the different research perspectives, it is different from social psychology), can be regarded as the scope of cognitive psychology. However, it should be noted that the distinction between cognitive psychologists and other psychologists should be different from the research question. The research scope of cognitive psychology probably includes, perception, memory, attention, language, thinking, (including logic , Speculation, mathematics, causality, etc.), problem solving, and social cognition (such as mind theory, etc.). To some extent, cognitive neuroscience is included in cognitive psychology, but cognitive neuroscientists ask different questions from other cognitive psychologists: they may want to understand how a cognitive process is Shown in the brain, including the spatial position of the brain (not a one-to-one mapping of a cognitive process and a certain brain area), temporal changes in the brain's active area and/or changes in neuronal dynamics in physiology and electricity , And the white matter connections between different brain regions. So it can be said that cognitive neuroscience wants to understand the mechanism of all cognitive processes by observing the activity of the brain at close range, and other psychologists who only conduct behavioral experiments may temporarily ignore the activity of the brain and develop through behavioral experiments. Theory, and then it is possible to explore whether such a theory can be supported by neuroscience experiments. So I think it can be considered that the problems of cognitive neuroscience and cognitive psychology research are very similar, except that one is from bottom to top, and the other is from top to bottom, digging through the "channel" to study the human brain and cognition. Another point to add is that with the development of cognitive science, more and more people use computational models to study many cognitive problems, such as the currently popular Bayesian model (Bayesian modeling). So modeling is also Cognitive psychology is a very important research method.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 世外哲学社别名“游荡社会”。致力于培养学生的理性思维和尽可能了解秩序美学，以独特视角解读名著与世界，达成精神上的深造和艺术历史上的共鸣。追求柏拉图式的冒险旅程，在一段相对安静的时间里把平常做成极致，以“千字”记录生活片段，产生爱、美、丑、恶的不同，与拥有相同兴趣的人们一起讨论，于是经过漫长的等待，一定会有意想不到的收获。
groups.C_DescriptionE: Philosophy outside the world community alias "The Peripatetic Society". It is devoted to cultivating students' rational thinking and understanding of order aesthetics as much as possible, interpreting masterpieces and the world from a unique perspective, and achieving spiritual further study and resonance in the history of art. The pursuit of Platonic adventure journey, in a relatively quiet period of time to make the ordinary to the extreme, to "1000 words" recording life fragments, produce the difference between love, beauty, ugliness, evil, and people with the same interest to discuss together, so after a long wait, there will be unexpected harvest.

grecord.C_Reflection: In this activity, we watched the philosophical film Dream. Discuss the content of the movie and think about it. The film is only composed of eight dreams, through which he reflects on the modern society and criticizes all kinds of human stupidity, inculpates the old and criticizes the young, and mainly reflects Kurosawa's overall thinking on the world in his late period. The other members and I all found the film very interesting and planned to do research and papers to further learn.

Looking at Schopenhauer's ontology and epistemology is mainly directly following the epistemology of Kant's critical philosophy, as well as a little bit of Platonic philosophy. In the section of "transcendental perceptual theory" in Critique of Pure Reason, Kant believes that sensibility is the sensory ability of the subject, while time and space are the innate intuitive forms of sensibility, and color and smell are the acquired intuitive materials of sensibility. Time is introspective, space is external, and external ultimately belongs to introspective, so time is slightly higher than space. Time gave birth to algebra and space to geometry. Time and space are subjective, not objective. Thing and itself form experience material through sensibility, and knowledge is formed by reason through 12 categories combination and induction from understanding. This benefits everyone.

Read The Wisdom of Life. This is a pamphlet of popular philosophy that can be read by men, women and children alike. But it was full of ideas that Schopenhauer made that seemed rebellious and unprecedented at the time, even though many of them were similar to Buddhism. The "study and freedom of religion" is also a great breakthrough and attempt in the field of philosophy. Community members also conducted research and investigation on this, and summarized Chapter 1. In the process of effective learning, I also realized that philosophy does not exist only in the high-level level of knowledge, sometimes it will appear more frequently in life.

grecord.C_Theme: the influence of Chinese Confucianism on the world
grecord.C_Reflection: We continue to do in-depth research on this topic and discuss it with our partner society, the French Society, on issues such as French philosophers and social environment, or the influence of Chinese Confucianism on the world. These all fit nicely into the problem we're working on right now. And many aspects make all the activities interesting and rich. And the instructor also posted relevant content in the group, so that some difficult questions were solved. This is a great aid to our ability to observe society and to ancient literature.

We watched the documentary "Man and Nature". (It was up to the group members to choose whether to watch or not), and they enjoyed many strange phenomena and natural beauty. At the same time, they also have doubts and reflections on the local culture. Why can people reproduce here? Why does this happen? These seem to be questions that we can study and relate to philosophy. (Perhaps the presence of human beings has changed a lot to anything, harmful or beneficial just an unknown number.)

3/7 During this regular meeting, most of our club members had come this time, so the time for the meeting took was longer than before. Like usual, we firstly did a table topic sessions where all the member participated in. The topic was given by other club members randomly, and most of us had done the presentation over 1 minute, even some of us can talk 2 minutes without any preparation by now. It is evidential that most of us has truly developed our instantaneous presenting skill.

3/21 Today, we had planned to try another session inside our meeting, which is continuous story creating. It is one of the game from the toastmaster which we decided to add in our regular meeting’s routine. The random word generator will create 2 words at random, then the first candidate will use these 2 word to create a story for one minute. After, the second candidate will continue that unfinished story and this goes on and on. This is a really beneficial activity since we can improve our instantaneous presenting skill while enhance our creativity.

4/25. In this meeting, we did another table-topics session, followed by a prepared-speech given by me on how a formal toastmasters meeting works. The table-topics session is normal—we each are given a question on the topic of 'my favorite movie'. In the prepared speech section, I explained to the club members the procedures of a toastmasters meeting so that members can start preparing for our next formal meeting. Moses and David will give a prepared speech; and we also established the roles of grammarian and Ah-counter.

Toast Master’s last activity was held on 6/12. Luckily, we invited an Indonesia Toast Master member to join us. William, who is currently playing a leader position in over 3 Toast Master Clubs. We had an excellent cooperation with William. Due to his profound English skills and experiences, he was selected to take the role of grammarian. 
Firstly, David presents an 8 minutes prepared speech on AI technology, which allowed me to have a elementary understanding on CPU and GPU. Then, Moses, as we have expected, shared a famous work of the avantgarde composer, John Cage. Then, William and us engage in an interesting continue-story-telling about the “Rubbish Professor”. Finally, William introduced us several methods of effective evaluation, including Ah-counting, laugh-counting, and the stage time competition.

All of the members participated in a mini prepared speech. Since we are currently facing the so-called application season, and selecting a fit college list is always the first step. For this reason, we decided to conduct a college research session, where all of us were required to find an interested college and present to the rest what you have researched. groups.C_DescriptionC: 科幻社旨在让社员在对科幻作品的欣赏、学习和讨论的过程中产生思想上的交流与碰撞，从而与同样热爱科幻的伙伴们一同感受科幻文化的魅力。在科幻社中，社员们可以了解到有关科幻常识的科普，包括对科幻的定义与分类、对科幻历史的解读等等。此外，社团的主要活动还包括了许多对专题的研究和讨论。诸如《三体》、《2001太空漫游》等著名的科幻作品都会在本社活动中成为专题研究的项目；我们还将就科幻文化存在在社会中的不同形态（如传媒科幻、硬科幻、软科幻等）作为话题展开讨论。最后，社团中的每位成员都将得到亲身实践的机会，将自己对科幻的热爱和对知识的理解运用到自己的作品中。我们希望每一位社员都能在活动的过程中享受自己所爱，在科幻社中实现自己的梦想和憧憬。
groups.C_DescriptionE: Dream, science, future. Science-Future club aims to enable members to learn during the process of appreciating and discussing science fiction works and to feel the charm of science fiction culture together. In Science-Future club, members can learn knowledge related to science fiction, and discuss on various thought-provoking topics. Famous science fiction works such as "The Three Body Problem" and "2001: A Space Odyssey" will become the main focus of monograph research in the club activities. We will also discuss the different forms of science fiction culture in the society. Finally, every member of the club will have the opportunity to practice in person and apply their learnt knowledge to their own creations, including but not limited to producing short sci-fi clips, fan writings, and even novels. We hope that all members can enjoy things they love during the activities, and eventually realize their dreams and visions.

grecord.C_Reflection: We draw some posters in this activity. Actually, these posters are prepared for the next semester and the guessing game, but we have to prepare for them. First, we determined which science fiction movies we want to make posters for, and we searched for some element in the movie that is identical, but not so usual. At last, we drew together and made some posters about different movies and make a guessing game to find out what poster is for what movies.

This time we wrote the short English science fiction novels by ourselves. This is a program with Tian Lu. Actually, at first Tian Lu want to teach students in Tibet English, so they wanted to provide them some English novels, but they are too hard. Also, they tell us that students want to read science fiction novels, so we decided to write the novels by ourselves. We first learnt how to write short novels, and started discussing what stories can we develop

We tried to evaluate about one episode in the animation “Rick and Morty”. This episode is divided into four stories, and we discussed each of them. It has strong sarcasm in the American Society and we related it to some facts about America. Besides, we watched a little part of it and everyone enjoyed it. We think this animation is definitely one of the best animations in America. Also, we discussed about whether the government should restrict the content in the animations or series.

This time we discussed about the history of science fiction novels. Actually, we first divided into several parts and investigated separately. We divided the whole history into origin, development, prosperous and future. This time we begin from the origin to the development, and will continue to learn about the history of science fiction novels. In my opinion, the origin of the science fiction novels is already in a very high level, and will develop as we are going through the history

This time we continue to talk about the history of science fiction movies. We started from the end of second climax, and talked about the most important science fiction movie in the history of America: Star wars. We talked about the effect of Star Wars on Cold War. Then, we introduced the third climax from Independent Day to Truman‘s world. They are always related to the oldest myths and philosophy. Then we introduced the recent scifi movies including super heroes and Christoffel Norland

groups.C_DescriptionC:
世外商业社（WFLA Business Club）是世界外国语中学Academic类社团，旨在带领想要在商业和经济领域探索的同学系统性地学习商业、经济类知识，参与例如FBLA、NEC等顶尖的高含金量的学术比赛。
同时，我们希望同学通过商业方面的学习，能在实际生活中灵活运用商业知识解决问题，积累真实的经验，更好地规划自己的未来发展方向。
groups.C_DescriptionE:
WFLA Business Club is the Academic association of the World Foreign Language Academy. It aims to lead students who want to explore in the field of Business and economics to systematically learn knowledge and participate in top high-quality Business competitions such as FBLA and NEC.
At the same time, we hope that students can use business knowledge to solve real life problems, accumulate experiences, and better plan their future development direction through studying business.

grecord.C_Reflection: The activity was in a form of a case study, and I was responsible for this part. I hoped I could set an example, and then members could try to do it by themselves. The topic was about blind box economy, and the corporate used in the presentation was PopMart. At first, I spent 2 hours searching for online information and making the slides. I organized the presentation from a pure analysis of the corporate such as its revenue, IP establishment, and its development, to some professional business knowledge, including marketing, sales, and business management. On the day of the presentation, the presentation went smoothly, and every member was highly-involved. Their response and answer really gave me much confidence. The final result was very good. Some of them used phones to take pictures, and others even took down notes. I thought they really learned a lot, and I believe that they will be able to have their own presentation one day.

WBC decided to have a networking with the German club Telescope. I was responsible for communicating with Telescope's president and checking the final tweet. Our project was about the development of Haribo. At first, I talked with Telescope's president about different aspects of Haribo that we were going to introduce. Also, we had to have a labor division, making clear which club should take charge of a specific part. For example, WBC searched the business information about Haribo, like its operation style, corporate structure, and its product. We analyzed the factors that contributed to the success of Haribo. Telescope was responsible for translating it into German and adding some German culture. This first networking made me realize that networking is not as easy as I expect. In this cooperation, both WBC and Telescope should make contributions, not just about an incompatible combination of business knowledge and German culture.

This time my club members and I are preparing for Case study. Some of them showed great passionate to this activity, because they are going to attend the FBLA National competition in February. I was so glad to hear that they are already preparing for it and they learned how to do case study. This time we talk about how to benefit everyone from using marketing program. This is quite tough for them, but my club members really enjoy it, shows. I was so happy that everyone can participate in.

This time my club members and I are preparing for Case study. Some of them showed great passionate to this activity, because they are going to attend the FBLA National competition in February. I was so glad to hear that they are already preparing for it and they learned how to do case study. This time we talk about how to benefit everyone from using marketing program. This is quite tough for them, but my club members really enjoy it, shows. I was so happy that everyone can participate in.

As a Club leading, we have the first meeting during September 22. I was deeply impressed by ice break event. Alicia and I first introduced the FBLA Competition, and other business events like DECA and KWHS. Some of them showed greatly interest on these things. It is clear that our first meeting was very successful.  What's most interesting is that we have provided a lottery for everyone. The top 5 club members can get a blind box. They are really happy. Last time we got second place in the national competitions. But now we are at the starting point again.

groups.C_DescriptionC: 思源社是社会学社团。我们为学校中热爱社会学的同学提供交流平台，一起通过社会调研在更高的平台上发声。
groups.C_DescriptionE: Veritas is a sociology club.We aspire to build a platform for students in school who are enthusiastic about sociology,we can learn sociology together and attend events!

grecord.C_Reflection: A total of 6 offline and 1 online activities have been held during this semester. The first was about introduction to the club members ourselves. The second was an introduction towards sociology as a subject. The 3rd and 4th were respectively preparation for writing of proposal and for presenting the proposal towards the club. The 5th and 6th were both knowledge on research methods in sociology. The last one was based on the research methods in which we tried to discuss how to use the results to provide valid conclusions.

During the first month, Heidi and I has held several online and offline meetings about the activities and aims of our club veritas. We anticipated more members than now, but we managed to adjust with what we have got. Our meetings were mainly held at the start and during mid-term. We focused on recruiting in the first month, when we actively communicated with the last president. Then, we formed a fairly-detailed plot of the things we are going to do in the following semester. However, most of it didn’t go as we wanted because the number of members was too small and lots weren’t practical enough. Still, we managed to adjust while we marched.

3/1
As we planned, this semester we start to sort our recordings collected from last semester and look forward to drawing some interesting conclusions from them. Relied on the interactive video function provided by the Bilibili platform, we decide to make a series video of this kind to summarize the difficulties we could in dealing with family relations. In the past few days, we come up with a detailed script of the video which contains 3 main stems of stories, each having its own endings. Since COVID 19 has delayed our shooting plan, we look forward to carrying it out in June.

3/10
Next step, we want to publish an oral history collection, showing the different stories of our parents or grandparents. Most importantly, I plan to analyze these stories by contrasting different individuals’ situations during the same era. Through these stories, we may even educate the youth these days. The main task these days are to collect oral history written by our volunteers. To avoid privacy and security issues, I ask specifically whether the volunteer agrees to show it in public and whether he/she wants to show it anonymously. Up to now, we have collected 7 essays for 2,000 Chinese characters. I expect there will be more in the future.

grecord.C_Theme: Analyzing oral history and writing article
grecord.C_Reflection:
3/15
By close and distant reading the oral history report these days, some patterns gradually emerge. Most of the oral histories are concerned with several special reforms in the development of PRC. I think it will be very interesting to reveal the relations between macroeconomic objectives and individual circumstances. This topic also related to a thesis I am composing recently, in which I discussed the effect of environment act on villagers in Dabie mountain. Finally, with my club member, we publish an article on WeChat focusing on individuals in the cultural revolution.
