Pantheon学术社聚焦国际顶级社科竞赛，如USAD美国学术十项全能，NEC全美经济挑战赛，FBLA美国未来商业领袖，BPA美国全能商业精英，等国际顶尖竞赛。
我们是一个梦想家的社团，一个实干家的社团，一个拼搏者的社团，2021，让我们向更远的彼方前进！
groups.C_DescriptionE: This is a club of dreams and competence, of stamina and courage, of teams and brilliance. We will travel further, we will see clearer, and we will have reach that impeccable horizon with steps unfaltering, and become the best we can be.

grecord.C_Reflection: I really did spent a lot of quality time reviewing and making up mock tests for our fellow students. For their teams and the composition of their devisions will be largely dependent on the result of this test. And I have to say it has been a fair bit of pressure, it seems that the time was pretty restraining, and the tests, will, the questions I made up, proved to be a fair bit of challenge among the young students. But still, I was delighted to find a few largely exceeded my expectations! They performed so well I doubted if I could do the same had I been in the same shoes, so, some feel down and some are looking up, it sure would be a lot to expect working along these lot!

This session had been largely about acquainting our club members with the nature of USAD questions and all. So I made up a mock version of the tests in hope that this practice would lean the fellow students valuable insights in regard to what the USAD competition is going to test and how far, how precise it would go in the practice. So I was delighted to notice that a large portion of our group demonstrated remarkable skills and rendering in remembering and giving precise investigations upon the issues at hand. I would be delighted to see how well they will perform in the arena.

groups.C_DescriptionC:
我们的宗旨是通过创作英文报纸从新颖的角度、用自己的文笔发掘校园生活以及与校园生活有关的有趣内容，尤其是无人关照的方面，以充实学生们的校园生活体验。
我们社由四个部门组成，分别负责收集写作材料、寻找创新视角、美化语言和管理财务相关事务。
我们的社员在此过程中将得以锻炼多方面的能力，不仅是简单的学术能力，还有沟通、合作、管理以及对未知能力领域的探索等等都将有所提升。
groups.C_DescriptionE:
Here gather the creators of the only English media on this international campus. Using perception, thought and language, we strive to explore our school and the world associated with our education, uncovering the obscure, sharing the intriguing, and inspiring the thoughtful through our publication, the WFLA Bulletin. 
Unlike other publications, Bulletin is completely independent and our operations are entirely student-run. Thus, in addition to the challenging task of creating original articles of native linguistic standard, we also raise our own funds, promote our newspaper and conduct market research. Though smaller in scale, our operations are no less trying than medias operating in the business world.
The culture at Bulletin is one of free, friendly cooperation. There are no fixed schedules or strict hierarchies. We respect every member's opinions and ideas, and do our best to create a comfortable environment for everyone. 
Well, this is us!!! Join us, read our paper or contribute!!!

grecord.C_Reflection: The actual date is June 21st. On this day, I finally completed the layout of our annual journal. Looking at this document, I feel a great sense of achievement. When I took over this club, there was no output from the previous one, but now I have truly started using the club's public account through my own efforts and started posting my own articles. Looking at the collection of articles, I truly feel how meaningful my work during this year has been.

The actual date is June 2nd. On this day, I am preparing to hand over the club to the next class of students and handed over all the organized materials to them. The new president and vice president are very capable people, and I believe the club will definitely thrive in their hands. Our club improves year by year. We discussed about the things that a president of a club should do, and I talked about some of my experiences as leader of the club.

The actual date is April 7th. On this day, we finally finalized the book review for the short story 'a perfect day for bananafish'. We feel a great sense of satisfaction. From the moment we first learned this novel, to the moment we developed a strong interest in it, and finally to the finalization of the book review, it took us several months to gain a deeper understanding of the novel. Finally, we decided to take this book review and publish it on the official account after typesetting.

The actual date is March 24th. We finished editing the book review for the novel "a Rose for Emily". It is a short story published by Faulkner in April 1930. This short story shows us the historical development after the American Civil War through the conflict between different values and the sharp contradiction between the old and the new order. In addition to the tragedy of her personal character, Emily's tragedy also comes from the society, the times and the nation.

The actual date is March 31st. In this CAS meeting, we reviewed the task originated from our academic English class, which was to continue writing the end of the short story "the Story of an Hour". I remembered that when we first started to think of posting this in our WeChat account, we took out the end we wrote, exchanged it with the other's homework, and modified and expanded it. At the end of the activity, we finished writing the ending and prepared to take it to composing.

The designing part was finished, and I went over the whole design. To make it look nicer, I gave a few pieces of advice on the details, including the size and style of the words. After the details were done, we selected photos given by photographer to add into the calendars so that their works can be shown. We also changed some of the wordings so that the readers can better understand what happens in each event through easier wordings.

We decided on what we are going to worked out this semester—calendars. Then we discussed about whom to be responsible for each part. I divided the whole project into four parts. Designing, wording, communicating and advertising. We agreed on setting up deadlines so that the works of each part can be guaranteed to be done by the time we need to start the next section. I also offered the student who was responsible for designing some photos that I thought can fit in the calendar.

First, one of the members shared his experience of observing the stars. He planned to bring his telescope to school this week but since the activity was conducted online, he sent a photo of the telescope to the group chat. He also recommended places that we can use it and the approach to put all the parts together through a video. Then, we discussed about things to sell at Charity. Last year, we made a calendar that has predicted astronomic events and this year we are considering putting new elements in it.

During this session of club meeting, our members participated through zoom online due to the epidemic situation, and discussed about astronautics background with our main lecturer Fred Fang. We talked about the milestones of astronautics (and some aeronautics) events and evaluated why they are so remarkable, including the innovative changes taken to achieve such a high place in astronautics history. We also mentioned some important fundamental equations and design theories in this field, which may enhance the understanding of how exactly do aircrafts function in each situation.

groups.C_DescriptionC: Mapa意为地图，Mapa西语社希望给学习西语或对西语感兴趣的同学们以地图般的向导，既提供语言学习的资源与帮助，又引领大家了解西语及西语国家的文化，从社会、文学、语言学等方面进行介绍与交流，共同探索一门语言背后的世界。
groups.C_DescriptionE: Mapa means “map” in Spanish. The Mapa Spanish Club hopes to be the guiding map for those starting their journey. We not only provide resources and aid for Spanish learning, but also encourage students to know more about the Spanish language itself and the cultures behind it. We cover topics in society, literature, and linguistics, exploring together the magnificent world that emerges with a new language.

grecord.C_Reflection: 12.27 Today our club had the final activity of the semester and we used this opportunity to talk about the New Year in Spain. We learned about Spanish new year traditions such as eating twelve grapes at midnight or gathering in Puerta del Sol. We also talked about Días de los Reyes Magos, the Spanish children's day, when the children receive present from the kings. Finally, the session ended with some remarks on Mapa during the semester and what we hope to achieve in the next.

12.20 Today the Mapa Spanish club celebrates together with a lecture on the Spanish Christmas traditions. We watched videos of christmas lights in Spain and was introduced to El Gordo, the Christmas lottery. We also learned about all the different dishes and sweets that the Spanish usually serve for their Christmas dinner. Then, we listened to some Spanish Christmas carols, Villancicos, which really brought holiday vibes. And finally, we played a taboo game where we guessed the different words and phrases introduced in today's activities. It was a great fun to learn about Christmas in Spain and I wish to celebrate it there in person.

12.13 At today's Spanish club meeting, we delved into the vibrant world of Hispanic pop culture, with a special focus on pop music. We introduced iconic figures such as Shakira, Jennifer Lopez, Daddy Yankee, and Ricky Martin, highlighting their most renowned songs. The meeting came alive with the beats of several music videos that showcased the diversity and infectious rhythm of the Hispanic music scene. The shared experience of exploring these musical gems not only brought us together but also immersed us in the cultural richness of the Hispanic community. It was an exciting session that broadened our understanding and appreciation for the impactful influence of these artists on the global pop music scene.

11.29 Today at the Mapa Spanish club, we discussed yet another language phenomenon of Spanish, the Spanglish language. It is a manner of speech by Spanish-English bilinguals in the United States. Although being a mix of two languages, it demonstrates extreme linguistic diversity and creativity, and is a sign of proficiency in both, rather than neither, languages. We looked at sample vocabulary and sentences, studied a few linguistics terms such as calque and code-switching. We also explored some literature and music of the Hispano/Chicano culture in Spanglish.

11.22 Today we joined again with the Stargazers club to discuss further on the movie Roma, which we had watched last week. We firsted watched two interviews of the viewers and directer of the film, and got to know more about its background and general reception. Then the president of the Stargazers club gave a wonderful speech on the moive. She discussed the themes in the film and what the film meant personally to the director. We learned a lot about Mexican culture and their view on love and marriage.

grecord.C_Theme: lecture2: common fuels and future of bio fuels.
grecord.C_Reflection:
Introduction to Common fuels:

Gasoline: Gasoline is a common liquid fuel commonly used in internal combustion engines, such as cars and motorcycles. It is separated from petroleum during the refining process and is a high energy density fuel suitable for high-speed, efficient engines.

Diesel: Diesel is also a liquid fuel that is widely used in diesel engines, such as trucks, buses, and generators. It has a high energy density, efficient power output and fuel economy.

Natural Gas: Natural gas is a clean fossil fuel, mainly composed of methane. It is used in the automotive and industrial sectors for power generation, heating and fuel supply, reducing greenhouse gas emissions.

Biofuels (Biofuels) : Biofuels are fuels made from organic materials, including biodiesel and ethanol. They are usually produced from raw materials such as vegetable oil, cooking oil, waste, etc., and are environmentally friendly and renewable.

Applications of bioengineering in fuels:

Bioengineering has a wide range of applications in the fuel sector, aiming to reduce dependence on traditional petroleum fuels, reduce greenhouse gas emissions, and drive the development of sustainable energy sources:

Biodiesel: Through bioengineering techniques, biodiesel can be produced using vegetable oils, algae or waste animal and plant oils. This diesel can be used in conventional diesel engines to reduce carbon emissions.

Bioethanol: Bioengineering can be used to produce ethanol, usually by fermentation of crops such as corn or sugar cane. Bioethanol can be blended with gasoline, reducing the need for oil and reducing tailpipe emissions.

Bioengineering can be used to produce biogas, which produces methane gas by breaking down organic waste, such as agricultural residues or municipal waste, by microorganisms.

Algae fuel: Bioengineering research is using algae to produce fuel, which has the advantage of high productivity and low land requirements and is expected to be an important source of sustainable fuel in the future.

Spark plug ignition test:Materials: Model engine, spark plug, wire, battery, switch.
Test procedure: Connect the spark plug to the wire, and then connect the wire to the battery and switch. By opening the switch, the discharge phenomenon of the spark plug can be observed and the ignition process can be simulated.Simple cylinder compression test:Material: Plastic bottle, piston, water, stopper.The experiment: Insert a piston into a plastic bottle, and then inject some water into the bottle. Seal the bottle with a stopper, then compress the bottle with your hands. High school students can observe the effect of pressure changes in the cylinder.Compare combustion experiments of different fuels:
Materials: candles, alcohol lamps, kerosene lamps and other different fuels.

Experimental process: Ignite different fuel sources, observe their combustion properties, such as flame color, temperature, burning speed, etc., and compare the differences between them.Simulated engine cycle test:Materials: Plastic syringe, small container, water.Experimental procedure: Plastic syringes and containers were used to simulate the working cycle of the engine, including the suction, compression, ignition and exhaust stages. Observe the movement of water in different stages.

RC (Remote Control) car is a mini vehicle that is battery powered and can be operated by remote control. They are a popular choice for car enthusiasts and model collectors because they offer a simulated driving experience without having to personally drive a real vehicle. Here are some basics about getting started with RC cars:

Vehicle type: RC vehicles are available in various types, including electric, fuel and turbo. Electric cars are powered by batteries, fuel cars by fuel engines, and turbo cars by compressed air.

Size and scale: RC cars can be miniature, 1/10 scale, 1/8 scale and other different sizes and proportions. Scale represents the size ratio of the RC car to the real car.

Remote control: The remote control is the key tool to operate the RC car, usually including steering wheel, trigger, throttle and brake controls. Some advanced remote controls also have programmable features.

Suspension and tires: The suspension system and tire type of an RC car affect its performance. Off-road vehicles typically have sturdier suspension and large treads that are suitable for uneven terrain.

Team introduction:

Our RC team, named "Eureka", is a team of passionate RC car enthusiasts. Here is a brief introduction to our fleet:

Team name: Eureka RC Team.
Mission: Our mission is to promote and train RC car enthusiasts and to promote the development of RC car technology and racing.
Events: We regularly host RC car races, training sessions and social events to provide members with a diverse RC car experience.
Team members: Our team members come from all ages and backgrounds and share a passion for RC car sport. Whether you are a new or experienced player, we welcome you to join us.
